column1: Application Development Tracker
column45:
Weekly check list

* Work done in the week
* Code walk through of the week
* Test Coverage walk through (TDD)
* SonarQube Metrics
* Work to do in the next week
* Any blockages
* Main branch code should build and pass tests when run locally at any time.

column1: Replicate OpenSearch data from sit01 to dev01
column45:
Originally data in dev01 

* ho_cng - no index mapping
* fc_cng - no index mapping

Replicated this to sit01

* ho_cng - no index mapping
* fc_cng - no index mapping
* ho_cng_final - index mapping
* fc_cng_final - index mapping

Updated mapping data in dev01 

* ho_cng - added index mapping
* fc_cng - added index mapping

Renamed dev01

* no indexes and no data 

For now replicate sit01 to dev01

# Merin - Add index mapping to ho_cng and fc_cng in sit01
# Merin - Re-index to ho_cng and fc_cng in sit01
# Dileep - Replicate sit01 to dev01 
# Dileep - Add manual snapshot on dev01

column1: CNG - SOLR API - System Test - totalPrice is displayed twice in SOLR response when fl=* and wt=json
column45:
FH - select/safe/hfHandler

totalPrice is displayed twice in response when fl=* and wt=json

Case 1: totalPrice = headlineTotalPrice

In this case, totalPrice displayed twice has the same values.

Sample query :

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&fq=ancillaryID:102395&rows=200&wt=json&fl=*|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&fq=ancillaryID:102395&rows=200&wt=json&fl=*]

Case 2 : totalPrice != headlineTotalPrice

In this case totalPrice displayed twice with different values

Sample query :

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&fq=ancillaryID:93495&rows=200&wt=json&fl=*|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&fq=ancillaryID:93495&rows=200&wt=json&fl=*]

*Expected result :* 

totalPrice should be displayed only once

*Actual result :*

totalPrice is displayed twice when fl=* and wt=json



Attached screenshots for reference

column1: CNG - SOLR API - System Test - Facet.field is not working properly for fields having data type as Float, Date and Boolean
column45:
*Issue Observed:*

Facet.field is not working properly for fields having data type as float, date and boolean.

 

float -- field value is not displayed in facet.field response. Ex. hotelLat, hotelLong, totalPrice, hotelStars

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=totalPrice&rows=1|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=totalPrice&rows=1]

 

date -- Date format is not proper in facet.field response. Ex. checkInDate, checkOutDate

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&rows=1&facet.field=checkInDate|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&rows=1&facet.field=checkInDate]

 

boolean -- Returned as 1/0 instead of true/false in facet.field response. Ex. isPackageRateOnly

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=isPackageRateOnly|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=isPackageRateOnly]



*Expected Behavior:*

Facet.field should be working properly for fields having data type as float, date and boolean.

*Actual Behavior:*

Facet.field is not working properly for fields having data type as Float, Date and Boolean

It is working fine in live 

Please find attached screenshot for reference

column1: CNG - SOLR API - System Test - Issues with start and sort for Grouped response
column45:
# *Issue with sort* 

Group values are not fetched in given sort order when group.field and normal sort is for the same field.

Solr requests:

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/carPackages/select/?q=*:*&fq=!categoryCode:M&fq=overallCabin:*&rows=50&echoParams=all&start=2&wt=xml&fl=categoryCode,dropOffDate,pickUpDate,packageDuration&group=true&group.field=dropOffDate&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=packageDuration+desc&group.limit=5&sort=dropOffDate+asc|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/carPackages/select/?q=*:*&fq=!categoryCode:M&fq=overallCabin:*&rows=50&echoParams=all&start=2&wt=xml&fl=categoryCode,dropOffDate,pickUpDate,packageDuration&group=true&group.field=dropOffDate&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=packageDuration+desc&group.limit=5&sort=dropOffDate+asc]

[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=200&echoParams=all&start=0&wt=xml&fl=arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportName_3_I,duration&group=true&group.field=duration&group.ngroups=true&group.limit=5&sort=duration+desc|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=200&echoParams=all&start=0&wt=xml&fl=arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportName_3_I,duration&group=true&group.field=duration&group.ngroups=true&group.limit=5&sort=duration+desc]

Actual result: Normal sort is not considered in fetching groupValues

Expected result: As per live, groupValues should be fetched based on normal sort order when group.field and normal sort is for the same field

# *Issue with start*

When start value is mentioned with group operation, the groupvalues should be fetched based on the given start value. We are getting same response with start=0 and start as other values.

start=0
[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=200&echoParams=all&start=0&wt=xml&fl=duration&group=true&group.field=duration&group.ngroups=true&group.limit=5&sort=duration+desc|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=200&echoParams=all&start=0&wt=xml&fl=duration&group=true&group.field=duration&group.ngroups=true&group.limit=5&sort=duration+desc]

start=2
[https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=200&echoParams=all&start=2&wt=xml&fl=duration&group=true&group.field=duration&group.ngroups=true&group.limit=5&sort=duration+desc|https://vpce-083b431353b4a0fdc-fxbyqwvo.vpce-svc-02464bf2facd36829.eu-west-1.vpce.amazonaws.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=200&echoParams=all&start=2&wt=xml&fl=duration&group=true&group.field=duration&group.ngroups=true&group.limit=5&sort=duration+desc]

Actual result : start value given in request is not considered

Expected result : As per live, groupValues should be fetched w.r.t the start value

column1856:
12/Apr/24 12:48 PM;712020:6f5fdfde-606d-4bd1-89df-dbccee06047c;[~accountid:6398ba693c9bcd36397729e0]  [~accountid:63ad707c082abdd71bb5598d]  The Opensearch behavior for such cases where we are passing the invalidate field name in the query, It neglect / ignore the field rather than throwing error as we have in Solr. 

As you know in existing solr we are using build in Solr APIs to search the index/core. 

We have backword compatible wrapper API build , we are not using the OS API directly for search operations, So the API we build does not have any schema definition with it. So we are relying on the OS for all search operations. 

So we will not be getting errors in case wrong, invalid field is passed in a valid Lucene query for OS search. 

If we need to implement the same in New BW Solr API then they should be Schema aware and to do such check , we need to make additional call to OS to get the latest schema fields or need to have local copies of all fields and need to validate every field before we pass it to OS. 

Which will be unnecessary and time consuming and will hit the overall performance of the API. 

Also can we check whether in current Production Solr we have received such request over past 1 year or so.
column1857:
12/Apr/24 1:24 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:712020:6f5fdfde-606d-4bd1-89df-dbccee06047c] 

So the existing SOLR behaviour where invalid field names are ignored in the (fl) field list but cause errors when used in an operation

Will Change for SOLR b/w to be that they are ignored wherever they appear in the url (in fl or in an operation). Is that correct?

From a business perspective, the queries that are failing today cannot be being used for anything useful and this change in behaviour will not cause problems. It will change what the testers should expect to see though… [~accountid:62e3f2aa4913d0b73489d25a], please bear this in mind.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: Validate dependent components configurations in stack 04 PINT, E2E, DPERF, and PERF environments.
column45:
Even though  sse-mhs and evm-bahem applications are deployed in PINT, E2E, DPERF and PERF environment, application will work fine only when all the dependent components are in sync and details are updated in the CAPTWO database.  All the details are motioned below.


# CMH Queue - below details should be update in the captwo database. 
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.queueManager
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.channelName
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.userName
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.defaultRejectQueue
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.destination
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.recoveryMode
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.hostName
## cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.port
# Xdist service - below details should update in the captwo database. 
## cap2.bahem.cs.xdist.base.url
## cap2.bahem.cs.xdist.port
## cap2.bahem.cs.xdist.contextPath
## cap2.bahem.cs.xdist.sendTimeout
## cap2.bahem.cs.xdist.receiveTimeout
# Open Search 
## cap2.bahem.cs.opensearch.base.url
## cap2.bahem.cs.opensearch.host
## com.ba.captwo.framework.config.evm.pwd.opensearch
## com.ba.captwo.framework.config.evm.sid.opensearch

Also, we need to remove the redis dependency.

* com.ba.captwo.framework.config.cache.redis.sentinel.hosts
* com.ba.captwo.framework.config.cache.redis.sentinel.ports
* com.ba.captwo.framework.config.cache.redis.masternames
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.readTimeout
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.timeToLive.general.minutes
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.timeToLiveDataSourceRefresh.general.minutes
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.timeToLive.workload.minutes
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.retryLimit
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.redisHostIndicator
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.database
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.workload.heatmap.interval
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.workload.forecast.interval
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.workload.days
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.workload.hours
* cap2.evm.bahem.redis.primary.password





We need track this in PINT ,E2E DPERF and PERF

column1: CNG - SOLR API - Need internal consumers to be configured in System testing environment(CAPDEV866)
column45:
To perform system integration testing(FE) for b/w Solr API [CNG-79], we need below internal consumers in capdev866 environment to be pointed to AWS CNG Solr. 

•	ALP / Flight summary (Partial date range)
•	ALP / Flight summary (Realtime Package rate not successful)
•	MMB
•	Holiday Finder
•	Holiday Finder modal

Instead we connect on-prem DP regression to either on-prem captwov2 prelive (prelive is migrating in AWS to a separate account BA-PRP-IT-captwov2st4) or e2e. column1905: CNG - Burst (CAPTWO), Batch (CAPTWO) - Services - DEV AWS Stack 04 Migration (PINT, E2E, DPERF and PERF)

column1: Need CMH queue details for all environments - since it is required for application configurations.
column45:
CMH queue is dependent component which connecting to captwo applications (sse-mhs and evm-bahem). 

Based on the environments CMH queue details will vary. While configuring the application in different environments relavant entries need to be enter in the CAPTWO_CONFIG table.

This Jira is used track the get the CMH queue details for all environments.  

*Below Information required All enviroment(DEV/SIT, Regression, Perfomannce, Pre-Live, Live) :*
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.queueManager
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.channelName
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.userName
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.defaultRejectQueue
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.destination
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.recoveryMode
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.hostName
cap2.evm.bahem.msg.sample.port

column1: Need read access to CAPTWO Database Config Table-  to check the captwo configs   sync with application Configs  required read access to NID
column45:
The CAPTWO services (see-mhs and evm-bahem) are using captwo config table to connect the application with dependant  components such as CMH queue, xdist services, Open search etc. To validate the captwo application sync with given configs we recheck details in the captwo configs for this relevant team members required read only access to data base. 



This Jira is to track steps to follow to get the read only access to NID

column1: AWS CAPTWO Account Connectivity to AWS OpenSearch Account - Dev Environment
column45:
Step 1: Create the ingestion role in ECP DEV Account  

Step 2:  Create assumed role in STACK04 account attach a trust policy to it.  

Step 3: In ECP DEV account must grant permissions to assume the ingestion role that created in the STACK04 account.

NOTE: 
Cross account connectivity guideline given below:

[Working with Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline integrations - Amazon OpenSearch Service|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/opensearch-service/latest/developerguide/configure-client.html#configure-client-cross-account]

column1: Define new names for GitHub repositories following BA standards
column45:
We need to define a set of standard names for the GitHub repositories, which should follow BA standard naming conventions.


Link for BA standard naming convention can be found here:

[GitHub - Confluence (atlassian.net)|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GIT/overview] > [Repository naming convention - GitHub - Confluence (atlassian.net)|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GIT/pages/930782309/Repository+naming+convention]

* for questions re standards: 

"Nicholas Lee" <[nick.1.lee@iaggbs.com|mailto:nick.1.lee@iaggbs.com]>; "Petter Franzen" - Architect  <[petter.franzen@iaggbs.com|mailto:petter.franzen@iaggbs.com]> - Software Engineer

column1: Synk Requirements for the AHP/CNG Project
column45:
Call held about Synk requirements on Wed 28-Feb-24.

[~accountid:63d7c609f1475ad42c576e3c] advised Docker Images are fine to use (also being used by the Nexus programme) and that that Snyk licenses will start to be available in approximately 2-3 weeks.  Dimitirs to get back to the project once it is available.

Any vulnerabilities identified will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis (keeping in mind that this is a backwards compatible API).

If you would like to start doing index mapping going forward then lets have a quick call about where this responsibility lies and how long this will take. We'll need a separate jira for this. I have raised:

[https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-1379|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-1379|smart-link]

column1: (3844) - Exclusion of prices from API response where travel date/time is in the past
column45:
*Background:* 

Housekeeping requirements (CNG-73) stipulate that cache data can be deleted approximately 48hrs after the travel start date has passed. However, this creates a window where data can exist in our cache for past travel. As customers could not reproduce these prices from a live search, under no circumstance should they be returned by API to consumers either.

*Requirement:*

I want to exclude prices from API responses where the travel dates are prior to the current date/time so that users only receive pricing for products with a future travel date/time 

*AC1: API response excludes old prices based on timestamp filtering*
*Given* the cache has a value that date/time stamps when travel is due to start 
*When* a request is made to retrieve prices from either b/w Solr or BAHPC API
*Then* the responses should only include prices with travel start date/time in the future
*And* prices with timestamps earlier than the current date/time are excluded from the response

*Key Info*

Travel start date should be based on flight departure time.

For Ground only, it is believed a default Hotel check in or Car pick up time of noon is stored in the cache, regardless of what the accurate reception/depot opening hours are (see CNG-999). If this is correct, BAH accept that any API requests made between noon and midnight, will exclude all of that day’s ground only pricing.

26/Feb/24 9:49 AM;712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31;"For Ground only, it is believed a default Hotel check in or Car pick up time of noon is stored in the cache, regardless of what the accurate reception/depot closing time is. If this is correct, BAH accept that any API requests made after noon but before midnight, will exclude all of that day’s ground only pricing.”
We should think about an easy way to make this “noon" assumption parametric so that in case of different agreement (maybe it’d be 18:00 or 2 hours from now…) we can quickly adapt the cache system.

_Hi Paolo, I’ve been working on the CNG DNS at_ [+_https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CNG/pages/1249312801/Domain+Names+WIP_+|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fiagtech.atlassian.net%2Fwiki%2Fspaces%2FCNG%2Fpages%2F1249312801%2FDomain%2BNames%2BWIP&data=05%7C02%7Cshafiqul.islam%40iaggbs.com%7Cdfefcc1f835c450f13e708dc47644dbb%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C638463743823863919%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=rZ6ZGUTQ%2BIiLvkGZJRx7%2FpvlAfP5LdLz%2FIOXhv1n3%2FQ%3D&reserved=0]

_Few points_

* _Should we host the route 53 DNS for dev/uat/prelive/prod in one account (presumably prod), or do we want each account to manage its own set of subdomains?_
* _Do we need or want different subdomains for each of the accounts?_

_Maybe we could have a meeting later or early next week to go through it_

 

_Thanks, Nigel_

column1856:
22/Feb/24 1:24 PM;5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883;Hi All, we (Bharath,Narayana,Rukaya,DIleep) had a call with Gary on 21/02/2024. Gary is not OK to use shell script in platform due to security concerns.

It was agree infra team will look at options to enable cross account access and application team will look at using SDK for authentication.As of 21/02/2024 the approach is not finalized.
column1857:
27/Feb/24 8:52 AM;62441749f6a26900695c6645;Hi [~accountid:5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883] 

We can also use a profile-based method instead of Shell Script to create AWS credentials for authenticating the OpenSearch Pipeline. As of now , this is the best approach.

Please find the below details for more information

*1.Generate temporary credentials Based on AWS Profile by using AWS SDK :*

 *Prerequisite* : 

# create .aws folder in root directory and place  inside helper , certificate and private key
# Create config file inside .aws and place the below example command

*Implementation :*

Created IAM Roles Anywhere that provides a way to get temporary credentials for a workload or process that runs outside of AWS. 
To configure 'credential_proces' that Specifies an external command that the SDK  runs on behalf to generate and retrieve authentication credentials to use.
The setting specifies the name of a program that the SDK will invoke. When the SDK invokes the process, it waits for the process to write JSON data. The custom provider must return information in a specific format. That information contains the credentials that the SDK can use to authenticate.

 Ex: 
credential_process = aws_signing_helper credential-process \
      --certificate /path/to/certificate \
      --private-key /path/to/private-key \
      --trust-anchor-arn arn:aws:rolesanywhere:region:account:trust-anchor/TA_ID \
      --profile-arn arn:aws:rolesanywhere:region:account:profile/PROFILE_ID \
      --role-arn arn:aws:iam::account:role/role-name-with-path

*2.Generate AWS Signature and ignest data into the Pipeline*

When transferring data into the pipeline, it is essential to authenticate the Ingestion pipeline API by utilizing the AWS signature, which is generated using the AWS credentials mentioned earlier.

We provided information to [~accountid:6160078dc5388b0069a3f269] in the email and are now waiting for confirmation.

*Note* : The Version 1 team is focusing on implementing cross-account access, which is considered a more secure approach compared to the above approach .
column1858:
27/Feb/24 5:51 PM;6160078dc5388b0069a3f269;Do you really need to create a profile ? When I did this kind of thing in an AWS lambda (calling a downstream service that needed to be signed), I used the STS credentials which the lambda had in its runtime environment (granted internally as a consequence of the lambda having an execution role).  I don’t know whether that also works when you are running on an EC2, but I imagine it would?

I can send you details of what I did in the microservice, if you need them
column1859: 27/Feb/24 5:53 PM;6160078dc5388b0069a3f269;Also not sure that getting the SDK to “run an external command” is a good idea? Sounds similar to the shell script option.
column1860:
28/Feb/24 8:45 AM;62441749f6a26900695c6645;Hi [~accountid:6160078dc5388b0069a3f269] I agree with you.

Currently, relying on a profile-based approach is not a permanent or ideal solution for generating temporary credentials.
The version1 team is developing a solution for cross-account access. If successful, we will use a cross-account approach to generate temporary credentials.

*For Role based approach:*

As you said, role based approach also possible to create temporary credentials.
Basically, Applications that run on an Amazon EC2 instance must include AWS credentials in the AWS API requests.If use an IAM role to manage temporary credentials for applications that run on an Amazon EC2 instance. The role supplies temporary permissions that applications can use when they make calls to other AWS resources. 

I will check with version1 team about  role based approach and will update here.

stack04 cloud and test end to end connectivity from cross account.Owners - CNG Application Team

Pre-requisite for point 3
Connectivity to be established between stack04 and CNG ECP account.Owners - CNG Infra and DCETeam

4.Stubbing/logging to be taken care as per current CAPTWO framework.Owner - CNG Application Team/Gary.

column1: All new CNG scheduled jobs running on bhprd13 server should write to the DPSTATS Autocore-runs report
column45:
This isn’t a new requirement and it’s something that Nigel has discussed with TCS several times, but there isn’t a Jira for it.

* All current scheduled jobs running on the bhprd13 server write entries to the DPSTATS Autocore-runs report ([https://dpstats.baplc.com/|https://dpstats.baplc.com/])
* This is a daily log (csv) which has entries for +each run+ of every job
* The amount of data written can vary between jobs depending on what’s available
* All new CNG scheduled jobs running on bhprd13 server should write data to this report eg CMT reference data update & housekeeping jobs (TCS to confirm full list of jobs)
* The minimum data that should be logged is the following: job name, host, statusmsg, status, start & end times, logfile path (TCS to confirm this is possible)
* The reporting for all current jobs should be unaffected by the CNG changes

Jon

column1860:
22/Feb/24 10:27 AM;712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31;This issue rose more questions and we have to investigate all of them.
The main one is WHY we need multiple envs on a single AWS account?
 More considerations and details on the discussion will follow.
column1861:
27/Feb/24 1:19 PM;712020:6f5fdfde-606d-4bd1-89df-dbccee06047c;As per our discussion , the Secrete entries for parameter will have Env Name in its name. 

The detailed approach is explained in LLD section [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CNG/pages/1095210856/SOLR+API#Environment-Variables|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CNG/pages/1095210856/SOLR+API#Environment-Variables|smart-link] . 

Infra team needs to define Environment Variable in system.
column1862:
27/Feb/24 1:46 PM;712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31;In the Solr API LLD it’s still indicated that the ENV is postfixed to the variable name, while we agreed that it should be prefixed in a hierarchical name structure.
We have to decide the full structure of the ENV Names.
I propose to use the same definition as in : [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CNG/pages/1101582486/AWS+Resource+Naming+Standards+In+Progress|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CNG/pages/1101582486/AWS+Resource+Naming+Standards+In+Progress|smart-link]  ( [<env>]-<domains>-<applicationname>-<servicename>-<operationname> ) 
Maybe simplified in a form like : <env>_<application>_<varname>
column1863:
28/Feb/24 8:41 AM;712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31;[~accountid:712020:66ee9123-af4a-4ff3-a3a7-34daaa7047b3] : can we consider the Secret Manager as created and ready in the ECP account?
So we can close this ticket and keep the discussion about accounts and envs in a different track.
column1864:
28/Feb/24 10:08 AM;712020:66ee9123-af4a-4ff3-a3a7-34daaa7047b3;Hi [~accountid:712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31] : Secret manager is created in ECP account for storing OpenSearch username and password. Currently its created as below

!image-20240228-100131.png|width=477,height=143!

Shall I change this to /solr/<env-prefix>/opensearch/username and /solr/<env-prefix>/opensearch/password. In parameter store values are created as below:

!image-20240228-100645.png|width=655,height=179!
column1865:
28/Feb/24 10:16 AM;712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31;Hi[~accountid:712020:66ee9123-af4a-4ff3-a3a7-34daaa7047b3], 
we can think about a “default" management mechanism, where if the env is not provided or the value is not found, then the value is searched for a “path" with out it.
For example:

ecp-dev01-opensearch_master_user

has a “default" value with name like:

ecp-opensearch_master_user

This would make it more simple to “migrate" parameters from one env to an other, specialy between different accounts.


The parameter in Parameters Store would follow the same rule:

/solr/<env-prefix>/carPaclages/alias

would have the default value in a param named:

/solr/carPaclages/alias



What do you think about it?

column1856:
16/Jan/24 5:53 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;afaik the  batch controller evm-bahem fails at startup if it cannot connect to the redis endpoint.

column1: CNG - Batch Controller (CAPTWO)- Impacted Component -Service - Code development of CAPTWO batch controller which connect to AWS ECP Open Search
column45:
This task is to make changes in the code to enable connection to OpenSearch from CAPTWO Code. Please find below points can access from CAPTWO code once complete this TASK.

# Connect to OpenSearch from CAPTWO batch controller. 
# Enable individual document entry and bulk data entry to OpenSearch through openserch REST API client calls
# Also enable the request compression using the captwo frameworks jars. 
# Add custom error handling in captwo batch code in case if application not able push the data into OpenSearch. 
# Batch controller to have the error monitoring for the data being sent to OpenSearch, so if OpenSearch is unavailable due to connectivity or any reason then Batch Controller can catch that error and triggers an alert to be actioned by support team.

column1: East-West firewalls for CAPTWO Stack 4 DCE to CNG/AHP Project  and to DP DCE
column45:
Hi, for CAPTWOv2 stack4 AWS dev account, we need to set up some “East-West” firewalls

[@liam.rae-mclauchlan@version1.com|mailto:liam.rae-mclauchlan@version1.com], can you please give the IP range (the private IP range allocated by IPAM) for OpenSearch in bahahpecpdev-dev account .  I think the IP can change as it will be a cluster and AWS can automatically add/remove instances eg for automatic blue-green patch deployment, so we should tell the whole possible range. Port will be HTTPS 443.

 (see email attached for full details)

*The IP range (the private IP range allocated by IPAM) for OpenSearch in all ECP accounts will need to be provided to DCE once they have been created.*

column1: firewall rules for ECP account  bahahpecpdev-dev (025700222871)
column45:
We will need firewall rules to connect from:

* on-prem sublive captwov2 stack 4 batch controller to ECP opensearch via GCC HTTPS  (and possibly later when captwov2 migrates to AWS, East-West firewall)
* laptops to (kibana) dashboard HTTPS
* cap solr redirection to SOLR backward compatible microservice HTTPS
* housekeeping lambda (assuming that is still a lambda) reachback to BAHCMT database Oracle SQLNet port 1521.  And also … “East-West” firewall since we now have dev and regression/prelive AWS BAHCMT databases.
* competitor analysis connecting to BAH SqlServer database - “East-West” firewall once BAH AWS migration gets done.

column1: HTTP Request Compression in CAPTWO
column45:
From Gary (see also attached): It is *just a beta release* (the minimum I can give you, as I'm really busy with the "DCE avalanche" and everything else) - e.g. I haven't yet looked at whether it "plays nicely" with logging/stubbing etc. 

 

I need you to plug it into your service, and see if it does what you need. Then I will polish it up (taking on board any issues you discover when using it).

 

To use it, plug version1.0.57.1-SNAPSHOT of "captwo-http-client-comms"  into your service (you will have to do a framework upgrade on your service first) - see [https://cap-wiki.baplc.com/twiki/bin/view/CAPTWO/HOWTOUpgradeFrameworkVersionNumbers#3_Using_Jenkins_to_run_the_pomul|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcap-wiki.baplc.com%2Ftwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FCAPTWO%2FHOWTOUpgradeFrameworkVersionNumbers%233_Using_Jenkins_to_run_the_pomul&data=05%7C01%7Cshafiqul.islam%40iaggbs.com%7C7ee7dba82bae4fd0d18e08dbf666b618%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C638374694860500761%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=k57U1%2BINBe02vqC%2BUZ6bY4WGtYv8pNSmx%2B4QwMWYGdY%3D&reserved=0] 

 

Then add this line to the relevant CAPTWORestServiceClient call in your code (i.e. the one whose request you want to compress);

 

withRequestCompression(true)

 

The sooner you can try this, the sooner I can fix any problems that come up 🙂

 

I've turned off the compression threshold (so all requests will be compressed, even if they are tiny). We can talk about a "sensible" limit later, or even make it configurable...

 

So the ball is now in your court, I won't touch this any further until you come back.

 

Don't hesitate to contact me if you have any problems with any of this 🙂

column1856:
08/Jan/24 2:45 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Note we will need to add overrides to the burst and batch controller messages to connect to the right opensearch endpoint, in a similar way that we already have for xdist endpoint and redis endpoint.  See Burst controller LLD 4.2.4  gives sample message format:

{noformat}{ 
"startdate": "20-04-2019", 
"returndate": "25-04-2019", 
"noOfAdults": 2, 
"noOfChilds": 1, 
"noOfInfants": 0, 
             "childAge": “7”, 
"OjCityCode": "CITY_LON_GB", 
"ancillaryId": 6774114, 
"depAirport": "JFK", 
"DestAirport": "LHR", 
"airline": "BA", 
"market": "GB", 
"cabinCode": "M", 
"modBy": "dptest9", 
"priority": "4", 
"frequency": "24", 
"createDate": "18-04-2019", 
             "bah_cmt_service_provider": "bhdevdb05.baplc.com:1521:bhdev_cache_appsvr_testuid_test_pwd"", 
             "bah_xdist_service_provider": "http://bhdev15.baplc.com:10080/badp/services/spm/spm", 
             "bah_redis_service_provider": "http://aws.ws.baplc.com:10080/bahcng/services/redis/" 
} {noformat}

The work for this Jira will make {{bah_redis_service_provider}} redundant but there will need to be another override something like {{bah_opensearch_service_provider}}

The reason for this is that captwo is a scarce resource, there is not one captwo instance for every DP stack - eg there is only one e2e captwo stack4, and we need to be able to connect that seamlessly and simultaneously to any CNG test (we expect at least 3 CNG AWS test environments) or regression environment.
column1857:
12/Feb/24 10:14 AM;5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883;Hi Nigel

Currently the code is implemented to have overrides for xdist only.There is no override supported for Redis and CMT currently.As you said, we can discard redis and implement the code changes needed for OpenSearch override.

Please can you confirm why we need CMT data source override as we are already connected to the environment we want.
column1858:
12/Feb/24 10:49 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Hi, there should have been, this was in the Burst controller LLD 4.2.4.  We need to have override for CMT so that the captwo e2e/prelive/pint can connect to the required BAHCMT schema. You might be connected as DPTEST01_BAHCMT_USER now, but later we may want to connect - at the same time - to DPTEST02_BAHCMT_USER, DPTEST03_BAHCMT_USER, and any other up to DPTEST30_BAHCMT_USER.  Obviously not all 30 at the same time but BAH will allocate DP test environments as they see fit and they will change over time so at a particular moment any of the 30 DPTESTxx_BAHCMT schemas could be in use.

I believe team have defined a few tomcat context.xml jdbc connection pools for the currently in-use on-prem BAHCMT schemas, but we discussed that the naming was not ideal since it was using names like jdbc/bahcmt_first whereas they need to be predictable like for instance jdbc/dptestXX_bahcmt for DPTESTxx_BAHCMT_USER ;  jdbc/dpregX_bahcmt for DPREGx_BAHCMT_USERA ;  jdbc/dppl_bahcmt for DPPL_BAHCMT_USERA
column1859:
23/Feb/24 9:50 AM;5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883;Hi Nigel,

We will name the Data source appropriately as DPTEST01_BAHCMT_USER,DPTEST02_BAHCMT_USER in the context file..but we are not able to override it dynamically by passing the datasource details in the header.Since this Jira is for connecting to OS we will close this Jira and track CMT overrides seperately.(CNG-1206)

Note - We are able to override opensearch environments  dynamically.Please let me know if you are OK.
column1860: 23/Feb/24 10:00 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Sure, track this separately, but we need to be able to override the bahcmt connection one way or another. If you are defining all the datasources in the tomcat context.xml, I presume the override will specify which of the tomcat jdbc connections to use, named consistently.

12/Feb/24 6:01 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;As per [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-1137|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-1137|smart-link] 

* *carGroupDescription Issue:*  In elastic search *carGroupDescription*  populated with spaces. As per this Jira we need to avoid the spaces that is populated at the start of the data.

Checking on the details in solr live *carGroupDescription and  carGroupDescriptionShort* populated initially with space followed by data. Sample live solr query is given below
[ba.com/solr/cars/select/?q=*:*&wt=json&indent=on|https://ba.com/solr/cars/select/?q=*:*&wt=json&indent=on]


!image-20240212-055445.png|width=1600,height=900!

Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] could you please confirm whether we required to avoid spaces from *carGroupDescription* and *carGroupDescriptionShort* or we do continue on the same way as is in existing *live SOLR. ?*
column1857:
12/Feb/24 10:43 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - from looking at both FC and CO in live:

For FC - {{carGroupDescription}}  has a leading space  and {{carGroupDescriptionShort}} does not

For CO - both have leading spaces

The ideal solution is to save all these values in the index without the spaces, so that when we develop the full API all these inconsistencies are resolved.

I had a look in the SIT env ([https://kibana.dev.int.bahcache.com:5601/|https://kibana.dev.int.bahcache.com:5601/]) and all these values looked to be in the index without spaces. Has a changed for this actually been developed all ready and you are asking me if this is the correct thing to do?

This does give us a (low?) risk in the b/w SOLR interface if we start sending thru the values w/o spaces. If the users of this data (primarily BA) are removing leading spaces using trim functions or just taking the data as-is then this would continue to work fine. If they are looking at the text from position 2 then this would result in something like '{{eugeot 208 or similar}}' coming out. Do you think the use of a trim function be more likely?

We would have the opportunity to look at this during test to see if any obvious issues were present on the [ba.com|http://ba.com] pages. We just need to agree if this is a reasonable risk to take.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: CNG - SOLR - Lambda - ELK Data Issue
column45:
As we discussed on the Solr API Clarifications call happen on 04-Oct-2023, team need a confirmation on ELK Data issues mentioned in the excel sheet.

*NOTE:* Observation tracker is available on share path :[Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]

*Observations*

* *Market GB populated twice:*
"GB " is from older data.Previously we had GB with space as we were fetching the value of market from DB which had a space so we had a jira to remove this space.Currently we are not getting this space.You can check Jira CNG-468 for your reference.Ancillary id:32753 HO in kibana has space after GB but it is from older data, further this ancillary id is not available in ancillary table.Further we will also monitor the pricing document.
* *Date format issue :* Timestamp format incorrectly showing. for example sorted response for hotelCheckInDate and hotelCheckOutDate
"hotelCheckInDate" : "2023-05-23T12:00:00ZZ",
* *carGroupDescription Issue:*  In elastic search *carGroupDescription*  populated with spaces.  

*Examples*

* *MARKET Issue:* [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=market+desc&wt=json&fq=-market:GB&indent=on&rows=1000&facet=true&facet.field=market|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=market+desc&wt=json&fq=-market:GB&indent=on&rows=1000&facet=true&facet.field=market]
* *Date format issue :*
** [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=hotelCheckOutDate+asc&wt=json&indent=on&rows=1000|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=hotelCheckOutDate+asc&wt=json&indent=on&rows=1000]
** [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=hotelCheckOutDate+asc&wt=json&indent=on&rows=1000|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=hotelCheckOutDate+asc&wt=json&indent=on&rows=1000]
** [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/bahpricefeed/?q=*:*&fq=pricePerPersonPerNight:84.0&wt=xml|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/bahpricefeed/?q=*:*&fq=pricePerPersonPerNight:84.0&wt=xml]
* *carGroupDescription Issue:*  
** [ba.com/solr/cars/select/?q=*:*&wt=json&indent=on|https://ba.com/solr/cars/select/?q=*:*&wt=json&indent=on]

*Confirmation Required on Below Item*

* Market Issue: From batch application we removed the spaces for the market. Team do the mointoring for this older records we can observe the spaces. But newer ones are populating correctly. Team doing Mointoring on this data  Please confirm do we need to any other action item on this?
* Date format   :  Z in checkindate  is from older data.Previously we had Z in depDateString,arrDateString,checkin and checkout date fields which was removed as part of CNG-623.Ancillary id: 27540 HO in kibana has Z in checkin and checkout date but this anc id is not available in ancillary table. 

*Jons Comments on above teams queries.*

* If out of date data is causing you problems, then perhaps you should remove these older records from the index?ie remove any records before a specific timestamp date.

*Action Items*

* Market GB populated twice issue and Date format issue Team doing Monitoring on this data. 
* carGroupDescription Issue:  Team needs to do the development to incorporate changes in captwo evm-bahem code.

column1: CNG - SOLR - Lambda - Clarification on Special characters allowed in SOLR queries.
column45:
As we discussed on the Solr API Clarifications call happen on 04-Oct-2023, team need a confirmation on special characters allowed in SOLR requests.

As per solr documentation Solr gives the following characters special meaning when they appear in a query:

+ - && || ! ( ) { } [ ] ^ " ~ * ? : /

& (,-,_ ," most of them are supporting but required if any others special charaters are required to support in CNG? 

Please Confirm on this.

*NOTE:* Observation tracker is available on share path :[Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]

15/Nov/23 1:29 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] [~accountid:5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883] 

This is a question about how SOLR works and should form part of the analysis Bharath is doing on current SOLR functionality.

B/W SOLR only needs to support special characters / combinations of special chars that are being sent through in queries today.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: CNG - SOLR - Lambda - Not functionality (Operators  !, - ) build for field values.
column45:
As we discussed on the Solr API Clarifications call happen on 04-Oct-2023 team shared an excel sheet [Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]  which contains teams' observations on unit testing, 
Team could see that in group. Query field value we can use the Not (! , -) Operator but that is not working CNG it should be needed to do as development.

Once confirmed on this team can take it as enhancement and progress on the analysis then development.

*NOTE :*  Not functionality (Operators! -) will work for field values. Observation tracker is available on share path :[Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]

column1: CNG - SOLR - Lambda - Clarification on Behavior Confirmation of current Live Solr requests
column45:
As we discussed on the Solr API Clarifications call happen on 04-Oct-2023, team requires a clarification on Solr live behaviors

# Team required confirmation on limit values on below items.
## Is filtering with 'q' operation applicable for all the fields?
## What are fields that we are using on facets ?
### In Group operation
#### what are the fields we can use ?
#### Need confirmation fields for group.query and group.field and group.sort. ?
#### How the values will be displayes within group.?
####  Ngroups count is coming same as the rows count passed in the CNG Solr request url. As per live Solr API response, nGroups should return total no. of unique Group values for the matched conditions in cache. How will be ngroups will works. same way mentioned above?
### Facet operation whether it required to support hotelDesc and Deeplink since value coming as more than 256 characters.
## Confirmation needed if queries having ?locale=en GB to be supported, if required then it is an enhancement required.
## Is wildcard operation supported for all fields in all propositions?
## do we need to preserve any order to display the results when group and facet requested in the url?
# Once confirmed on above team needs to do work on this wherever it is applicable in CNG.

*NOTE:* Observation tracker is available on share path :[Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]



*Observations*

* 'q' operation: supported to which fields. 
* Facet fields : Live solr queries giving errors some time. But same queries work fine after sometimes. That means fields on facet behaving inconsistent in live solr. example   Hotel description Field in xml behaving differently. 
* Group Operation :
*# Confirmation on group operation for hotelImage,hoteldesceiptions, ImageUrl some times work in Live sometime throws error. What are the fields use in group operation.
*# group.query OR and Range operation : This behavour confirmation required. how it is behaving in existing Live.
*# Within group how the data displayed is the start value is considered ?
* Wildcard support : 
** How it is handled in live is it supported for all the fields in the all propositions. ?
** Currently in Live supporting for Multiple fields. But in CNG supporting for single field.
* locale=en GB : Is this supported?
[4.do|http://4.do] we need to preserve any order to display the results when when group and facet requested in the url?

*Examples*

# q operation :[https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/carPackages/select/?q=pricePP:330|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/carPackages/select/?q=pricePP:330]"
# [Facet fields : |https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDescription&facet.limit=100&rows=1000]
## [https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDescription&facet.limit=100&rows=1000|https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDescription&facet.limit=100&rows=1000]
## Hotel description Field in xml behaving differently. 
### [ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDescription&facet.limit=100&rows=1000|https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDescription&facet.limit=100&rows=1000]
!image-20231117-065922.png|width=1099,height=840!
### [ba.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=10&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDesc&facet.limit=20&wt=xml|https://ba.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&rows=10&facet=true&facet.field=hotelDesc&facet.limit=20&wt=xml]
!image-20231117-065802.png|width=926,height=563!
# Group Operation : 
## Image Url :[https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=hotelImage&group.query=hotelImage:%22http://capdev575.uk.ba.com/travel/fx/public/en_gb/badp/static/external/AE-A08-7015757/med_61_AE-A08-7015757-B1511-RoomType_DLXKING1.jpeg%22&group.limit=50&group.sort=hotelID+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=hotelImage&group.query=hotelImage:%22http://capdev575.uk.ba.com/travel/fx/public/en_gb/badp/static/external/AE-A08-7015757/med_61_AE-A08-7015757-B1511-RoomType_DLXKING1.jpeg%22&group.limit=50&group.sort=hotelID+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage]
## group operation pick from Start value  : [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=hotelStarRating&group.query=hotelStarRating:4&group.limit=50&group.sort=hotelName+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage,hotelName,hotelStarRating|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=hotelStarRating&group.query=hotelStarRating:4&group.limit=50&group.sort=hotelName+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage,hotelName,hotelStarRating]
## group.query : 
[https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/safe/?q=*:*&wt=xml&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=deepLink&group.query=deepLink:|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/safe/?q=*:*&wt=xml&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=deepLink&group.query=deepLink:]""[http://capdev575.uk.ba.com/travel/fx/public/en_gb?saleOption=CO&depCountry=GB&eId=111081&carGOTo=LON&depCountry=GB&pickUpTimeHr=09&totalPrice=281&pickUpGO=12/12/23&chcar=0&dropOffTimeHr=09&ojDd=AIR_LHR_GB&dropOffGO=16/12/23&adcar=0&dropOffTimeMin=00&infcar=0&currencyCode=GBP&carGOAgeConfirm=true&pickUpTimeMin=00&ojGw=LON|http://capdev575.uk.ba.com/travel/fx/public/en_gb?saleOption=CO&depCountry=GB&eId=111081&carGOTo=LON&depCountry=GB&pickUpTimeHr=09&totalPrice=281&pickUpGO=12/12/23&chcar=0&dropOffTimeHr=09&ojDd=AIR_LHR_GB&dropOffGO=16/12/23&adcar=0&dropOffTimeMin=00&infcar=0&currencyCode=GBP&carGOAgeConfirm=true&pickUpTimeMin=00&ojGw=LON]""&group.limit=100&group.sort=market+desc&fl=destinationAirportCode,ancillaryID,market,deepLink&rows=12&echoParams=ALL"
 [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=tripAdvisorGIFURL&group.query=tripAdvisorGIFURL:|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=tripAdvisorGIFURL&group.query=tripAdvisorGIFURL:]""[http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/img/cdsi/img2/ratings/traveler/5.0-11576-4.png|http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/img/cdsi/img2/ratings/traveler/5.0-11576-4.png]""&group.limit=50&group.sort=totalRoundedPrice+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=totalPrice,totalRoundedPrice,tripAdvisorGIFURL
## group.ngroups
CNG Solr:
[http://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/carPackages/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.field=carGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP|http://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/carPackages/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.field=carGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP] asc&group.limit=20&rows=5
Live : 
[https://ba.com/solr/carPackages/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.field=carGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&group.limit=20&rows=5|https://ba.com/solr/carPackages/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.field=carGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&group.limit=20&rows=5]

*Action Items.*

* Team needs to develop the code for supports Mutiple wildcards if it available in solr request.
* Facet.Field - in ba.com  Hotel description Field in xml behaving incorrect for FH and HO. Need a confirmation.
* group operation for hotelImage,hoteldesceiptions, ImageUrl sometimes work in Live sometime throws error. But to work as excepted team need to change text size also need a confirmation on the size that needs to be support in CNG,
* group.ngroups behavior needs to analyze in [ba.com|http://ba.com] if required any changes need to be incorporate in CNG.
* Team needs to recheck the Scenarios listed in the confluence page. [DHSI-265 - CNG - Investigate Solr BAH package Queries - Discover and Inspire - Confluence (atlassian.net)|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DI/pages/1116705664/DHSI-265+-+CNG+-+Investigate+Solr+BAH+package+Queries]

column1856:
15/Nov/23 1:27 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] [~accountid:5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883] ,

From what I can see this all appears to be questions about how SOLR works and should form part of the analysis Bharath is doing on current SOLR functionality.

I wouldn't expect anyone to facet or group on some of the fields you mentioned (hotelDesc, Deeplink, hotelImage, hoteldesceiptions, ImageUrl ) because it doesn't achieve anything useful. Log file analysis on what's being sent through in group.field and facet.field would prove this

Likewise if grouping or faceting on fields over 256 chars in length doesn't work, this is only an issue if you can see this happening in the live logs.

If the same SOLR queries fail sometimes and work at other times...this indicates to me that the functionality is supported (otherwise it would never work) but SOLR is having problems sometimes (heavy load?). In this situation I think CNG should support this functionality for these queries as well unless there's a good reason not to. 

Thanks,

Jon

06/Nov/23 1:04 PM;712020:8d138859-363b-4f27-8fcb-f73aeda9b37f;[~accountid:5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883] 
As discussed in the meeting, looked at the current code and few observations below


1.  Code is looking more procedural than following OO Principles.

2.  Code in lots of places either using unnecessary logic or misleading constructs.

3.  Unit tests needs to be improved to cover multiple failure conditions

each search has been scheduled, searched or indexed then a dynamic report is created containing the following information:

Date
Search Request ID
Ancillary ID
Airline Brand
Market
Proposition
Origin
Destination
OJ City code
Pax Mix
Priority
Frequency
Time of each search is scheduled for
Time of when each search response has been received
Time of when each search is indexed
Duration between search response received and index time
And time is to be HH:MM:SS
And the report is to indicate if the search and index has been successful or has failed

column1: CNG-70 - AC.5 - Load Capacity Forecast v Actual Report
column45:
As part of [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|smart-link] in this Jira discuss about fifth *Acceptance criteria.* 
Please find the details below.

*AC.5 - Load Capacity Forecast v Actual Report*

*Given* individual searches are burst and scheduled at midnight

*When* the schedule has prioritised and ordered the searches

*Then* a daily report is created and contains the following information:

* Todays date
* Total Flight and Hotel searches - Forecasted
* Total Flight and car searches - Forecasted
* Total Hotel only searches - Forecasted
* Total Car only searches - Forecasted
* Total overall searches - Forecast (Four propositions combined)
* Schedule start time i.e. 00:00 (Actual)
* Forecasted end time of daily schedule  i.e. 22:30
* Forecast time capacity used percentage i.e. forecast percentage of the day to be used between 00:00 to 23.59  _(based on 22:30 and the calculation shown below e.g. 93.75%)_

*And* once the schedule has completed, the report the following 'actual' information

* Total Flight and Hotel searches - Actual
* Total Flight and car searches - Actual
* Total Hotel only searches - Actual
* Total Car only searches - Actual
* Total overall searches - Actual
* Actual end time of daily schedule  i.e. 23:30
* Actual time capacity used percentage i.e. forecast percentage of the day to be used between 00:00 to 23.59  _(based on 22:30 and the calculation shown below e.g. 97.92%)_

*And* the date information to be stored for 365 days e.g. logs 30/04/2019 and will be removed on 30/04/2020

*And* all times to be shown as HH:MM

*And* all percentages to be shown to 2 decimal places

column1: CNG-70 - AC.4 - Last indexed price greater than 48 hours Report
column45:
As part of [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|smart-link] in this Jira discuss about forth *Acceptance criteria.* 
Please find the details below.

*AC.4 - Last indexed price greater than 48 hours Report*

*Given* the schedule is susceptible to planned or unplanned delays

*When* any indexed prices have not been refreshed within 48 hours or more,

*And* where the lead times or travel dates are 330 days or less

*Then* a daily report is produced containing the following information:

* Date of range of Report
* Search request ID
* Ancillary ID
* Airline
* Proposition
* Market
* Origin
* Destination
* OJ city code
* Duration
* Frequency
* Travel dates
* Lead times
* Pax mix
* Cabin
* Date and Time last indexed

*And* the report is to be emailed at 9am every day to a shared BAH distribution list

*And* the report is to show impacted searches ranging from previous report to current report i.e.  9am the previous day to 9am on the current day

*And* BAH can manage the shared email distribution list

*And* both the duration price last indexed and lead time duration are configurable i.e. 48 hours and 330 days can be amended

column1: CNG-70 - AC.3 - xDist CPU Report
column45:
As part of [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|smart-link] in this Jira discuss about third *Acceptance criteria.* 
Please find the details below.

*AC.3 - xDist CPU Report*

*Given* individual searches will be scheduled and searched via xDist

*When* search results are starting to be returned

*Then* a dynamic report of the xdist CPU usage is created

*And* the report is updated after every 15 minutes

*And* the results are shown as a graph showing each servers activity 

*And* previous days reports are retained and stored

column1: CNG-70 - AC.2 - Destination
column45:
As part of [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|smart-link] in this Jira discuss about second *Acceptance criteria.* 
Please find the details below.

*AC.2 - Destination*

*Given* DBS Support need to evaluate errors for specific destinations

*When* search responses have failed for any reason e.g. supplier availability error

*Then* a dynamic report is created showing the aggregated count of failures by destinations, which can be broken down by -suppliers and the- failure reasons counts

e.g.

* New York 1000
** -Pegstour 200-
*** No availability 100
*** XML is not valid 100

*And* -Suppliers and- failure reasons are aggregated to show their total overall counts

*And* each count is supported by a percentage figure

*And* Destination-, Supplier- and failure reason aggregated counts only are comparable with last 7 days

*And* previous days reports are stored and retained e.g. 00:00-23.59 01/01/2018 of each report 

*And* to be refreshed every 15 minutes

column1: CNG-70 - AC.1 - Schedule, Search & Indexing Report
column45:
As part of [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-70|smart-link] in this Jira discuss about first *Acceptance criteria.* 
Please find the details below.

*AC.1 - Schedule, Search & Indexing Report*

*Given* DBS Support need to analyse system performance

*When* each search has been scheduled, searched or indexed

*Then* a dynamic report is created containing the following information:

* Date
* Search Request ID
* Ancillary ID
* Airline Brand
* Market
* Proposition
* Origin
* Destination
* OJ City code
* Pax Mix
* Priority
* Frequency
* Time of each search is scheduled for
* Time of when each search response has been received
* Time of when each search is indexed
* Duration between search response received and index time

*And* time is to be HH:MM:SS

*And* the report is to indicate if the search and index has been successful or has failed

*And* the report to show a summary of the following:

* Total scheduled searches
* Percentage of progress through the schedule
* Total searches complete
* Total successful searches
* Percentage successful searches out of total searches
* Total failed searches
* Percentage failed searches out of total searches
* Total Indexed searches
* Total successful Indexes
* Percentage successful Indexes
* Total failed Indexes
* Percentage failed indexes
* Estimated completion time of schedule
* Estimated completion time of Index

*And* each of the above to be comparable with last 7 days e.g. 22/11/18 - 50,000; 21/11/18 - 45,000

*And* previous days reports are stored and retained e.g. 00:00-23.59 01/01/2018 of each report

*And* to be refreshed every 15 minutes

column1: CNG - Agree Commercial Requirements and approach for IB interstitial page
column45:
In design discussions for IB CNG deeplinks, the following was discussed / proposed:

* IB CNG deeplinks should display an interstitial page, so customers are confident action is being taken
* IB exploitation hasn’t been agreed yet, but could either be from the IB site itself (eg Holiday Finder equivalent or landing pages) or from another location (email, 3rd party sites)
* IB could choose to display their interstitial page for deeplinks direct from [iberia.com|http://iberia.com] but this option wouldn’t exist for deeplinks from elsewhere
* We should create an IB version of the interstitial page that the BA landing page can display
* This page should include the wording recently added to the IB interstitial for legal reasons about being transferred to BA Holidays 
* This would be the default interstitial page shown for IB deeplinks
* An additional parameter could be added to the deeplink urls (by Iberia) allowing Iberia to override this interstitial page with their own if / when they choose
* The IB logic on the BA landing page would need to check for this param before deciding if our version of the IB interstitial page should be displayed or suppressed
* Getting confirmation of what is reqd on our version of the IB interstitial could take some time
* Design approach for IB deeplinks can be completed in advance of confirming reqs for CNG version of IB interstitial page.
* We need to get commercial agreement to this overall design approach

Jon

column1856:
18/Oct/23 4:24 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I spoke to John Price, Martin Brine & Katy Flood about this today:

* All agreed that we should display an interstitial of some form for IB deeplinks
* John wasn’t sure if we’d ever link a customer directly from an email into search results, but we do link customers from 3rd party sites in this manner for BA
* They understood why the design approach was being recommended
* The main concern from John was whether this would complicate things in terms of  1) introducing complexity into CNG project, 2) getting IB involvement / agreement to contents of the interstitial, 3) having to co-ordinate technical changes with IB
* 1) [~accountid:62e3f2ca0b4bf7ad924bb2c6] - this will need TCS to consider and flag is this is an issue
* For 3) I explained that we won’t be reliant on IB making any changes at specific times because if the additional param is not present, we display the CNG interstitial by default
* 2) I’ve recommended that rather than opening up ‘requirements gathering’ with IB that we simply clone an existing interstitial. 
* John said he’s probably not the stakeholder to agree reqs for the IB interstitial and that should probably be Suzanna (Martinez Jiminez?), Jonathan Smart, Katy Flood within BAH
* He also said that there are 2 IB interstitials - the main one we see when transferring customers from [Iberia.com|http://Ibria.com] to [viajes.iberia.com|http://viajes.iberia.com] after search form submission but there’s also a different one as part of the existing IB deeplinks process (an IB page)
* The current IB deeplink interstitial looks quite different and Suzanna & John are  in discussion with IB to get changes made to this…it does not have the legal wording added to the main interstitial
* I’ve said that we can do an approximate clone of either of these 2 interstitials, but we’d need Commercial to confirm which one to use. If its the current IB deeplink interstitial, then we would need them to confirm if the design was actually going to be changed & when.

Jon

# Ensure lambda SGs are only open to ingress from API Gateway and egress to Elasticsearch.

column1: CNG-Commercial Analysis -POC Dependency
column45:
*Overview*

The CNG application will store the cached pricing in OpenSearch. Commercial Analysis team needs the data to be extracted from OpenSearch for their reporting. The scheduled report will fetch the data from OpenSearch and load it into MS SQL Server database which is owned by CA team currently in AWS. This service delivers a generic solution allowing the Commercial analysis team to query to CNG data using queries setup on the CA team’s SQL as and when required.

*Dependencies*

*Database Details*

* *Description*: We need detailed information about the target database, including schema and table structures.
* *Owner*: _Database Team_
* *Action Items*:

* Provide target database details, including schema and table names.
* Confirm the database is hosted on Amazon RDS or in EC2 .

*Connectivity*

* *Description*: Establish connectivity to the target table for POC purposes.
* *Owner*: _Infrastructure Team_
* *Action Items*:

* Ensure proper network configurations and security group settings are in place for connectivity between our Spring boot application locally and the Amazon RDS instance. Or EC2 where target DB is present.

*Sample Test Tables*

* *Description*: Creation of sample test tables in the database for the POC.
* *Owner*: _Database Team_
* *Action Items*:

* Create sample tables testing purposes.

*Data Indexing*

* *Description*: Need to index considerable data in one of the OpenSearch indexes.
* *Owner*: _Dev Team_
* *Action Items*:

* Collaborate with the team that has access to AWS OpenSearch to ensure sufficient data is indexed for the POC.

*Bulk Insert CSV*

* *Description*: Execute bulk insert operations from both Java applications and SQL scripts.
* *Owner*: _Database Team_,
* *Action Items*:

* Obtain permission to perform bulk insert operations.
* Determine the method for bulk insert (e.g., using AWS SDK for Java, SQL scripts).

*Stored Procedure Calls from Java*

* *Description*: Implement and test stored procedure calls from a Java application.
* *Owner*: _Development Team_
* *Action Items*:

* Develop and test the Java code to call stored procedures in the SQL database.
* To chk commit and rollback operations.

*Script and Stored Procedure Permissions*

* *Description*: Require permissions to write, test, and execute scripts and stored procedures on the SQL server.
* *Owner*: _Database team_
* *Action Items*:

* Confirm permissions and possibly provide elevated access for the POC duration.
* Are we allowed to store the data in file temporarily? (we should not have any security issue ?)

*File Storage for Bulk CSV Upload*

* *Description*: Identify a storage solution accessible by the SQL database for storing CSV files for bulk upload.
* *Owner*: _Infrastructure Team_
* *Action Items*:

* Determine a suitable file storage solution (e.g., Amazon S3) and configure it for access by the SQL database.

column1: CNG - SOLR - Lambda - Clarification on min/max/default limit values used in SOLR queries.
column45:
As we discussed on the Solr API Clarifications call happen on 04-Oct-2023, below items needs to be actioned as part of min/max/default limit values used in SOLR queries.

# Team required confirmation on limit values on below items.
## facet.limit  
## group.limit
## fl
## size
# Once confirmed on above team needs to do work on this wherever it is applicable in CNG.

*NOTE:* Observation tracker is available on share path :[Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]



*Observations*

* Below items needs to know the min/max/default values for below items
*# facet.limit:  On the live solr code analysis team not able see any limit values specified in any of the config's files. (in [ba.com|http://ba.com] we could see more than 200000000 and less than 300000000 are fetching.)
*# group.limit:  On the live solr code analysis team not able see any limit values specified in any of the config's files. (in [ba.com|http://ba.com] we could see more than 200000000 and less than 300000000 are fetching.)
*# group.limit
*# fl(fl=* in safe gives only the default fields mentioned in LLD are returned)
*  The details as per the configuration in live solr code updated in Min Max Values tab on the [Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true] sheet.

*Examples*

These are questions about how SOLR works and should form part of the analysis Bharath is doing on current SOLR functionality.

I expect the default / max / min limits/ -1 behaviour for faceting and grouping are explained in Apache documentation and / or various discussion forums.

It's worth remembering that regardless of what the SOLR application limits are, the number of facets or groups that are returned will be driven by the data available and normally be a manageable number.

Jon

column1: CNG - SOLR - Lambda - Clarification on Data mapping of double to int conversion.
column45:
As we discussed on the Solr API Clarifications call happen on 04-Oct-2023, below items needs to be actioned as part of data mapping conversions.

# Team required confirmation on double to int rounding strategy to follow in CNG to sync the data similar like LIVE solr.
# Once rounding strategy confirmed team needs to do work on the field value translations wherever it is applicable in CNG. 

*NOTE:* Observation tracker is available on share path :[Solr-API-Clarifications (version 1).xlsb.xlsx (sharepoint.com)|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B91612A15-1DDE-4AD7-8490-416B80D1DEAA%7D&file=Solr-API-Clarifications%20(version%201).xlsb.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]
*Observations* 

# *RANGE Operation:* Getting success response with totalRoundedPrice range as float values in CNG. Getting error in Live for same scenario. Reason is Expected totalRoundedPrice range in int (as per live) This issue will face to all the converted fields which are converted to double from int.
# *Group Value Display:* In Group value(<str name="groupValue">3037.0</str>) for example totalPrice value is shown in decimal format instead of int for both xml and json. But in Live same field type is int. this will affect to all int to double converted fields.
# *group.query Display Values:* will display values if we give search data value in decimal point and group value is displayed as decimal. But live all are displaying as integer values.
# *fl :* totalPrice also returned in fl for totalRoundedPrice and vice versa in normal queries and group queries. As part of data mapping, we newly included in solr API totalRoundedPrice since this field is not available in ELK cache but required in Solr responses. So we added totalRoundedPrice newly and totalPrice value to totalRoundedPrice field as per the data mapping discussion.
# *Safe Handler:* totalRoundedPrice is also returned for safe which should not be returned for default response. As part of data mapping, we newly included in solr API totalRoundedPrice since this field is not available in ELK cache but required in Solr responses. So we added totalRoundedPrice newly and totalPrice value to totalRoundedPrice field as per the data mapping discussion.
# *group.query OR and Range operation :* This behavour confirmation required.
# *SORT :* Sort values are affecting for all the converted fields.

*Examples:* 

|[Range Operation : |https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fq=-totalRoundedPrice:%5b1623.0%20TO%201700.0%5d&rows=100]
[https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fq=-totalRoundedPrice:[1623.0 TO 1700.0]&rows=100|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fq=-totalRoundedPrice:%5b1623.0%20TO%201700.0%5d&rows=100]|
|Group Value Display : [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/select/?q=*:*&fq=totalPrice:495&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalPrice&group.limit=20&rows=30|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/select/?q=*:*&fq=totalPrice:495&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalPrice&group.limit=20&rows=30]|
|Group.query : 
# [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalRoundedPrice&group.query=totalRoundedPrice:99&group.limit=50&group.sort=numberOfNights+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage,hotelName,hotelStarRating,isAirportHotel,market,numberOfNights,roundedHotelStarRating,totalPrice,totalRoundedPrice|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalRoundedPrice&group.query=totalRoundedPrice:99&group.limit=50&group.sort=numberOfNights+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage,hotelName,hotelStarRating,isAirportHotel,market,numberOfNights,roundedHotelStarRating,totalPrice,totalRoundedPrice]
# [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fl=totalPrice|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fl=totalPrice]
# [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalRoundedPrice&group.query=totalRoundedPrice:99&group.limit=50&group.sort=numberOfNights+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage,hotelName,hotelStarRating,isAirportHotel,market,numberOfNights,roundedHotelStarRating,totalPrice,totalRoundedPrice|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalRoundedPrice&group.query=totalRoundedPrice:99&group.limit=50&group.sort=numberOfNights+asc&rows=50&echoParams=ALL&start=2&wt=xml&fl=hotelID,hotelCityCode,hotelImage,hotelName,hotelStarRating,isAirportHotel,market,numberOfNights,roundedHotelStarRating,totalPrice,totalRoundedPrice]|
|Safe Handler : [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/safe/?q=*:*&wt=xml&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalPrice&group.query=totalPrice:100.0&group.limit=100&group.sort=destinationCityName+desc&fl=ancillaryID,totalPrice,destinationCityName&rows=12&echoParams=ALL|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/safe/?q=*:*&wt=xml&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=totalPrice&group.query=totalPrice:100.0&group.limit=100&group.sort=destinationCityName+desc&fl=ancillaryID,totalPrice,destinationCityName&rows=12&echoParams=ALL]|
|SORT : 
ASC 
# [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=numberOfNights+asc&wt=json&fq=-numberOfNights:26&indent=on&rows=1000&facet=true&facet.field=numberOfNights&facet.limit=50|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=numberOfNights+asc&wt=json&fq=-numberOfNights:26&indent=on&rows=1000&facet=true&facet.field=numberOfNights&facet.limit=50]
DEC
# [https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=numberOfNights+desc&wt=json&fq=-numberOfNights:26&indent=on&rows=1000&facet=true&facet.field=numberOfNights|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&sort=numberOfNights+desc&wt=json&fq=-numberOfNights:26&indent=on&rows=1000&facet=true&facet.field=numberOfNights]|

*Confirmation required.*

* Data mapping changes of int to double have some different behavior in CNG Solr. We observe changes are affected to all data mapping fields which are converted from int to double or float in all package handlers. How we need to proceed on? Could you please confirm?
** Some samples fields are given below.
*** totalPrice
*** pricePerPersonPerNight 
* +*For the points 4,5,6*+ 
** *Jons Comment on above confirmations.*
*** 4 and 5 are related to not having field totalRoundedPrice but generating it from the SOLR response.
Is the issue here that you are treating totalPrice and totalRoundedPrice as though they are the same field? Rather than 2 fields that have their value mapped from the same ELK location. We should be able to output one without the other and only return the expected fields for safe handler.
Need to compare where in the logical sequence the totalRoundedPrice field is created vs where the field list to return is being checked.
** *Action Items* 
*** Team needs incorporate the changes to handle this on SOLR API. 
* +*For the points 1,2,3,7*+ 
** *Jons Comment on above confirmations.*
*** As a general thought process for b/w SOLR, we should be starting from what the live SOLR queries look like and how they work, rather than how things are setup in ELK. 
Because there are differences in the ELK / SOLR field names and formats, I'm assuming that you have logic to convert between the two.  This logic would need to be used for translating field names and values from the inbound query into ELK format and then again for converting ELK response into SOLR field names and formats. Is this how things are working? We should not be running queries against ELK using SOLR field names or data formats because that will cause problems.
For the range operation in live, the correct query would be [https://www.britishairways.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fq=-totalRoundedPrice:[1623%20TO%201700]&rows=100|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fq=-totalRoundedPrice:[1623%20TO%201700]&rows=100]
because it's an integer value
This is the format of query that will hit CNG and the format that we will need to handle. Is this type of query failing in dev because you are just passing the integer value from the SOLR query without allowing for the format difference? The same problem is probably affecting 1,2,3,7 
** *Action Items* 
*** As per the call happen on 04-Oct-2023, we need to round/truncate the double data type values. Based on the confirmation team proceed on development

|*Field name*|*CNG Value*|*Solr live value*|*Excepted Output Value Excepted*|*Todo Task in Solr*|
|totalPrice|89900.0|89900|89900|Request & Response value translation once confirmed on Action Items|
|pricePerPersonPerNight|8990.0|8990|8990|Request & Response value translation once confirmed on Action Items|
