column1: Difference in SOLR response between Live and Dev when the resultset is empty
column45:
When a solr query is incorrectly formatted or missing any logical operators , the current live system returning an empty response where as in Dev AWS system, getting a message “SOLR Execution :null”  Noticed the same for both xml and json response types.

*Dev Request:*
[https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG AND currencyCode:GBP AND pickUpDate:"2023-06-12T12:00:00Z" |https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG%20AND%20currencyCode:GBP%20AND%20pickUpDate:%222023-06-12T12:00:00Z%22%20carDuration:1&sort=dailyPrice%20asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2][*carDuration*|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG%20AND%20currencyCode:GBP%20AND%20pickUpDate:%222023-06-12T12:00:00Z%22%20carDuration:1&sort=dailyPrice%20asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2][:1&sort=dailyPrice asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG%20AND%20currencyCode:GBP%20AND%20pickUpDate:%222023-06-12T12:00:00Z%22%20carDuration:1&sort=dailyPrice%20asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2]

Response:
SOLR Execution :null

*Live Request:*
[https://ba.com/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG AND currencyCode:GBP AND pickUpDate:"2023-06-12T12:00:00Z" |https://ba.com/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG%20AND%20currencyCode:GBP%20AND%20pickUpDate:%222023-06-12T12:00:00Z%22%20carDuration:1&sort=dailyPrice%20asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2][*carDuration*|https://ba.com/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG%20AND%20currencyCode:GBP%20AND%20pickUpDate:%222023-06-12T12:00:00Z%22%20carDuration:1&sort=dailyPrice%20asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2][:1&sort=dailyPrice asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2|https://ba.com/solr/cars/select?q=destinationAirportCode:PRG%20AND%20currencyCode:GBP%20AND%20pickUpDate:%222023-06-12T12:00:00Z%22%20carDuration:1&sort=dailyPrice%20asc&group=true&group.field=carGroupDescription&group.limit=1&rows=2]

Response:
<response>
<lst name="responseHeader">
<int name="status">0</int>
<int name="QTime">1</int>
</lst>
<lst name="grouped">
<lst name="carGroupDescription">
<int name="matches">0</int>
<arr name="groups"/>
</lst>
</lst>
</response>

“AND” is missing before carDuration in the above requests

Thanks,

Surya

column1859:
18/Jul/23 8:44 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417] - that’s good. The no availability response returns a json style response, so that doesn’t have the same issue as the invalid request scenario.

One other general thing that I’ve noticed is that the SOLr b/w response are all preceeded with ‘*SOLR Execution :*’ which isn’t present in today’s live SOLr responses. Is this valid JSON structure…shouldn’t this be removed?

 Jon
column1860:
18/Jul/23 8:45 AM;712020:8d138859-363b-4f27-8fcb-f73aeda9b37f;Hi[~accountid:6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417] 

In addition to what Jon mentioned below, some times the string “Execution :" displayed before the actual response as well  for both json and xml.  May be coming from some debug statement added to the response string.  Please have a look.

Example url: https://[g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=fr_CA&fq=duration:5&fq=departureCityCode:YTO&fq=destAirportCode:LON&fq=marketCode:*CA*&group=true&group.field=destAirportCode&group.main=true&q=*&rows=1&sort=totalPrice+asc&wt=json|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=fr_CA&fq=duration:5&fq=departureCityCode:YTO&fq=destAirportCode:LON&fq=marketCode:*CA*&group=true&group.field=destAirportCode&group.main=true&q=*&rows=1&sort=totalPrice+asc&wt=json]

Thanks,

Surya
column1861:
18/Jul/23 12:19 PM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;[~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] [~accountid:712020:8d138859-363b-4f27-8fcb-f73aeda9b37f] 

‘*SOLR Execution :*’ this is getting printed along with response, just to ensure we are getting the valid response or not. 

In case of any invalid query being passed,  return from CNG solr is {{Execution :null}} in System testing environment.

These 2 additional loggers will be removed when we move to UAT environment. Also in case of any invalid query, current live solr redirects to home page. [https://www.britishairways.com/travel/home/public/en_gb/|https://www.britishairways.com/travel/home/public/en_gb/] 

When we do the actual redirection on existing environment, this redirection will be done in case when we “Execution: null” response is returned from Solr API lambda.

Hope this clears the query. Please let me know if in case of any further clarifications required.
column1862: 18/Jul/23 1:48 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Ok that makes sense to me -thanks. Jon
column1863: 03/Jan/24 2:20 PM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;This was a bug in a previous architecture.  Any new bugs identified will be resolved during the next planned phase of testing and therefore this Jira will be closed.
column1864: 03/Jan/24 4:31 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Sulafa - I've discussed this with Shaf. There's no bug here as such, but we should test that once the debug is removed in UAT that everything works as expected. Can you please include this in your testing. Thanks - Jon
column1866:
09/Apr/24 10:57 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f2aa4913d0b73489d25a] - you need to be a bit careful with the test urls here. From what I’ve seen AND in the url is only used when supplying multiple values +with the q parameter+. When multiple fq parameters are supplied in the url, they are separated by & not AND. If multiple values need to be checked for one fq parameter this is normally done with OR. 

Looking at the HO example

Your url doesn’t work in live

[https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fl=*|https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fl=*] AND fq=-tripAdvisorRating:4.5 AND fq=!isAirportHotel:N&group=true AND group.main=false AND group.field=resortName AND facet=true AND facet.field=resortName AND group.limit=100&rows=20&wt=json

But the following does

[https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fl=*&fq=-tripAdvisorRating:4.5&fq=!isAirportHotel:N&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=resortName&facet=true&facet.field=resortName&group.limit=100&rows=20&wt=json|https://ba.com/solr/mmbHotels/select/?q=*:*&fl=*&fq=-tripAdvisorRating:4.5&fq=!isAirportHotel:N&group=true&group.main=false&group.field=resortName&facet=true&facet.field=resortName&group.limit=100&rows=20&wt=json]



Similar adjustments to the FH also result in a response from live (though it happens to be empty)

[https://ba.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&wt=json&indent=on&fl=market,arrivalAirport,arrivalDate,departureAirport,destinationCityName,departureCityCode,pricePP,duration&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR OR LGW)&fq=arrAirportCode_1_O:(BCN OR DOH)&fq=boardBasis:(breakfast OR only)&fq=depDate:[2024-04-08T00:00:00.000Z TO 2025-01-30T00:00:00.000Z]&rows=1000|https://ba.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=*:*&wt=json&indent=on&fl=market,arrivalAirport,arrivalDate,departureAirport,destinationCityName,departureCityCode,pricePP,duration&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR%20OR%20LGW)&fq=arrAirportCode_1_O:(BCN%20OR%20DOH)&fq=boardBasis:(breakfast%20OR%20only)&fq=depDate:%5B2024-04-08T00:00:00.000Z%20TO%202025-01-30T00:00:00.000Z%5D&rows=1000]

Jon
column1867: 09/Apr/24 10:59 AM;62e3f2aa4913d0b73489d25a;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] , Yes i know it should be separted by & not AND, but the test is to test invalid queries, and see the results/response returned and compare it to live, this is the subject of the test/Jira. this wat the reporter of this Jira was testing. thanks

column1: BAHolidays - (3844) Additional Holiday Pricing (CNG) - R3XX Release Slot Request
column45:
The BAH “Ancillaries Pricing Cache” (APC) application is a system which caches availability and pricing information for BA Holidays packages and ground products, making the information available to a variety of client applications.​



*Business benefit:* To develop a new package pricing and availability near real time cache with a threefold increase in capacity, store additional data and access mechanisms for existing and new internal and external consumers.

*Business Impact of not in requested release:* The business will not be able to realise the benefits to the new cache until a later date.

*Absolutely deadline date:* 31-Aug-23

*Type of Change:* Revenue generating

column1: TARGET: BAHolidays - (3844) Additional Holiday Pricing (CNG) - R392 Release Slot Request
column45:
** Placeholder for CRs

The BAH “Ancillaries Pricing Cache” (APC) application is a system which caches availability and pricing information for BA Holidays packages and ground products, making the information available to a variety of client applications.​

 

*Business benefit:* To develop a new package pricing and availability near real time cache with a threefold increase in capacity, store additional data and access mechanisms for existing and new internal and external consumers.

*Business Impact of not in requested release:* The business will not be able to realise the benefits to the new cache until a later date.

column1: CNG - All API- Message Queue - ST - Unable to process any Search requests as Queue full - UAT environment
column45:
Been unable to Burst and Batch search requests as there are issues with the queue being full. Jon picked this up from the batch controller logs: 2023-07-04 09:32:01,333 [http-bio-0.0.0.0-18080-exec-18] WARN  com.ba.captwo.sse.mhs.coreservice.retrieveeligiblerecords.EligibleRowsFinder [txId=tx-04-201-9fe6d022-1b28-46b1-9baa-d1c16f5af387|client=CNG|entryService=(GET)/sse-mhs/rs/v1/processsearchcriterias|callingService=] [] [TYPE+WARN|code=SSE_MHS_9003|desc=QUEUE_IS_FULL(NO SPACE IN QUEUE FOR NEW RECORDS)|lineNo=0]

Please can this be looked into as this is stopping me from testing Jiras.

column1856: 04/Jul/23 10:57 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;If possible, I’d like to understand the cause of this in case it highlights a logical gap in when requests should be deleted from the queue. Jon
column1857:
05/Jul/23 6:11 PM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;Currently records moving to queue batch also picking the records from queue. Could you please check and let us know. 

We are configured buffer size for queue as 1000 in UAT database. Yesterday more than 1000 records are in BURST_COMPLETED status in UAT database for all 4 propositions.  We will monitor this issue from our end. In case any issues if you noticing let us know.
column1858:
13/Jul/23 11:29 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;[~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - the 1000 limit is the total size of the queue isn’t, rather than a total limit on the number of searches that can be submitted each day. If all the searches are cleared off the queue by the next time the job runs, 1000 more can be moved onto the queue. If items are still on the queue, then the number of searches that can be moved onto the queue in the next cycle is reduced by the same amount ie it cannot exceed 1000. That’s correct isn’t it?

Thanks,

Jon
column1859:
17/Jul/23 3:49 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Merin,

I still don’t think that the environment is working correctly although I can’t be 100% sure

* There are some searches that are never getting processed REQ_STATUS is null 
* The number of searches getting pulled each time by the burst controller is relatively low (limit is 1000 but I’m seeing low numbers eg 24 being pulled each time)

I’m wondering if the queue is mostly blocked again meaning only a fraction of additional searches can be taken each time. 

*Are you able to run a quick extract of the data currently in the MQ and send it to me? I can then see if the ancillary ids are problem ones or not.*

Thanks,

Jon
column1860: 28/Jul/23 3:27 PM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] , [~accountid:6365c865f7ad721e78509db6] , where you able to get an extract of the data in MQ?
column1861: 01/Aug/23 9:58 AM;557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1;Just added an example here where search requests are not being processed, FH-10375 in the UAT environment. This was created on 27th June with a start exec date of 17th Jul and an end exec date of 24th Aug. Priority is 0 with a frequency of 120. The status is showing NULL. So this has never been Batched or Burst (checked an AncillaryID in Kibana and nothing showing for the last 90 Days). This isn’t a one off either.
column1862:
02/Aug/23 3:58 PM;62e3f1d13780798663d11cff;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] / [~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1] 

We are working on the Jira. We will share you the details shortly.

Thanks

Amreen Fathima.
column1863:
02/Aug/23 6:14 PM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;We are attaching the UAT queue messages with this JIRA.

[^UAT_Message_Queue.zip]
column1864:
03/Aug/23 11:27 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I created a merged file of all the data and did some manipulation (attached mergedFile - excel manipulation.xlsx). 

There were 1000 records which indicates the batch controller is pulling records to it’s full capacity. The last tab shows the combined data for all these records (minus 1 that I lost somewhere along the line!)

The last modified_date is being incremented

However, 90% of the records are still sitting in BURST_COMPLETED status long after the extract was taken. This should be a relatively short lived status, so something is going wrong.

We need to look at the batch controller logs for these ancillary ids, to see if they are being requested and something is going wrong. Alternatively if they aren’t being requested, is there a problem with the rate at which the batch_controller is configured to pick up searches from the queue?

Jon
column1865:
07/Aug/23 10:54 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Unfortunately because I could only pick up the MQ message data from Merin on the next day, the Info error logs had already been cleared down.

However given that the MQ appeared to be full, it looks like the burst controller is doing it’s part initially and it’s the batch controller that might be experiencing problems.(code or otherwise)

This is going to need TCS analysis now, to see why the batch controller isn’t processing ancillary Ids at the rate expected.

Jon
column1866:
07/Aug/23 5:09 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Just been doing some checks in the evm-bahem-Info.2023-08-07 log 

About every 30 seconds I can see what look like an attempt to insert data into the index, eg:

TYPE+EXTERNALREDISENTRY|method=leftPushAll|ANCILLARY_PRICE_DPTEST38,[{"proposition":"FH"……

And there’s one long line that contains all the data for a number of documents being inserted - and the ancillaryId is visible within this. For each of these ‘batches’ that I have looked at so far, all the docs included are for one ancillaryId only. If this is correct it means we would only be handling inserts for 2 ancillaryIds per minute, which doesn’t seem correct. 

Can you please check if you agree with this? Do you  know what the cause of this might be?

Jon
column1867: 10/Aug/23 11:36 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Setting status to under investigation. Jon
column1868:
28/Sep/23 8:15 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;Team analyzed on this issue below are observations on this JIRA, 

# When we monitored the queue, we could find that the records got vanished from message queue after 1 hour and stayed in burst completed status which resulted in piling up of records in burst completed status which exceeded the buffer size, which further resulted in queue as full.
# We confirmed that the message queue will delete the records after 1 hour with MQ monitoring team as well.
# On further analysis on the processing speed of the data that available on the CMH queue we could see below observations
#* For 1 Hour, around 120 records are getting batch completed i.e for 1 minute 2 records will gets batch completed this might increase if the record takes less than 30 seconds. 
#* In some cases, this might get reduced based on time taken for formation of pricing document from OJ response and can process 3-4 records per minute. The processing time will increase as well in some cases at that time only 1 record gets processed in 1 minute. 
#* So, for 1 hour i.e for 60minutes only 60 records might be processed or even less if the time consumption is more than 1 minute. 
#* But so far we haven’t seen a record taking more than 1 minute.
column1869:
28/Sep/23 8:47 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;Yesterday team had discussion with Nigel on this JIRA. 
Below are the discussed points.

* To avoid the piling up of records in burst completed records in SIT enable the burst invocation in development environment. As confirmed from control-m team we need to develop the shell scripts in 15 mins loop the burst service call in 1 min by providing sleep waiting time as 60 secs, which is in progress under [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-661|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-661|smart-link] 
*  To avoid the piling up of records in message queue we have to decrease the configurations of buffer size in such a way that all the records should process with in 1 hour. Nigel explained number of server instances running in sublive(1), prelive(2) and live(4) based on this buffer size should vary in each environment. 
* Also confirmed not to change expiry time that is set in CMH queue. 

*Action Items:* 

* Automate the burst controller in every 1 minutes to avoid the piling up of records in SIT. 
* Modify the configuration decreasing the buffer size. Also check the configurations of buffer size related to server instances. 
* Monitor queue by cleaning the data for some days.
column1870: 28/Sep/23 8:47 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;Update:  Assigning to Pooja.
column1871:
28/Sep/23 10:06 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c]  - thanks for the update. I don’t fully understand it -  can you help me clarify a few points:

* Requests are going onto the queue fine
* Do you think that the ~30 secs response time for availability response is primarily due to network latency?
* When you are talking about the number of server instances, which type of servers are you talking about xDist servers?
* Are all the availability responses being sent and processed sequentially using a single thread per server? ie is the batch control waiting for the availability response for request 1, before sending request 2 without anything occurring in parallel. Do searches only get sent in parallel if there are multiple server instances?
* There is no mechanism for updating the CMT DB if a request is deleted directly from the queue because of the timeout 
* But you don’t think the above point is a problem if the buffer size etc is correctly managed?
* Adjusting the buffer size etc won’t change the rate at which searches can be processed will it? So there’s a daily limit that we need to take into account for UAT. Can you confirm an approx estimate for the number of daily searches. Would this be similar to SIT ie ~ 120 an hour, so we could only complete 120*24 = 2880?  I think that’s lower than we would have expected but will have to check with [~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1]  what the impact is likely to be.

Thanks,

Jon
column1872:
17/Nov/23 1:18 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f2fd3aaeedcae756b1f3] ,

This Jira is quite an important one because it was effectively blocking UAT the last time we checked. From Merin’s last update, it looked like she thought she had the solution and assigned it to Pooja. Can you confirm what the latest position on this is?

Although this isn’t directly related to SOLR, we need to ensure that it’s fixed (or sufficiently good enough) that it does not block effective data caching for SIT and UAT on SOLR. I wrote down some questions to get and get a better understanding of this. Answering those isn’t so critical, I just want to ensure SOLR testing isn’t impacted.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: CNG - SOLR API- Impacted Component - LLD, Layers, Lambda - CR - b/w Solr ^ (boost) Logic
column45:
From Suriya’s analysis, there’s another SOLr logical character ^ (boost) that we need to cater for in the SOLr b/w interface.

Most of the examples use it on market or marketCode fields, but there are also some operating on hotelID field.

Examples:

184.31.0.181 - - [12/Jun/2023:16:06:10 +0000] "GET /solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=en_US*&q=marketCode:(US^9,%20GB^999999999)*&sort=score%20asc,%20pricePP%20asc&fq=destAirportCode:(LAS)&fq=overallCabin:(M)&fq=depDate:[NOW/DAY+TO+NOW/DAY%2B365DAY]&fq=hotelStars:(%224%22OR%224.5%22)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.field=hotelID&group.sort=score+asc,%20pricePP+asc&group.main=true&start=0&rows=4&wt=json HTTP/1.1" 200 16176 [https://www.britishairways.com/en-us/destinations/las-vegas/holidays-in-las-vegas|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.britishairways.com%2Fen-us%2Fdestinations%2Flas-vegas%2Fholidays-in-las-vegas&data=05%7C01%7Cjon.funnell%40holidays.ba.com%7Cc139ed0aebbf488b4d2108db722d6d95%7Cddd66cceffe14029967c5e15ef73127f%7C0%7C0%7C638229312878485857%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ytJ93oB7VZxMHliU4I3VGqZ2yYDfBECYnK6QeDVYD%2Fo%3D&reserved=0] "Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 16_4_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Mobile/20E252 [FBAN/FBIOS;FBDV/iPhone15,3;FBMD/iPhone;FBSN/iOS;FBSV/16.4.1;FBSS/3;FBID/phone;FBLC/en_US;FBOP/5]" "5aZLpKOmeB8AAAP1DuAAAAAF" 80 "-" "-" "-" "-" "-" "-" "ip:24.4.22.6/-" 873479



[2023-06-19 04:05:21,288] org.apache.solr.core.SolrCore (INFO)  - [mmbHotels] webapp=/solr path=/select params={sort=score+asc,pricePerPersonPerNight+asc&q=*hotelID:(SG-SIN-5898000^9,+SG-SIN-8235300^63,+SG-SIN-7330222^441)*&group.field=hotelID&group.main=true&group=true&wt=javabin&fq=hotelCheckInDate:[2020-09-01T00:00:00.000Z+TO+2021-09-01T23:59:59.9999Z]+AND+hotelCityCode:SIN+AND+hotelStarRating:(2+OR+2.5+OR+3+OR+3.5+OR+4+OR+4.5+OR+5)+AND+market:GB*&version=2&rows=3} hits=0 status=0 QTime=1

*The queries that I’ve tried containing ^ chars against the SIT SOLr url, are responding with http 400 errors as opposed to ignoring the characters, so this would break existing queries.*

Eg

[https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/hotelPackages/select?&q=*:*&fq=market:(GB^7)&rows=40&sort=totalPrice asc&wt=json|https://g2qqlg0esi.execute-api.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/dev/solr/hotelPackages/select?&q=*:*&fq=market:(GB%5E7)&rows=40&sort=totalPrice%20asc&wt=json]

Jon

column1859:
29/Jul/23 11:58 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;[~accountid:635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20] 

 [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef] to pick on code analysis from 31st Jul.

column1860: 01/Aug/23 1:29 PM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;Update: Assigning to [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef]  to do the analysis on boost character functionality and its required change in API build.
column1861:
03/Aug/23 12:43 PM;63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] ,Please clarify the below queries based on our analysis:

# Different boost values we could see ( 9 , 63, 441 ) in the sample query . Is there any specific reason for this numbers given by the consumers for the given query.
# We are assuming the ordering the parameter based on elastic search  boost functionality. Is it the same  exceptions for  the consumer  as well.
# This is Q query required a score. But  In full API  we are  planning to consider only fq , which doesn't look for score. If in full API Booster functionality  really required we need to  check possibilities of q as well.
column1862:
03/Aug/23 2:00 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef],

For #1

There’s more than one sample query showing different boost values eg  in SOLr b/w doc itself [britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=en_US&q=marketCode:|http://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=en_US&q=marketCode:](US^9, GB^999999999)

And in the embedded FH-solr_queries.txt

select params={sort=score+asc,totalPrice+asc&q=marketCode:(SG^1,+GB^99)

I can’t talk to the consumers sending these queries because we don’t know where they come from. I doubt the numbers themselves are that important…I would imagine it’s the ordering of them size wise and relative size that are more important. It would be worth checking is there is a maximum value allowed for SOLr…999999999 is the largest one that I’ve seen.

For 2#, I’m sorry I don’t understand your question. Can you please clarify? 

For #3. I know in the full API we have talked about limiting matching values to just using fq (and match_phrase). But I don’t think that’s the same decisions as saying that we would never support anything on the q parameter, ie if it was something other that trying to match a value. Having said that, at the moment I don’t think boost functionality for full API is needed for go live - see Jira [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-946|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-946|smart-link] 

We might need to talk to Abinaya about potential use of things like boost on the q parameter and get her views.

Thanks,

Jon
column1863:
08/Aug/23 4:56 PM;63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef;As We discussed with [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] and [~accountid:712020:8d138859-363b-4f27-8fcb-f73aeda9b37f] , below scenarios seems to be working as expected in elasticsearch too.                                                                                                                


While analysing the solr sort  along with boost funtionality ,we could see below observation in solr and elastic search.

*with Sort + boost +score*
*Behaviour 1*

 [https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^37)&rows=56000&fl=hotelID,pricePP&sort=score%20desc,pricePP%20asc|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^37)&rows=56000&fl=hotelID,pricePP&sort=score%20desc,pricePP%20asc]

 In solr as Per above query behaving the same way as expected. We are getting  hotelId :BB-BGI-6203600  is having the higher boost value ,it gets sorted first by using score. Then PricePp is sorted in ascending.
*Behaviour 2*

 [https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^37)&rows=56000&fl=hotelID,pricePP&sort=pricePP%20asc,score%20desc|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^37)&rows=56000&fl=hotelID,pricePP&sort=pricePP%20asc,score%20desc]

 As Per this query  pricepp fields is getting sorted in ascending order first. and boosting is also prioritized when it is having 2 or more same value in pricepp.

 

*with boost*

 [https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^3087)&rows=560;|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^3087)&rows=560;]
As Per this query  hotelId :BB-BGI-6203600  is having the higher boost value,the response is ordering as per higher relevance score.

 

*with Sort + boost*

 [https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^3777)&rows=560&fl=hotelID,pricePP&sort=pricePP%20asc|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?q=hotelID:(ES-TCI-2133435^9,+BB-BGI-6203600^3777)&rows=560&fl=hotelID,pricePP&sort=pricePP%20asc]

 In solr,AS per above query ,When we use the combination of sort and boost,sorting is happening for pricepp alone,boosting is not prioritized.
column1864:
08/Aug/23 5:56 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;The 4 tests above are essentially:

# boost added for hotelID, explicit sort docs on score desc and then pricePP asc
# boost added for hotelID, explicit sort docs on  pricePP asc first and then score desc
# boost added for hotelID, no sort specified (implicit sort on score desc)
# boost added for hotelID, explicit sorts docs on  pricePP asc

The only question was whether #4 would trigger implicit sorting on score as well as sorting on pricePP asc, but this doesn’t appear to be the case for either SOLr or Elasticsearch. Overall the responses for Elasticsearch seemed consistent with SOLr which is good.

The above tests are based on sorting individual documents. It’s also possible to sort docs based on groups, so I think we should repeat similar tests to the above for group sorting.

[~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef] Could you please check if similar behaviour happens when the dataset has +group sorting+….so setup a query using grouping and repeat similar tests using the *group.sort* parameter (which controls sorting within each group). You’ll need to consider what data you have available in your test system and what it makes sense to group upon but hotelID might work again.

FYI - Default behaviour for SOLr appears to be to return 1 row per group unless *group.limit* is also specified([https://solr.apache.org/guide/6_6/result-grouping.html|https://solr.apache.org/guide/6_6/result-grouping.html|smart-link] )…but I’ve tried including that parameter but it didn’t have any impact. Not sure why that is.

For simplicity I would do this group sorting test w/o any *sort* parameter. 

*What I’d like to find out is if group sorting follows the same rules as indiv doc sorting in both SOLr and Elasticsearch or otherwise.*

*After we’ve done that we should probably check a combination of sorting at both levels, but lets do 1 step at a time.*

Thanks,

Jon
column1865:
09/Aug/23 4:27 PM;63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] and [~accountid:712020:8d138859-363b-4f27-8fcb-f73aeda9b37f] ,   I have analysed combination for boost+group+sort+score functionalities  below

*Scenario 1(with boost +group)*

[britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR^9, GB^99, ES^100)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=500|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR%5e9,%20GB%5e990,%20ES%5e100)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=500]

In solr , As per above query it is ordering based on higher relevance score in group. Documents .Same behaviour is apply in Elastic search.

*Scenario 2(with boost +group.sort(score,pricepp)*

[britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR^9, GB^990, ES^100)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=500&group.sort=score desc,pricePP asc|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR%5e9,%20GB%5e990,%20ES%5e100)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=500&group.sort=score%20desc,pricePP%20asc]

In solr , As per above query it is ordering based on higher relevance score and based on group.sort it is ascending the pricePP in group Documents. Same behaviour is apply in Elastic search.

 

 *Scenario 3(with boost +group.sort(pricePP,score)*

[britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(US^9, ES^1, FR^67)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP&group.limit=500&group.sort=pricePP asc,score desc|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(US%5e9,%20ES%5e1,%20FR%5e67)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP&group.limit=500&group.sort=pricePP%20asc,score%20desc]

In solr , As per above group.sort it is ascending the pricePP and when we have same value in pricePP in that it is boosting is prioritized in group Documents. Same behaviour is apply in Elastic search.

*Scenario 4(with boost+sort +group.sort(score,pricePP))*

[britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(US^9, ES^1000, FR^67)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&sort=journeyTime asc&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=500&group.sort=score desc,pricePP asc|https://www.britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(US%5e9,%20ES%5e1000,%20FR%5e67)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&sort=journeyTime%20asc&rows=2&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=500&group.sort=score%20desc,pricePP%20asc]

In solr , As per above query it is ordering based on higher relevance score and based on group.sort it is ascending the pricePP in group Documents and for journey Time is not sorted as expected while using sort functionality . Same behaviour is apply in Elastic search.

*Scenario 5(with boost+sort +group.sort(pricePP,score))*

[britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR^99, US^13444, ES^10)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP asc,score desc&rows=5&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=600&sort=journeyTime asc|https://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR%5e99,%20US%5e13444,%20ES%5e10)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc,score%20desc&rows=5&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=600&sort=journeyTime%20asc]

In solr ,As per above query,Based on group.sort pricePP is sored first and then it is boosting is prioritized.and journey Time is not sorted as expected while using sort functionality . Same behaviour is apply in Elastic search.

*Scenario 6(with boost+sort (score,totalPrice)+group.sort(pricePP,score))*

[britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=en_US&q=marketCode:(US%5e9, GB%5e999999999)&sort=score asc, totalPrice asc&fq=destAirportCode:(LAS)&fq=overallCabin:(M)&fq=depDate:%5bNOW/DAY+TO+NOW/DAY%2B365DAY%5d&fq=hotelStars:("4"OR"4.5")&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.sort=score+asc, pricePP+asc&group.main=false&start=0&rows=4&fl=marketCode,pricePP,totalPrice&group.limit=87600|https://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select?locale=en_US&q=marketCode:(US%5e9,%20GB%5e999999999)&sort=score%20asc,%20totalPrice%20asc&fq=destAirportCode:(LAS)&fq=overallCabin:(M)&fq=depDate:%5bNOW/DAY+TO+NOW/DAY%2B365DAY%5d&fq=hotelStars:(%224%22OR%224.5%22)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.sort=score+asc,%20pricePP+asc&group.main=false&start=0&rows=4&fl=marketCode,pricePP,totalPrice&group.limit=87600]

In solr , As per above query it is ordering based on higher relevance score and based on group.sort it is ascending the pricePP in group Documents and for score and totalPrice is not sorted as expected while using sort functionality . Same behaviour is apply in Elastic search.

I have a query with group sorting and also the sort parameter, where the sort parameter does impact the results. If you compare the output of 

[https://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR^99, US^13444, ES^10)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP asc,score desc&rows=5&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=600&sort=score asc|https://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR%5E99,%20US%5E13444,%20ES%5E10)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc,score%20desc&rows=5&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=600&sort=score%20asc]

[https://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR^99, US^13444, ES^10)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP asc,score desc&rows=5&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=600&sort=pricePP desc|https://britishairways.com/solr/hotelPackages/select/?q=marketCode:(FR%5E99,%20US%5E13444,%20ES%5E10)&group=true&group.field=hotelID&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc,score%20desc&rows=5&fl=marketCode,pricePP,journeyTime&group.limit=600&sort=pricePP%20desc]

You will see that the sort parameter is resulting in different hotel ids being returned and one set of results have lower prices than the others.

I think it would help if we could find out in what order SOLr uses the parameters, this might explain why it sometimes has an impact and sometimes it does. If the normal sort param is used first, this might explain why we get different price ranges back?

FYI - for your query 6, for me this was only returning GB market data and the group sorting parameters in the url were the wrong way around compared to the text description. (Not sure it’s that important though and I think looking at these 2 queries here will be more useful.)

Thanks,

Jon

column1874:
03/Oct/23 5:32 AM;62441749f6a26900695c6645;Hi [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef] 

Solr provides the relevance level of matching documents based on the terms found.
In Solr , boosting allows to control the relevance of a documents by boosting its term.

Boosting value is achieved by following the below rules.

# The default boost value is 1, it must be positive, and it can be less than 1. (ex: 0.2)
# If boost value is greater than one will increase the importance of a term
# If boost value is between 0 and 1 will decrease the importance

Please let me know if have any queries

column1887:
07/Dec/23 11:58 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef] ,

From my perspective there are 3 different things in play here:

# what functionality the current live SOLR setup supports
# which subset of this functionality is actually used in live ie where we see examples of usage in live server logs
# whether the use of boost in your live / example queries is actually impacting the sort order of results and working correctly

In terms of 1

* you are saying that boost is supported for all propositions but only for the select handler
* *on that basis we only need to support it for the select handler in CNG and the other handlers don't need to support boost*
* we do however need to ensure that if the other handlers are called using q and boost that they don't fall over
* is the current behaviour for the non select handlers to simply ignore the q parameter (essentially treating it like the query url has q=_*:*_ ?
* if that's the case we should do the same in CNG. If not, please clarify what you thinks we need to do

For 2:

* You've looked at live logs for a week, which sounds fine
* We only need to focus on the select examples as these are the only ones where boost works currently
* You've said TC11 - TC12 aren't from live server logs. Are all the other select examples from live or are they ones you've created?
* Are you happy that this spreadsheet highlight all the combinations of parameters that you think are important as part of understanding how boost works, or are there others in the logs?

For 3:

* I find the spreadsheet a bit confusing
* From a requirements perspective only the select ones are of interest. (The other queries might be useful for testing but that’s about it.)
* Why are some select handlers marked as Boost applicable no? Are you actually talking about whether the boost and score are impacting the order of the results as opposed to whether the functions work in live? I so, this isn’t clear.
* Normally there should be a clear link between what fields are used in the query that affect sort and the order of the search results. 
* For your select examples are there any instances where the sort order or results are not as you would expect? If so that would be worth highlighting. if not, then great and everything is working as expected.

It might make sense to talk this through to clarify where we are and next steps. I’m not around this afternoon but I can do a call tomorrow or next week.

Thanks,

Jon

If required we can have a follow up call with Lee who is the senior SME for Solr.

column1856:
30/Jun/23 9:33 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Caroline Easton advises that everything that currently supports Holiday Finder (ie DMT, APC, Solr index, Solr queries and holiday Finder itself) is covered under generic SLA levels…ie office hours support only ~ 9am-5pm. The only thing that sits separately to that would be the SIP - but given that is lower priority, Caroline is pretty confident that will be generic SLA level as well. 

I asked how she felt about keeping it at this level or increasing it and she's happy for it to remain like this for go live. She may look at getting it increased to SL2  at some point. But when she previously mentioned this, it got shot down quite quickly so it needs a good commercial case and that might be easier to put together once we are live.

Jon

column1863:
22/Aug/23 8:14 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;to recap details of firewall rule FWR 28468:

source - AWS dev 100.64.43.128/26 and prelive  100.64.43.64/26 

destination - NAT public IP {{23.239.128.41}} - this NATs the private IP 10.225.20.45 of the database at Astral towers .  

Port 1433

There is no DNS set up with {{23.239.128.41}}; so from AWS connect to the database using the IP 23.239.128.41 and port 1433 (plus whatever other connect details BAH tell you like instance/user/password).

column1: Define technical support process for removing Deleted docs from Elasticsearch diskspace
column45:
As part of testing re-indexing, Abinaya was investigating why the new copy of the index was smaller then the original. As part of this investigation, so found the following link:

[After reindex, new index has same documents but data size is much less - Elastic Stack / Elasticsearch - Discuss the Elastic Stack|https://discuss.elastic.co/t/after-reindex-new-index-has-same-documents-but-data-size-is-much-less/243068]

Part of this discussion highlights that when Elasticsearch documents are deleted they continue to take up disk space. (and only removed here as part of the re-indexing process). When we are running in production, the number of document updates will be very high and we want to avoid holding large amounts of unwanted data. We should discuss this with Elasticsearch and find the best way of managing the situation.

I’m not sure if the build up of old documents is triggered just by deletion or by updates as well - we should clarify that as well.

Jon

column1: Implement control M in production
column45:
We need to setup control-M scheduler in production for all 8 refresh jobs identified. This would involve writing the script+ raising Service now tickets with OPIN forms to support scheduling.

We also need to ensure all these jobs  to be implemented as Cron jobs in lower environments. This will ensure that the data will be accurate in parent and ancillary tables and audit tables. This also would enable accurate testing.

This need to be done for all 8 refresh jobs identified.

Midnight refresh job(4)

Housekeeping job(1)

Audit cleanup job(1)

Car +hotel refresh jobs(2)

-Suresh



___ This Jira is only for implementation of batch jobs in Production via Control M

July 3, 2023 at 12:33 PM

Hi All,

Recommendations :

As discussed during HLD meeting, following considerations needs to be take care during the build and testing phases and MoM email attached for the same.

# Handle multiple requests coming from different users in a way that all users should be able to access the API rather only few ones.
# tps ( transaction per second ) - Currently its 275 requests/second . Needs to work more on metrics.
# Implement the cache mechanism - Temporarily store the auth token and re-use till token expires.

[^Minutes of Meeting - Design approach - To implement OAuth in BA Holidays Pricing Cache API.msg]

column1860:
08/Jun/23 6:50 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;Hi All,

 

Thanks for joining this call and providing your input. Following are the key points discussed and need action :

* SOLR internal call changes to be done in content proxy and will route through external API Gateway (through internet). This would require content proxy ips whitelisting in CNG-AWS infrastructure.
* SOLR external call changes to be done in Akamai and will route through external API Gateway. This would require either Akamai ip whitelisting or validation of Akamai header in CNG-AWS infrastructure.
* The approximate duration for the change implementation till Live is 1.5 months but to be further estimated and confirmed after the queries have been answered.
* SIP API related changes to be checked with SIP team.

+Actions :+ 

To confirm number of environments requiring the changes (current expectation is Dev, Prelive and Live) - *Sushant*

To provide tentative dates for the implementation - *Sushant*

To advise on irules for Akamai header validation - *Sebiks*/*CTTI*

To confirm on the Akamai - Sebiks/CTTI

column1: CNG - Batch (CAPTWO) - Impacted Component - Service, Elastic Search, Kibana - CNG should not store availability details without a price.
column45:
This comes out of the  discussion / investigation for [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|smart-link] .

The purpose of the cache is to store priced availability. If a document is stored in the cache without a price, then it is of no use to us and could cause downstream problems eg 

* Causing errors in systems retrieving CNG data because a critical field is not present
* Displaying zero prices at end use points - leading to customer confusion / complaints
* Causing problems for Commercial analysis

The fact that a price cannot be store indicates that something has gone fundamentally wrong either with the OJ response or the handling of it. There might be more than 1 scenario where this could happen.

*We should add an additional check for all propositions, to confirm that we have a price available. If this is not the case, we should not store the document in the index. We should also log any documents that have been ignored because of this check.*

Jon

column1856:
07/Jun/23 3:21 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I’m not sure of the exact scenario in [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|smart-link]  where the issue was noticed. It’s for LON - SYD for upgraded cabins eg ancillaryId 64410. For this ancillary Id some upgraded cabins results have been priced ok but others have not. See screenshot where for the 10 Apr update timestamp, W cabin has been priced ok, but C cabin for the same hotel has not.



!image-20230607-141951.png|width=1495,height=640!



It’s also clearly not happening every time a LON - SYD search is done because no further docs without pricing were generated when I set up an additional search today (CMT ref FH-10250).

So testing this might be tricky.

Jon

column1859:
14/Jun/23 6:36 AM;63a38a924bc858b303cbec94;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1d13780798663d11cff] 

I have added additional check for all propositions to confirm that we have a price available. If this is not the case, that package along  with ancillaryId and other details will be logged into Error Log stating that NO_PRICE_DOCUMENT_CREATED  As mandatory total price is not available.

For FH and HO, if *DisplayTotalPrice* is null then the error will be logged. Whereas for FC and CO, if *TotalPrice* is null then the error will be logged.

Can you please check on this.

Thanks

Ketaki

column1864: 04/Aug/23 12:02 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;do we understand why the prices are missing? [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|smart-link] suggests at least one cause is routes configured in xdist to only return 1 cabin. If we log NO_PRICE_DOCUMENT_CREATED error for all of these, won’t that be a bit confusing for support teams?
column1865:
25/Aug/23 10:03 AM;6392214d3c26ca7fa0d75c1d;Hi [~accountid:616007b564ff01007180a9c5] ,

* We will be logging NO_PRICE_DOCUMENT_CREATED along the reason in error log. This has been done as part of [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-69|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-69|smart-link] in which [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-485|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-485|smart-link] especially handles logging of {{BAH_BAHEM_4021}}-No price document created if any mandatory condition is not satisfied.

It is handled in such a way that the support team can understand the reason for logging this error code.

For example:

# {{[TYPE+WARN|code=BAH_BAHEM_4021|desc=No price document created for this ancillary id(As mandatory hotel image condition is not satisfied for OJ Hotel Code: AU-SYD-2140000 Ancillary ID: 89014)|lineNo=0]}}
# {{[TYPE+WARN|code=BAH_BAHEM_4021|desc=No price document created for this ancillary id(As mandatory OJ Hotel Code is not available in Hotel product info table for OJ Hotel Code: AE-DXB-7027000 Ancillary ID: 89038)|lineNo=0]}}

* As for the cause of pricing details missing query, we are checking on this and will be updating it in the Jira once we find the reason.

Thanks,

Pooja
column1866:
18/Mar/24 3:38 PM;62e3f2aa4913d0b73489d25a;FH,FC 

1- from xdist, select a route like Paris to london, which is not defined in the below xdist table

!image-20240318-153519.png|width=825,height=371!

2- create FH and FC CMT using the route, setup the cabin to Club store and commit cmt, then 3- check the Burst and the batch logs to see if the price specific message/warning is logged {{desc=No price document created for this ancillary id(As}}

4- check the ES Index FH , the ancillary id should not be stored. without a price.

5- Repeat for FC



HO

1- in the ES HO data, establish a hotelid that is stored for a an ancillary id

2- Modify the record in the table hotel_product_info for the above hotelid

3- create HO CMT for the destination that should include the above the hotelid, store and commit.

4- Check the burst and batch logs, and verify ancillary id does not include this hotel

08/Jun/23 12:56 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;for special offers Jira [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-55|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-55|smart-link] given below are the impact areas which has an estimate of 17 days of build efforts. 
Also [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] can you kindly confirm if we need to expose this fields for Full API (if yes means, do we need to populate data as it is in kibana or any changes required there). If we need to modify the data what we get in Kibana in Full API, then it will be add additional efforts based on the change/requirement.

|Analysis|
|Get the Open Jaw Response  structure for discounts and    remove the details from Specials(FH and HO)|
|Open Jaw Response  structure for Remarks(FH  HO, FC and CO)|

column1857:
09/Jun/23 9:11 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8] , [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - yes special Offers info should be made available through the full API. (Or BA Holidays Pricing Cache API ). As this is new data, Special Offers should not be included in the b/w APIs.

I’m not exactly sure what you mean about Kibana. The batch controller rules will need to change to pickup all the Special Offers info and the index mapping in Kibana will probably change. (we’ve still got to agree exactly how the SO info will be held). I don’t see the need to ‘transform / alter’ the SO data we receive from the availability response, because it should already be user friendly enough for front end display. However the key thing is to store all the SO info in an appropriate structure, so it’s clear what it is and so it can be used effectively by the users of cache data. Does that cover your question?

Jon

traffic is able to get from the bah-dev-full (in the service VPC) all the way to the transit gateway, but from there, it can't hit 161.2.10.145

column1858:
29/Aug/23 5:28 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;Updates from 17-Aug:



Shahzad, thanks for checking the curl from transit VPC to 161.2.10.145 161.2.10.146 161.2.10.147 161.2.10.151 161.2.10.152 

So there is connectivity from transit VPC to on-prem .  So I presume I do not need to raise a ticket for BT to investigate our side, since firewall on BA side is allowing the traffic OK.  To connect from inside the private VPC, it should go via NAT gateway in the transit vpc
column1859:

a NAT Gateway would need to be in place to allow the Lambda to branch-out from the AWS network to be able to access the on-premise network

agreed

so, why would you need a NAT then?

it's probably already in place
column1860:
29/Aug/23 5:31 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;Updates from 28-Aug:

As asked for DEV environment, we checked the connectivity of housekeeping lambda to OnPremise DB through our application code and seems it is not working. It is unable to locate the host with both name and specific IP given. Please find the details below :

 

 

Caused by: java.net.UnknownHostException: [bhdevdb05.baplc.com|http://bhdevdb05.baplc.com]: Name or service not known



 

And on giving specific IP 161.2.10.146 (port-1521), it got just timed out. 

Please let us know if you have any queries or more details required.

column1: CNG - Housekeeping - Impacted Component -  LLD -House Keeping Design
column45:
Quick summary on House Keeping Design:

||*Task*||*Start Date*||*End Date*||
|Design|21-Jun-23|07-Jul-23|
|Design Walk through|13-Jul-23|13-Jul-23|
|Design Review Comments|13-Jul-23|31-Jul-23|
|Incorporate Review Comments|31-Jul-23|04-Aug-23|
|Risks raised|04-Aug-23|04-Aug-23|



There was quick discussion with IAG/BAH/TCS on the following pointers on 04th Aug:

# In case of deletion failure in elastic cluster, how the records will be managed to clear records from elastic cluster and CMT DB in order to make the records to be sync 
# How many times to trigger the housekeeping lambda based on the max records to be deleted for a day.

To understand the failure cases (as it is a rare scenario where we are not able to predict the failure cases) and the lambda run time required for a single run

Decision was made to do a feasibility study before agreeing on the design sign off.

column1859:
14/Jul/23 5:13 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;Team is currently working on the review comments from Jon/Nigel. LLD path of the document given below 
[House keeping design link |https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/BAHProjects/3844%20Additional%20Holiday%20Pricing%20CNG/3.%20Analysis%20%26%20Design/Designs/LLD/(3844)%20CNG%20-%20Housekeeping%20LLD%20v0.1.docx?d=w315fe653c8fd41aa9b7d2b98a6ac3b00&csf=1&web=1&e=qWg1f1&%3D%3D&sdata=Tm8wOE9ETU5CVVVPYzhDS2xMSTVoUTFCUVNLcVJ0aWY1QnRFNGcvaXF3Yz0%3D&ovuser=ddd66cce-ffe1-4029-967c-5e15ef73127f%2Canand.dixit%40ba.com]
column1860: 21/Jul/23 6:36 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;Design review comments targeted to be closed by next week.
column1861: 31/Jul/23 4:17 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;Team is checking internally for one review comment, rest all comments have been incorporated
column1862: 04/Aug/23 3:41 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;Discussed with Jon and Nigel today, to address the open comments and failure case, team has got the approval to do the POC and then reconsider the design based on the outcome.
column1863: 11/Aug/23 5:08 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;POC is in progress. required code base set up is completed and team is currently working on data set up for 1 million records in CMT DB and ELK.
column1864: 21/Aug/23 2:44 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;POC is on hold for Version 1 to establish connectivity between lambda to on prem DB. Once we get the connection established, we can do testing of POC. Once testing of POC is complete, we will be able to address open comments of housekeeping LLD.
column1865: 25/Aug/23 9:35 AM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;POC code to be deployed and tested in AWS lambda to ensure connection is established between AWS lambda and on prem DB. Once testing of POC is complete, we will be able to address open comments of housekeeping LLD.
column1866: 01/Sep/23 12:49 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;POC code deployed in AWS lambda to ensure connection is established between AWS lambda and on prem DB. Team found issues which has been highlighted to version 1. Once testing of POC is complete, we will be able to address open comments of housekeeping LLD.

column1: CNG - SOLR API - NOT(!) Logic
column45:
When we discussed the b/w SOLr design, we discussed whether NOT logic should also be included. It was omitted on the basis that we didn’t know of any examples where this was occurring.

Looking in Holiday finder prelive ([https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/travel/holiday-finder/public/en_gb|https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/travel/holiday-finder/public/en_gb]), I can see an example of this when filtering the results to just the Europe region. This generates a url of the form:



[https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/solr/hotelPackages/hfHandler/?q=*:*&sort=pricePP%20asc&fq=pricePP:[0%20TO%20*]&fq=duration:[1%20TO%20*]&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=departureCityCode:LON&fq=marketCode:GB&fq=flightDepDate_1_O:[2023-06-01T00:00:00Z%20TO%202023-06-30T23:59:59Z]&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR%20OR%20LGW%20OR%20LCY%20OR%20LTN%20OR%20STN)&fq=(|https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/solr/hotelPackages/hfHandler/?q=*:*&sort=pricePP%20asc&fq=pricePP:[0%20TO%20*]&fq=duration:[1%20TO%20*]&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=departureCityCode:LON&fq=marketCode:GB&fq=flightDepDate_1_O:[2023-06-01T00:00:00Z%20TO%202023-06-30T23:59:59Z]&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR%20OR%20LGW%20OR%20LCY%20OR%20LTN%20OR%20STN)&fq=(regionCode:EUK%20AND%20countryCode:*%20AND%20destAirportCode:*%20AND%20!countryCode:GB)&group=true&group.field=hotelIDDurationGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&fl=resortName,location,hotelImage,ancillaryID,hotelIDDurationGroup,destAirportCityName,destAirportCode,hotelName,hotelID,hotelStars,reviewRating,reviewRatingImg,reviewCount,reviewLink,depDate,depDateMillisecs,checkInDate,checkOutDate,duration,pricePP,boardBasis,deepLink,countryCode,cabinCode_1_O,cabinCode_2_O,cabinCode_2_I,cabinCode_3_I,cabinCode_4_I,depAirportName_1_O,depAirportName_2_O,depAirportName_2_I,depAirportName_3_I,depAirportName_4_I,arrAirportName_1_O,arrAirportName_2_O,arrAirportName_2_I,arrAirportName_3_I,arrAirportName_4_I,depAirportCode_1_O,depAirportCode_2_O,depAirportCode_2_I,depAirportCode_3_I,depAirportCode_4_I,arrAirportCode_1_O,arrAirportCode_2_O,arrAirportCode_2_I,arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportCode_4_I,flightDepDate_1_O,flightDepDate_2_O,flightDepDate_2_I,flightDepDate_3_I,flightDepDate_4_I,flightArrDate_1_O,flightArrDate_2_O,flightArrDate_2_I,flightArrDate_3_I,flightArrDate_4_I,departureCityCode,currencyCode,overallCabin&rows=30&wt=json][*regionCode:EUK%20AND%20countryCode:*%20AND%20destAirportCode:*%20AND%20!countryCode:GB*|https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/solr/hotelPackages/hfHandler/?q=*:*&sort=pricePP%20asc&fq=pricePP:[0%20TO%20*]&fq=duration:[1%20TO%20*]&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=departureCityCode:LON&fq=marketCode:GB&fq=flightDepDate_1_O:[2023-06-01T00:00:00Z%20TO%202023-06-30T23:59:59Z]&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR%20OR%20LGW%20OR%20LCY%20OR%20LTN%20OR%20STN)&fq=(regionCode:EUK%20AND%20countryCode:*%20AND%20destAirportCode:*%20AND%20!countryCode:GB)&group=true&group.field=hotelIDDurationGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&fl=resortName,location,hotelImage,ancillaryID,hotelIDDurationGroup,destAirportCityName,destAirportCode,hotelName,hotelID,hotelStars,reviewRating,reviewRatingImg,reviewCount,reviewLink,depDate,depDateMillisecs,checkInDate,checkOutDate,duration,pricePP,boardBasis,deepLink,countryCode,cabinCode_1_O,cabinCode_2_O,cabinCode_2_I,cabinCode_3_I,cabinCode_4_I,depAirportName_1_O,depAirportName_2_O,depAirportName_2_I,depAirportName_3_I,depAirportName_4_I,arrAirportName_1_O,arrAirportName_2_O,arrAirportName_2_I,arrAirportName_3_I,arrAirportName_4_I,depAirportCode_1_O,depAirportCode_2_O,depAirportCode_2_I,depAirportCode_3_I,depAirportCode_4_I,arrAirportCode_1_O,arrAirportCode_2_O,arrAirportCode_2_I,arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportCode_4_I,flightDepDate_1_O,flightDepDate_2_O,flightDepDate_2_I,flightDepDate_3_I,flightDepDate_4_I,flightArrDate_1_O,flightArrDate_2_O,flightArrDate_2_I,flightArrDate_3_I,flightArrDate_4_I,departureCityCode,currencyCode,overallCabin&rows=30&wt=json][)&group=true&group.field=hotelIDDurationGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&fl=resortName,location,hotelImage,ancillaryID,hotelIDDurationGroup,destAirportCityName,destAirportCode,hotelName,hotelID,hotelStars,reviewRating,reviewRatingImg,reviewCount,reviewLink,depDate,depDateMillisecs,checkInDate,checkOutDate,duration,pricePP,boardBasis,deepLink,countryCode,cabinCode_1_O,cabinCode_2_O,cabinCode_2_I,cabinCode_3_I,cabinCode_4_I,depAirportName_1_O,depAirportName_2_O,depAirportName_2_I,depAirportName_3_I,depAirportName_4_I,arrAirportName_1_O,arrAirportName_2_O,arrAirportName_2_I,arrAirportName_3_I,arrAirportName_4_I,depAirportCode_1_O,depAirportCode_2_O,depAirportCode_2_I,depAirportCode_3_I,depAirportCode_4_I,arrAirportCode_1_O,arrAirportCode_2_O,arrAirportCode_2_I,arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportCode_4_I,flightDepDate_1_O,flightDepDate_2_O,flightDepDate_2_I,flightDepDate_3_I,flightDepDate_4_I,flightArrDate_1_O,flightArrDate_2_O,flightArrDate_2_I,flightArrDate_3_I,flightArrDate_4_I,departureCityCode,currencyCode,overallCabin&rows=30&wt=json|https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/solr/hotelPackages/hfHandler/?q=*:*&sort=pricePP%20asc&fq=pricePP:[0%20TO%20*]&fq=duration:[1%20TO%20*]&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=departureCityCode:LON&fq=marketCode:GB&fq=flightDepDate_1_O:[2023-06-01T00:00:00Z%20TO%202023-06-30T23:59:59Z]&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR%20OR%20LGW%20OR%20LCY%20OR%20LTN%20OR%20STN)&fq=(regionCode:EUK%20AND%20countryCode:*%20AND%20destAirportCode:*%20AND%20!countryCode:GB)&group=true&group.field=hotelIDDurationGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&fl=resortName,location,hotelImage,ancillaryID,hotelIDDurationGroup,destAirportCityName,destAirportCode,hotelName,hotelID,hotelStars,reviewRating,reviewRatingImg,reviewCount,reviewLink,depDate,depDateMillisecs,checkInDate,checkOutDate,duration,pricePP,boardBasis,deepLink,countryCode,cabinCode_1_O,cabinCode_2_O,cabinCode_2_I,cabinCode_3_I,cabinCode_4_I,depAirportName_1_O,depAirportName_2_O,depAirportName_2_I,depAirportName_3_I,depAirportName_4_I,arrAirportName_1_O,arrAirportName_2_O,arrAirportName_2_I,arrAirportName_3_I,arrAirportName_4_I,depAirportCode_1_O,depAirportCode_2_O,depAirportCode_2_I,depAirportCode_3_I,depAirportCode_4_I,arrAirportCode_1_O,arrAirportCode_2_O,arrAirportCode_2_I,arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportCode_4_I,flightDepDate_1_O,flightDepDate_2_O,flightDepDate_2_I,flightDepDate_3_I,flightDepDate_4_I,flightArrDate_1_O,flightArrDate_2_O,flightArrDate_2_I,flightArrDate_3_I,flightArrDate_4_I,departureCityCode,currencyCode,overallCabin&rows=30&wt=json]

The part in bold is saying get results for all country codes in the Europe region with the exception of GB ([*!countryCode:GB*|https://ecp-prelive.baplc.com/solr/hotelPackages/hfHandler/?q=*:*&sort=pricePP%20asc&fq=pricePP:[0%20TO%20*]&fq=duration:[1%20TO%20*]&fq=overallCabin:M&fq=departureCityCode:LON&fq=marketCode:GB&fq=flightDepDate_1_O:[2023-06-01T00:00:00Z%20TO%202023-06-30T23:59:59Z]&fq=depAirportCode_1_O:(LHR%20OR%20LGW%20OR%20LCY%20OR%20LTN%20OR%20STN)&fq=(regionCode:EUK%20AND%20countryCode:*%20AND%20destAirportCode:*%20AND%20!countryCode:GB)&group=true&group.field=hotelIDDurationGroup&group.ngroups=true&group.sort=pricePP%20asc&fl=resortName,location,hotelImage,ancillaryID,hotelIDDurationGroup,destAirportCityName,destAirportCode,hotelName,hotelID,hotelStars,reviewRating,reviewRatingImg,reviewCount,reviewLink,depDate,depDateMillisecs,checkInDate,checkOutDate,duration,pricePP,boardBasis,deepLink,countryCode,cabinCode_1_O,cabinCode_2_O,cabinCode_2_I,cabinCode_3_I,cabinCode_4_I,depAirportName_1_O,depAirportName_2_O,depAirportName_2_I,depAirportName_3_I,depAirportName_4_I,arrAirportName_1_O,arrAirportName_2_O,arrAirportName_2_I,arrAirportName_3_I,arrAirportName_4_I,depAirportCode_1_O,depAirportCode_2_O,depAirportCode_2_I,depAirportCode_3_I,depAirportCode_4_I,arrAirportCode_1_O,arrAirportCode_2_O,arrAirportCode_2_I,arrAirportCode_3_I,arrAirportCode_4_I,flightDepDate_1_O,flightDepDate_2_O,flightDepDate_2_I,flightDepDate_3_I,flightDepDate_4_I,flightArrDate_1_O,flightArrDate_2_O,flightArrDate_2_I,flightArrDate_3_I,flightArrDate_4_I,departureCityCode,currencyCode,overallCabin&rows=30&wt=json] *part*).

The query as it stands returns *21200 results* ("ngroups":21220 in response). 

If the !countryCode: GB part is removed, the query now returns *21613* results. 

If the bold part of the query is changed to just return countryCode: GB, this return 393 results - the difference between the other 2 figures.

So this indicates that the use of ! ie NOT in the holiday finder query is working and important from an HF perspective. 

With the current b/w SOLr design, selecting Europe should return Europe with GB destinations, rather than just Europe and give different performance to today.

When I try this in capdev760 our UAT env, I’m still getting the same totals as prelive. But I assume this is because we don’t have the re-direct in place yet to point to CNG for SOLr queries?

Jon

column1: Rename the 'Full API' to 'BA Holidays Pricing Cache API'
column45:
*Background:*

As per discussions in the working group, ideally we would update the full API url to replace full with the new name for full API (once it is agreed). This will mean that all references to full will be removed from all API documentation and urls - making things less confusing for users of the API.

*Requirement:*

*I want* the new ‘Full API’ to be consistently referred to as the “BA Holidays Pricing Cache API” *so that* there a clear name used and consumers immediately understand what it is



*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Given* the new API has been referred to as the ‘Full API’ throughout design/development

*When* it actually comes into delivery (sub-live / live)

*Then* it is renamed the “BA Holidays Pricing Cache API”

*And* all references to it must use the this name e.g. documentation, config files, scripts, API url’s etc

column1: API Consumers (Internal and External)

*Internal Consumers - SOLR*

* Chris McGreevy [chris.mcgreevy@ba.com|mailto:chris.mcgreevy@ba.com] - TDL

* [Note Lois advises there’s some cross over with what Zac and will Mowbray look after but we have both involved in different areas]

M) and [aga.joanna.szczepaniak@ba.com|mailto:aga.joanna.szczepaniak@ba.com] and [alejandro.perez.cruz@ba.com|mailto:alejandro.perez.cruz@ba.com] who are experts in Adobe AEM. Assume we don’t need to involve them unless a specific reason occurs]

column1856:
23/Jun/23 7:07 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;As per the CNG application configuration Redis key configuration is taken from the CMT_PARAMETERS table that is under CMT Database.
Below domain names are set in each environment

# *PROD*: CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as BAH_CNG
!image-20230623-060407.png|width=1260,height=248!
# *Pre-live*: CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as BAH_CNG_PRL
!image-20230623-060305.png|width=1273,height=259!
# *Regression*: CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as BAH_CNG_REG
!image-20230623-060448.png|width=1278,height=261!
# SIT, UAT, Performance: CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as ANCILLARY_PRICE.
!image-20230623-060535.png|width=1277,height=216!

So as per this Jira Key stored in Redis was created with name BAH_CNG_PRL for pre-live and that was correct as per the CMT_PARAMETER configuration.

Hi [~accountid:616007b564ff01007180a9c5] could you please confirm on this whether we need to change CNG_DOMAIN_NAME to ANCILLARY_PRICE for higher environment (PROD, Pre-live and Regression).

Thanks & Regards,

Merin Joseph
column1857:
23/Jun/23 10:39 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;no.  Actually it is necessary to set the redis key differently on different environments when the Redis instance in AWS is shared.  For example, reg and dev share the same redis instance, hence they need to write to different keys, and the reg and dev logstash instances pull from their respective keys.

I suggest to have consistent naming, so BAH_CNG_DEV would be better than ANCILLARY_PRICE.

Fyi, if we have multiple dev environments in the future (which we expect), they would need different keys.
column1858:
23/Jun/23 2:05 PM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;Hi [~accountid:616007b564ff01007180a9c5] ,

So in DEV environments itself we had SIT, UAT and Performance.  Could you please advise is it fine to pick the DEV  CNG_DOMAIN_NAME as below.

* SIT - CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as ANCILLARY_PRICE
* UAT -CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as BAH_CNG_DEV
* Performance CNG_DOMAIN_NAME set as BAH_CNG_PERF


Could you please confirm on this?
column1859: 06/Jul/23 3:35 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;cc [~accountid:616007b564ff01007180a9c5] could you please confirm [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] query?

column1856:
23/Jun/23 7:30 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;In dev environments the changes are reflecting after restarts of application server.  
On more analysis we could see that in CMT application the hotel/ vehicle information is taken from HOTEL_PRODUCT_INFO and VEHICLE_PRODUCT_INFO tables that resides under CMT database. On the CMT application startup those table details are fetched form database and storing in the application cache. After that rest of the time in batch application further batch functionalities these tables information are taking from the CMT application cache.  
The hotel/ vehicle refresh jobs are updating the HOTEL_PRODUCT_INFO and VEHICLE_PRODUCT_INFO tables. To reflect the updated table data in CMT application cache we need to restart the application server after the refresh job execution.

column1: CNG is issuing availability requests for travel dates in the past
column45:
I spotted this whilst looking at [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-536|smart-link] but I don’t think it’s directly related.

In the UAT environment I can see quite a lot of errors of the form:

<Error Code="BAH_PAA_9010" EchoToken="tx-08-02-1-bbdb6398-ce25-419e-a2ad-eee00b481efd" ShortText="BAH_PAA_9010" Tag="FLIGHT_IN_PAST">error:FLIGHT_IN_PAST</Error>

An example of this is on 15th May for ancillaryId 74610/ cmt ref 10131. This is an FC search with

*  last modified timestamp of 15-MAY-23 02:29:17 
* departure date of 25-APR-23 00:00:00

I think the cause of this are probably the fixed travel dates. When those travel dates go into the past, I suspect availability requests are still be issued for them. Obviously this is wasted processing to create these requests and to parse the responses. It’s probably likely to be an issue with all propositions.

I would think this doesn’t affect CMT records with rolling dates, as these should always calculate a forward date.

Looking at [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-13|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-13|smart-link] , I believe the intention was that the fixed dates would begin to fire availability requests for the next year, but it doesn’t look like this is the case either.

The best first step is probably to confirm the logic in this area and identify the impact. We can then decide how to proceed.

Jon

column1: Version 1: direct access to elastic search via internal load balancer
column45:
Hi Mark, we realised that we have a requirement for some scheduled jobs that will run on-prem and connect directly to elastic search.  They need to retrieve the private cost data fields that aren’t exposed via the microservices.

This will be on the internal load-balancer only (in the transit vpc), not the external.

The connection needs to be https, but it can terminate on the load-balancer.

It could use any of the elastic search ports 9200-9212 ?

 

It is feasible?

 

Thanks, Nigel

column1: HolidayFinder url MONTH parameter should be based on customers month of departure not arrival (overnight flights)
column45:
Looking at the live APC HolidayFinder  urls, I can see that they are generated using the customers month of departure. Whereas CNG is generating them based on month of arrival. 

Normally this won’t make any difference, but if the customer is travelling on the last day of the month to a destination with overnight flights (eg SYD), CNG will generate urls with  the later month in the url.

The impact of this would be that a customer could search departures on 31st July, and if they followed the Holiday Finder url, they would initially be shown August departures. (because arrival date is in August). The customer would be able to identify and work around this, but it isn’t a good customer experience.

Jon

19/May/23 4:07 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;This will require changes to SOLR API build. Code changes are being analysed at a high level to share the estimates. Once we have the estimates, to be discussed and progressed via CR.



Code change analysis to be completed by 30th May - [~accountid:6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8]  to share estimates
column1858: 30/May/23 5:04 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;Due date updated as 5th June to share the estimates for the build.
column1859:
06/Jun/23 11:25 AM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;Update: Analysis is in progress for FH proposition.

Current SOLR supports javabin for all the below scenarios, for each the response format is also varying

* Normal Scenario with response	
* Normal Scenario with response + echoParams	
* Normal Scenario with response + max rows (2000)	
* Default Scenario with empty docs	
* Normal Scenario with facet response	
* Group response	
* Group response + ngroups	
* Group + ngroups + facet response
* Group + facet response

 We further need to do analysis on how we can support all these scenarios with the current build using java gradle. And the same needs to be cross validated for other propositions too
column1860: 06/Jun/23 2:53 PM;6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8;Based on the below comment from Abinaya as more analysis is required to share the estimates for build, updating due date for this Jira from 5th June to 9th June.

column1: CNG - Batch Jobs - Impacted Component - On Premise Database, Scripts, Scheduler (Cron/Control-M) - ST - Create a batch script for Search request that are struck in burst controller by more than 1 hour.
column45:
Create a batch script for  Search request that are  struck in burst controller by more than 1 hour


As part [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-46|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-46|smart-link] this error should handle through batch scripts.


|*BAH_MHS_1007*|*LONG_RUN_IN_BURST*|*Search request is struck in burst controller by more than 1 hour*|

More details are available in Burst LLD document section 3.12: CNG 46: Logging cache errors

column1856: 09/May/23 3:15 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;This will require technical SIT rather than UAT. Jon
column1857: 05/Sep/23 10:56 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - as part of the creation of this batch job, please can you explain how you intend to identify ancillary ids that are stuck in burst? Thanks - Jon
column1858: 12/Mar/24 10:00 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;[~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] This is identified by ancillary ID  with REQ_STATUS ='BURST_COMPLETED' and last_modified_date is compared with to current time, it is more than to 1 Hour.
column1859:
12/Mar/24 10:29 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - so that check will identify any records where the Burst process part has completed successfully but they haven’t been picked up by the batch controller yet. 

Isn’t it possible that the records could get stuck in other BURST_* statuses as well?

* Anything in BURST_STARTED for an hour would indicate some sort of problem, wouldn’t it? Should we monitor this as well in case the searches get stuck at an earlier stage?
* BURST_RETRY….I’m not sure how long the retry period would last, particularly if multiple retries are reqd. Probably best to leave that out.
* BURST_FAILED isn’t an issue because that’s only used as the end of the retry attempts

Thanks,

Jon
column1860:
21/Mar/24 7:38 AM;62e3f2fd3aaeedcae756b1f3;Hi Sushant,

Please review the script.

Thanks

Riti

21/Mar/24 8:17 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;

column1: (3844) AHP Support Scope
column45:
Hi,

 

Following conversations about AHP support, the current preferred approach is for the DP Support team for the AWS Application plus Coforge for AWS Infra.

 

The next steps are for us to produce a scope document so that we can restart the discussions with Sushang and his team .

 

I’ve started a notebook page to collate our thoughts around this

AHP Support 2023-03-24  ([Web view|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fiairgroup.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FCNG2022-AdditionalPricing%2F_layouts%2FOneNote.aspx%3Fid%3D%252Fsites%252FCNG2022-AdditionalPricing%252FSiteAssets%252FCNG%25202022%2520-%2520Additional%2520Pricing%2520Notebook%26wd%3Dtarget%2528Implementation.one%257C291A7FD9-BC8C-4DFD-9333-305C76EDC708%252FAHP%2520Support%25202023-03-24%257C68AEF8CD-A0CF-4ADF-A7D4-952007F0E522%252F%2529&data=05%7C01%7Cshafiqul.islam%40iaggbs.com%7C16669501fc804f8d8c0508db2c80020b%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C638152700541829768%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Sg3XMTp2Ir0bFv3b8SbfKxS3BCoSmxA56coRP%2F4TPhQ%3D&reserved=0])

*To:* Dan Rowson <[dan.rowson@iaggbs.com|mailto:dan.rowson@iaggbs.com]>
*Subject:* Action Needed: AWS Account Review (reminder)

 

In late March we kicked off an activity to review and update the information held against each of our AWS Accounts. I have included the body of our initial communication below for your reference.

 

According to our records there are still accounts against your name that have not yet been reviewed. We would be grateful if you could spare some time to review those accounts by clicking on the link [here|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fiairgroup.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FIAGTechCloudGuild-AWSAccountOwners%2FLists%2FAWSAO%2FAllItems.aspx&data=05%7C01%7Cshafiqul.islam%40iaggbs.com%7C93ace2fd5a5a459d04d408db41810eab%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C638175794771964996%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MC4X%2BFrYgKysWUGglBNeye%2FDbAXgp1LsZ4ItOHN2JA4%3D&reserved=0].

column1: Inconsistent use of timezone in date fields in CNG fields
column45:
There is inconsistent use of time zone information within date fields in CNG. This may be confusing for users of the APIs where different fields appear with different formats.

Most date fields appear without any timezone information, however some do have Z for UTC (which may not be strictly correct)

Just looking at the FH index (note - need to look in JSON view to see actual date format otherwise Kibana hides this)

@timestamp - format 2023-04-12T11:16:21.751078675*Z*

arrDate - format 2023-04-27T17:25:00.000

arrDateString - format 2023-06-30T06:15:00.000*Z*

depDate - format 2023-05-01T18:20:00.000

depDateString - format 2023-11-13T09:45:00.000*Z*

I would imagine there may be similar issues in the other indices. Can we implement common handling of timezone…it might be easiest for all fields to have no timezone information and to explain in API documentation that all times are based on local times.

This would impact batch controller logic and require a CAPTWO change.

Jon
