column1856: 20/Apr/23 12:20 PM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;Assigning to [~accountid:62e3f1d13780798663d11cff]  for analysis on this timestamp field details.
column1857:
26/Apr/23 12:12 PM;62e3f1d13780798663d11cff;Hi Abinaya

There are in total 4 fields(2 fields in FH and 2 fields in HO) which has Z in it.

Below is the list:

*FH:* 1) arrDateString 2) depDateString

*HO:* 1)checkOutDate 2)checkInDate

Thanks

Amreen Fathima.
column1858: 26/Apr/23 1:51 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;There’s also @timestamp as well  -but I think this is created by Elasticsearch and not the batch controller. Jon
column1859:
05/May/23 12:43 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;From todays discussion:

* Batch controller changes will be made, so that all remaining date fields created by the batch controller containing Z will have this removed
* Another CAPTWO release will be required…but this isn’t the only inclusion that would be needed (Logging changes as well and there will be others)
* @timestamp is different and created by Elasticsearch. No obvious way of removing the Z and BAH accept that
* The Elastic search document actually has 2 sections with field names and values 1) _source and 2) fields- see [https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-fields.html|https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-fields.html|smart-link] 
* 1) contains the values passed into the index (from the batch controller) and 2) contains the values stored in the index. 
* The values in 1) will not have Z, however the values stored in 2) appear to still have the Z. 
* Having discussed this, I don’t believe it’s a problem because the full API is mapping out from the _source section, so end users of the cache won’t see the Z. Also, all the main views in Kibana are showing values from _source as well, so internal users won’t be seeing the Z…and this is consistent with the full API
* The fields values 2) are visible if Kibana users view the document in the JSON extended view format, but I don’t think they will do this very often and the _source values are also visible earlier in the doc
* We might need to be aware of this if we are writing queries in the developer console, where we could retrieve values from either 1) or 2) but I don’t think this causes us problems. It’s just something to be aware of.



We also discussed if the difference in format between @timestamp and the other date fields would cause problems for users of the full API. 

I don’t think this is the case. I would not expect end users of CNG to query CNG using the timestamp field. (although if they supply correct format it should work). There’s also no need for them to compare @timestamp with the other date fields, so that shouldn’t be a problem. It’s main use would be in case we identified that end users were using out of date cached information.

In summary, we will keep with the original approach of applying batch controller changes and just make a note of the other considerations.

Jon
column1860:
10/May/23 12:26 PM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;Update: Timestamp inconsistency are identified for below fields for which we require a batch change.

*FH:* 1) arrDateString 2) depDateString

*HO:* 1)checkOutDate 2)checkInDate

Batch changes are being incorporated as part of [CNG-623|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-623] and it is currently in SIT testing

Boost logic for full API ([https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-946|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-946|smart-link] ) and geodist / geosorting ([https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-655|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-655|smart-link] ) are the ones that I confirmed were not required for day 1.

Jon

11/Apr/23 9:58 AM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Hi [~accountid:6365c865f7ad721e78509db6] below are notes from the APC WG Notebook:

*29-Mar-23:*[SI] 

* Tony/Jon to update the CNG Client Cache Access Summary spreadsheet and forward onto Sushant to investigate how it works from the CAP side. 
* Jon has sent TCS a spreadsheet.   
* Sushant to reach out to Jai for support.
column1857: 20/Apr/23 4:36 PM;6365c865f7ad721e78509db6;This was checked further for Livesite pages and was recommended to do testing in Prelive environment for all pages to be available. This to be coordinated with CTT to avoid affecting any other releases.
column1858:
20/Apr/23 4:39 PM;6365c865f7ad721e78509db6;As was discussed with Jon, Tony, Nigel and Abinaya, following are the updates :

* Expected request flow would be like :

For SOLR-external    :    SFD - *Akamai* - CNG API

For SOLR-internal     :    SFD - *Apache Solr* - Content Proxy - CNG API

For SIP-external        :    Kayak - Akamai - *SIP AI* - CNG API

For SIP-internal         :    No consumers 

* The highlighted component will have the modification to include routing mechanism to new CNG services for required propositions and remaining propositions to continue calling current APC services.
* As the change is being done in actual service invoking component in BA infra, it will reflect for all the internal and external consumers and would be the Initial 're-direct' approach.
* Mid-term and Long-term feasible approach can be discussed with CTTI and then further to be discussed within CNG team.
* For internal consumers, to reduce latency issues, there are few approaches and to be discussed with CTTI – Sushant to schedule meeting.
* For SIT/UAT, as Akamai and AI won’t be available in these environments, so the CNG API urls can be also tested via SOAP-UI and with approach mentioned below.
* For livesite or other consumers, we will try to do changes in DEV environment where all the pages of livesite/ba.com may not be available but some working pages can help in doing testing of various scenarios.
* Once basic flows are working, further testing can be done in Prelive environment for which different scenarios responses can be captured before and after url redirect and then be compared – to be confirmed by Tony.
column1859: 12/May/23 8:48 AM;6365c865f7ad721e78509db6;Details have been explained to CTTI and after the initial discussions, the jira [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/BAHSC-327|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/BAHSC-327|smart-link] has been raised with them for the further tasks.

column1: Deeplink url parameters look to be incorrect
column45:
The relative urls that we are caching look to be incorrect. They do not include any dates so I cannot see how they can trigger a search correctly on the front end. We need to check the other parameters as well, but essentially all the relevant data needs to exist to trigger a valid search on the front end and I think there should also be a price to trigger messaging if / when the pricing changes from the cached value.

Bit surprised this hasn’t shown up in testing. 

Jon

column1856: 06/Apr/23 9:08 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;This needs to be check and keep you posted the updates
column1857: 09/May/23 10:22 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] / [~accountid:6365c88d01c2ff842c1aebc8] - we don’t have a due date for this Jira. Can you please consider when this can be slotted into the delivery plan as this is important for go live. Raising priority to Critical. Jon
column1858: 09/May/23 4:01 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;As this impacts data indexing, we would like to test this with the other elements of 3.1 functionality if possible. Jon
column1859:
11/May/23 2:27 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Just looked at an FH example for ancillaryId 66009 in UAT and it has parameters that I thought were missing.

[http://www.ba.com/travel/fx/public/en_GB/pCode1-US-G14-8831234/?&eId=111077&packageTo=CIT_US_NY_NewY&room1childAge1=12&room1childAge2=13&room1childAge3=16&ojDd=CIT_US_NY_NewY&room1childAge4=4&fromPkg=LON&infantsRoom1=0&saleOption=PAKFH&childrenRoom1=4&roomsRqd=1&flightHotelDate=Y&countryCode=GB&adultsRoom1=2&depCountryPkg=GB&ojGw=CIT_US_NY_NewY&restrictionType=Restricted&totalPrice=15989.0&cabin=M&retDate=02/12/23&currencyCode=GBP&depDate=22/11/23|http://www.ba.com/travel/fx/public/en_GB/pCode1-US-G14-8831234/?&eId=111077&packageTo=CIT_US_NY_NewY&room1childAge1=12&room1childAge2=13&room1childAge3=16&ojDd=CIT_US_NY_NewY&room1childAge4=4&fromPkg=LON&infantsRoom1=0&saleOption=PAKFH&childrenRoom1=4&roomsRqd=1&flightHotelDate=Y&countryCode=GB&adultsRoom1=2&depCountryPkg=GB&ojGw=CIT_US_NY_NewY&restrictionType=Restricted&totalPrice=15989.0&cabin=M&retDate=02/12/23&currencyCode=GBP&depDate=22/11/23]

I will take another look to confirm if I’ve raised this in error or if there are issues that need resolving.

Jon
column1860:
12/May/23 10:42 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Looking further at FH, normally the deeplink url is fine. I’ve been doing searches for the presence of the following additional params:

* cabin
* restrictionType
*  totalPrice
* currencyCode
* depDate
* retDate

There are currently 83231 FH docs in UAT. 

KQL queries of the form *NOT deepLink : "totalPrice"* show that 506 documents don’t have the expected deeplinks parameters

Where as *deepLink : "totalPrice"* returns 82725.  So the logic is in place and the vast majority of the urls have been created with expected params. However there looks to be an issue for a small subset where these params are not present for some reason.

I sampled a few urls with these additional params present, and these look like they are working.

I will do similar checks for the other propositions.

Jon
column1861:
12/May/23 2:18 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;2 FH examples with the missing deeplink params 

AncillaryId 64410 LON - SYD

AncillaryId 65748 LON - AKL

Last example is from 10th April

----

For FC there are 46277 documents, of which the vast majority 46251 have the expected url params. Checking a few of these, they appear to work ok.

There are 26 examples where something is missing. This appears to just be the totalPrice parameter, the other params are present. These have old timestamps from 31/3/2023 and are all for the same ancillaryId 74267. This may potentially be an historic issue which has now been fixed. 

Jon
column1862:
12/May/23 3:20 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I’ve checked the parameters for HO and CO urls and can’t see any problems with them.

Jon
column1863:
16/May/23 11:01 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;For the FH and FC examples with deeplink issue, they don’t have totalPrice populated either. It therefore looks like something more general has gone wrong with the availability response of handling of it.

I have seen some failures for these ancillaryIds in the logs, but the @timestamp field hasn’t moved on. This indicates that Elasticsearch hasn’t been updated and the absence of deeplink params and totalPrice is historic rather than caused by the latest run.



[~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - 2 questions for you:

If an availability response was correctly constructed, but we had problems extracting some fields eg totalPrice, would this result in the document being written into Elasticsearch with missing fields? I do think we allow this for some fields, but I would expect totalPrice to always be populated. 

In the scenario where results already exist and we are overwriting them, we would clear all previous results from the cache wouldn’t we? There wouldn’t be a scenario where we would retain +some+ of the old data if we hit problems, would there?

Thanks,

Jon
column1864:
16/May/23 5:07 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Looking at one of the affected FH ancillary Ids in detail - 64417

* It has a future travel date, so it returns availability
* only M cabin results were returned in the availability response, but all those look to have been handled correctly
* the older timestamp bookings with data problems are for other cabins W + C, which explains why they have been retained. (no availability to overwrite them with, and no clear down job running in UAT to purge old data)
* This confirms that it was an historic issue that caused the problem and not something occurring on every run.

Looking wider, the affected records have quite a few fields that are missing not just deepllink and totalPrice (eg currencyCode, display fields, headline fields, flightReference etc). I’m therefore assuming that CNG rec’d an availability response that it had difficulty handling, but we can’t confirm this without the availability response.

This could be due to an occasional rogue response, but given there are different timestamps and it seems to always be LON-SYD, I think we should monitor this.

I’m also not sure that we should be caching CNG data if there’s no totalPrice - we can’t use any of the data for thatdocument.

Jon
column1865:
16/May/23 5:11 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Merin,

Just re-adding my logic queries for you so they are the last comment. Could you please confirm:

* If an availability response was correctly constructed, but we had problems extracting some fields eg totalPrice, would this result in the document being written into Elasticsearch with missing fields? I do think we allow this for some (but not all) fields, but I would expect totalPrice to always be populated.
* In the scenario where results already exist and we are overwriting them, we would clear all previous results from the cache wouldn’t we? There wouldn’t be a scenario where we would retain +some+ of the old data if we hit problems, would there?

Thanks,

Jon
column1866:
18/May/23 12:41 PM;6392214d3c26ca7fa0d75c1d;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] ,

To answer your last comment,

* If we have values in the availability response we will map the values to the respective fields in the Elasticsearch if not the field will be empty.
* No ,currently we are not overwriting them instead we will display the result with latest timestamp.

 As for the totalPrice ,we are mapping the value of displayTotalPrice to that of totalPrice in deeplink.

If localFeeIncluded is true then value of HeadLineTotalPrice(value of {{HeadlinePackagePriceForFlight}} in flight tag) is mapped to displayTotalPrice, if not the field will be empty.

When we checked the deeplink of ancillary id’s without totalprice/dep/retDate etc. we found that the all pricing related fields are empty. As you can see, the ancillary id :64389 had all values even though the cabin is C .So, this has happened only when the required values in OJ Response was empty and as per our observation this issue has occurred especially on April 9 and April10.

!image-20230518-110914.png|width=440,height=219!

!image-20230518-110929.png|width=435,height=214!

Search Link for the above images: [Discover - Elastic (baplc.com)|http://bhdev56.baplc.com:10081/kibana/app/discover#/?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:'2023-04-01T00:00:00.000Z',to:'2023-04-12T23:30:00.000Z'))&_a=(columns:!(deepLink,totalPrice,depDate,overallCabin,retCabinCode,requestedCabinCodes,displayTotalPrice,localFeesIncluded,headlineTotalPrice,headlineCombineAndSave,headlinePricePP,ancillaryID,sequenceNumber,flightArrDate_4_I),filters:!(),grid:(columns:('@timestamp':(width:123),deepLink:(width:1272),displayTotalPrice:(width:141),headlineCombineAndSave:(width:181),headlinePricePP:(width:128),headlineTotalPrice:(width:141),localFeesIncluded:(width:123),overallCabin:(width:104),requestedCabinCodes:(width:159),retCabinCode:(width:114),totalPrice:(width:83))),index:'6d37f7fa-7020-4121-84b0-4faf410b44f8',interval:auto,query:(language:kuery,query:'overallCabin%20:C'),sort:!(!('@timestamp',desc)))]

Looking at ancillaryid:64417([Discover - Elastic (baplc.com)|http://bhdev56.baplc.com:10081/kibana/app/discover#/?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:now-1y%2Fd,to:now))&_a=(columns:!(deepLink,totalPrice,depDate,overallCabin,retCabinCode,requestedCabinCodes,displayTotalPrice,localFeesIncluded,headlineTotalPrice,headlineCombineAndSave,headlinePricePP,ancillaryID,sequenceNumber,flightArrDate_4_I),filters:!(),grid:(columns:('@timestamp':(width:123),deepLink:(width:1272),displayTotalPrice:(width:141),headlineCombineAndSave:(width:181),headlinePricePP:(width:128),headlineTotalPrice:(width:141),localFeesIncluded:(width:123),overallCabin:(width:104),requestedCabinCodes:(width:159),retCabinCode:(width:114),totalPrice:(width:83))),index:'6d37f7fa-7020-4121-84b0-4faf410b44f8',interval:auto,query:(language:kuery,query:'ancillaryID%20:64417'),sort:!(!('@timestamp',desc)))] ,we could see that the values are missing only for C and not for M or W cabin especially for sequence number 159 which explains that the pricing values are not present in the OJ Response.

!image-20230518-112421.png|width=435,height=197!

!image-20230518-112606.png|width=433,height=204!



In [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-421|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-421|smart-link] we have updated the mandatory condition logic in which we don’t have totalPrice /pricing details as a mandatory condition/mandatory fields. So, if this needs to be done shall we do this in a separate Jira ? 

We are further analyzing the code to check the logic of fetching the pricing details and will update in the Jira.

Please let us know your suggestion on this.

Thanks,

Pooja
column1867:
18/May/23 1:30 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Pooja,

I agree that this has turned out to be a general issue with extracting data from the availability response, rather than anything specific to deeplinks.

I think maybe I didn’t explain my second question clearly enough. In the scenario where a CNG key already exists in the index, and the search is re-executed as part of the next run. I believe CNG would update all the fields in that document for the latest values (even if they were missing). I don’t think we would ever hold on to any of the previous values in the document would we?

It is also clear that it doesn’t happen most of the time (niche scenario) and the availability response that was rec’d must have been missing quite a lot of data.

Wrt [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-421|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-421|smart-link] , totalPrice was never mentioned in that discussion…so I’m assuming that it has never been checked in that way? I’m just thinking that it might cause problems for downstream users if we cache results with no prices. I’ll check that with Martin Brine.

I suspect that the issue was that certain cabins didn’t price on certain dates. When I sent thru a SOAP UI request that matched ancillaryId, all the (100) flight itineraries returned were M cabin only. ie there were so many M itinerary options, that there was no room left for the other cabins…so no priced itineraries or package level pricing for the other cabins.

Jon
column1868:
22/May/23 9:26 AM;6392214d3c26ca7fa0d75c1d;Hi Jon,

Yes . If a CNG key already exists in the index and if the search is re-executed in the next run ,we will update/replace with latest values. If any one of previous CNG key is a unique one when compared to latest CNG key then that particular pricing document will be available.

Please let us know your updates on total price once you get the updates from Martin Brine.

Pooja
column1869:
07/Jun/23 11:46 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Actually I think the reason for the problem is slightly different and as a result it’s more general. LON - SYD didn’t have any rows in cabin_upgrades_upgrade table to request additional cabins. As a result only M cabin is returned, with nothing for W and C cabins. CNG is still trying to cache details for W and C cabins despite the fact that no availability has been returned for them. This leads to lost of missing fields including price. So this problem could affcet anyroute not setup to return additional cabins in xDist.

One of the knock on impacts is that the deeplink url cannot be properly formed, but it’s not the major issue.

I will raise a new Jira for the issue of storing data in CNG when we do not actually have availability or prices.

Jon
column1870:
08/Jun/23 9:27 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Jira [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-777|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-777|smart-link]  raised for storing results when we do not have prices. This should generally prevent storing results when we cannot get prices from the availability response, including the issue here that affected the deeplinks. 

[~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1] no technical delivery is reqd for this Jira, but I would like to keep it open so that we can do some dedicated testing on deeplinks, probably after 777 is delivered (TBC)

Jon
column1871: 13/Jun/23 10:07 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Changing status to UAT. Jon

column1859:
27/Jul/23 5:58 PM;712020:8d138859-363b-4f27-8fcb-f73aeda9b37f;Hi [~accountid:6422c457407493675d482097] 

Are the two not different i.e AWS Inspector and SonarQube?

From AWS "Amazon Inspector is a vulnerability management service that continuously scans your AWS workloads for software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure", it has not going to do anything with code debt and code maintenance.  Looks like both (AWS Inspector and SonarQube) are two different tools and complement each other.

AWS Inspector as in the chat *CNG/APH TCS & Version 1*, may be available as default with the AMI (after moving to ECP).  

SonarQube is required to make sure code quality and identify any code debts which should be integrated with the dev/test pipeline so that whenever build happens (where all the merged code present), code coverage happens.

Surya
column1860:

column1865: 29/Feb/24 10:27 AM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Adding [~accountid:712020:dae1f66a-88d8-4931-bb2f-05a42a6dd1d1] for awareness.
column1866:
01/Mar/24 5:28 PM;712020:dae1f66a-88d8-4931-bb2f-05a42a6dd1d1;[~accountid:635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20]  [~accountid:5d14ba9bbda1410bc8e04883] [~accountid:712020:b846cd8c-69cd-498e-9221-cf5454894f31] 

We have started to update the pipeline in the _bah-cng-common-lib_ to integrate with SonarCloud. However we noticed Unit rests are failing so we cannot complete the SonarCloud integration. Please see the below coverage result from SonarCloud which illustrates this.

column1: CNG - All API- Impacted Component - Elastic Search, Kibana - Confirm how to update Index Mappings for CNG without wiping out indexed data
column45:
Up until now, when we have made field mapping changes to an index, this has resulted in the data within the index being lost. This would be problematic after go live, where it would take significant time to re-populate the index - so we want to fins a way around this if possible.

My assumption is that it should be possible to update the index structure without losing data.

The scope of this task would be:

* Identify how to update the index w/o losing data
* Trial this process in a sublive env to validate t works as expected
* This should be done prior to go live

Jon

column1858:
10/May/23 9:03 AM;63a38a924bc858b303cbec94;[^CNG-518.docx]

Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] 

We have analyzed how to update Index Mappings for CNG without wiping out indexed data and how to rename existing field in index mapping. You can find the procedure for the same in the attached document.

Thanks

Ketaki
column1859:
10/May/23 9:45 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:63a38a924bc858b303cbec94] - thanks for the update and it confirms that what we want to do is possible. as a matter of interest, have you tried this out yet?

I’m just thinking about what the process for applying index changes would look like:

* this starts by copying the current index to a new name, where the amendments can be made. 
* So temporarily we would have 2 copies of a data in the index - until we delete the initial index. 
* We would make the changes initially in a test environment and try them out there. *I’m not sure if we would need to delete the initial index data almost immediately or if it could be retained for a period whilst the 2nd version of the index was amended and tested in case we needed to revert. How does space allocation / chargeability work in the Cloud?*
* For live we should be able to run the statements we used in test to 1) create 2nd version of index 2) Amend required fields in the index and 3) Delete the original index. So there would only be a short period where 2 copies of the index and data existed.

Can we look to trial these commands the next time we need to make changes to the index?

Thanks,

Jon
column1860:
23/May/23 11:50 AM;63a38a924bc858b303cbec94;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] ,

Yes we have tried it out and it works fine.
The process for applying index changes would look like:

# Yes, this starts by copying the current index to a new name, where the amendments can be made.
# It's not mandatory that we delete our initial index immediately, it can be retained until we want to delete it. But there will be duplication of indexed data in both the index that is older and newer index until we delete any one of the index.
# In case we want to revert back to initial index, we can use the same *reindexing* query and just change the source and destination index name in the query as per the requirement.

Also we have analyzed some other approaches for various scenarios. Please find the same in attached document,

[^CNG-518 V01.docx]

Thanks

Ketaki
column1861:
23/May/23 12:06 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Thanks Ketaki - so this has effectively been system tested and is ready for UAT. [~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1] -can you put this Jira onto the list for UAT.

I do think that we need some discussions about the practicality of doing this in live when we have very large datasets, to see if this causes additional constraints. 

Jon
column1862:
09/Jun/23 3:03 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Currently being tried on CO index in UAT environment by Abinaya.

Jon
column1863:
26/Jun/23 1:42 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Abinaya - this hasn’t been updated for a while. Are you happy that the test on the CO index was successful? If so, I don’t think there’s any additional benefit in Tony doing UAT…it’s more of a system change anyway.

We should still have discussions around the practicality of doing this when larger datasets are involved.

Jon
column1864: 06/Jul/23 4:04 PM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;[~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] - team has done re-indexing for CO and all the other propositions and shared the results in [[CNG-796] SIT-Different Data types Observed in SIT KIBANA and e2e Data Mapping - Jira (atlassian.net)|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-796] - please advise the next steps
column1865:
06/Jul/23 4:39 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:616007b564ff01007180a9c5] . As per the process Ketaki describes, this process temporarily creates a second copy of the index and the index details are then changed in one of the copies. This means that we would temporarily need to store double the data in the Cloud until we had completed this activity.

Do you think this is practical once we are in live once we have high volumes of data? I’m not really sure how space allocation / charging works in the Cloud and the practicalities of having a very large - but temporary - change in data volume.

Thanks,

Jon
column1866: 06/Jul/23 4:53 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;yes.  it should be easy to add disk in AWS. [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/modify-ebs-volume-on-instance.html|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/modify-ebs-volume-on-instance.html|smart-link]  (Although, I think the file system snapshot doesn’t work for rolling back with Elastic Search. Instead you have to make an elastic search index snapshot. using more storage of course, more likely S3 [https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-aws-custom-repository.html|https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-aws-custom-repository.html|smart-link] )
column1867: 06/Jul/23 4:58 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;shrinking the EBS afterwards once we no longer need the double storage might be more difficult
column1868:
06/Jul/23 5:12 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Thanks Nigel,

So it sounds like the overall idea is viable, but we need to work out the best way of doing this in live. 

I’d suggest we try this this once we are quiet live and have some data volume. As part of this we can research the best way of increasing & reducing space allocation and then test it out. We don’t have to do this now.

Jon
column1869:
06/Jul/23 5:14 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;[~accountid:635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20] - I don’t think there’s any value creating an additional Jira for the later work, I think we can just carry this Jira forward and update it (ie Labels). Sound ok? Who shall we allocate this task to for later on?

Jon
column1870: 06/Jul/23 5:40 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Agreed to leave this with Shaf for the meantime.  Will assign labels later. Jon
column1871: 05/Jan/24 4:39 PM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] , is there anything for TCS to do for this Jira?
column1872:

As per my 6th July 2023 comment, I still think there’s some technical work to do in order to confirm that the process is viable for larger datasets in the live environment. Who do you think would be best placed to do this, TCS? We’ll also need to capture the process for the relevant support  team.

Thanks,

Jon
column1873: 05/Jan/24 5:58 PM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Hi Jon , is there a business requirements Jira for this?  I would have thought a CR would be required to make such changes to a live system.
column1874:
08/Jan/24 9:42 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Shaf,

There’s no business requirement for this, but I would expect that when we implement new technology we know how to make changes if they are reqd. Given the amount of data, this is likely to be reqd at some point in BAU.

Yes, a CR would need to be raised at the time that changes were required, but I think we should go live with a process to enable such changes. Part of this has been done (commands to update the index mapping) but the space allocation tasks Nigel has mentioned haven’t been tried and documented.

Jon
column1875:
08/Jan/24 1:48 PM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Hi Jon,

This sounds like a potential application support requirement. column1: Incorrect data in flight matrix fields (e.g. aircraft_2_O, aircraft_2_I etc.) for FC ABCBA to Paris
column45:
Afternoon,

In Kibana, I’ve found a FC ancillaryID (73314) that is a multisector flight route (ABCBA) to Paris where the flight matrix fields aren’t being populated correctly. The expectation is that the numbers increment with each flight leg, but for this example that’s not what’s happened.

The ancillaryID for this is 73314, CMT ID 10113.

The route is NYC-LHR-CDG and using the ‘aircraft_*’ fields as an example, I would expect the following fields to be populated;

{quote}*Expected:* aircraft_1_O, aircraft_2_O, aircraft_3_I, aircraft_4_I

*Actual:* aircraft_1_O, aircraft_2_O, *aircraft_2_I*, *aircraft_3_I*{quote}

Both the 2_O and 2_I fields are populated which then seems to have a knock on effect and all subsequent numbered fields are incorrect. This issue can be seen for other flight matrix fields too, e.g. airlineMetal_*, cabinCode_* etc.

This issue doesn’t appear to impact all FC ABCBA routes as I can see examples to Sydney (ancillaryID 73351) where the fields are correct. The issue also doesn’t seem to impact FH, but I haven’t checked this extensively.

Please can this be investigated?

Thanks,

Dale

column1857:
16/Jun/23 2:32 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;This is done. BA private IPs are NAT-ted to 23.239.128.1

per BT:

“Our resolver team has checked and advised as follows: As checked on the firewall the traffic from the source subnet 10.X.X.X/8 when routed toward the AWS destination side 100.64.43.128/26 and 100.64.43.64/26 we only have a NAT object 23.239.128.1 configured on the firewall to translate the communication.”

For info, it appears that the firewall only restricts source/destination/port, not the service.  So we can actually connect by http. For the time being this is convenient since we haven’t been able to set up the certificates yet (this is dependent on DNS change to NS records). 

{noformat}C:\WINDOWS\system32>curl http://100.64.43.173:5601/kibana/app/home
<!DOCTYPE html><html lang="en"><head><meta charSet="utf-8"/><meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge,chrome=1
"/><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width"/><title>Elastic</title><style>
…{noformat}

However it is not what we agreed with BA cyber - they insisted on https.  I have followed up with BT and had a meeting, they insist this is a limitation of the firewall, it does not inspect the traffic only the source, destination and port.  (btw, google tells me that checkpoint does have the ability to check the “protocol signature”, if so presumably this is not something we use, perhaps because of performance impact or some other reason, I don’t really know much about firewalls.)

column1: CNG - Batch (CAPTWO) - Impacted Component - Service -CMT - Unable to load searches with OJ location types other than city for FH and HO propositions. APC can do this. - Not In Scope for TCS
column45:
Merin has explained that the current FH and HO CMT validation logic for OJ_city_code looks to match this code against the BAH_LOCATIONS table with BAH_LOCATION_TYPE= city (BAH_LOCATIONS data originates from xLocation)

This is a new restriction and currently we are able to load other location types (eg country, state, neighbourhood, airport) in APC, so we have lost functionality with CNG.

I think this has probably occurred because the requirement [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-16|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-16|smart-link] keeps mentioning city (rather than a more generic search location) but it doesn’t ask for a restriction on location type to be imposed.

How much effort would be required to resolve this issue? It’s possible we might be able to amend the data in xlocation to work around the issue but ideally it would be fixed.

----

FYI - there’s a similar restriction for FC and CO that the location type must be airport. I think this is fine and we always knew these were tied to airport locations.

----

column1: CMT - unexpected handling of First and Last Travel dates when adding End Exec date
column45:
This situation came about whilst I was trying to add End dates to all CMT entries in UAT, to stop searches being executed.

For records that didn’t previously have End Dates I was adding them for todays date 18/1/2023. System didn’t want to accept End Dates w/o start dates but I could work around that ok by adding start date of today as well. That worked fine for rolling searches (w/o specified travel dates).

When I came to try to add End dates for ones with specified travel dates…I hit problems with those where the last travel date was in the past.

I could update the records ok, but when I tried to set them to review this was blocked with and 2 different types of errors.

Firstly system won’t accept the existing +unchanged+ values in first and last travel date

* error 'First travel date is out of range, please select new date, Last travel date is out of range,'

Secondly the system won’t accept changes to Start and End exec dates when these are later than the first and last travel dates

* Start execution date must be before first travel date
* End execution date cannot be future than last travel date

----

Thoughts on this:

* does the CMT validation check every field including those that haven’t been amended?
* I think the current situation means that any attempted updates to CMT records with specified travel dates will be prevented once these travel dates have passed
* First and last travel dates are specified in CMT w/o year…the idea being that the searches could be left and start to run for the next year once to came into system range. However the validation is specifically assuming that these are 2022 dates and in the past. So there’s something here that isn’t correct.
* Does the above issue mean that we have any problems with the actual searches running again for the next year? I’m hoping this should have been tested and was ok.
* How much testing generally has been done on amending CMT entries? 

[~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1] -  can you advise on the last 2 points.

----

At the moment I would just like to understand the situation. Maybe we can live with it.

Thanks,

Jon

column1859:
24/Jan/23 10:04 AM;63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] ,

CMT logic for First travel date, Last travel date, Start execution date, End execution date are given below;

1.First Travel date should be greater than current date, else it will show the error message  as ”*First travel date is out of range, please select new date”* .

2.Last Travel date should be greater than current date, else it will show the error message  as “*Last travel date is out of range, please select new date”* .

3.First Travel date should be greater or equal to start execution date, else it will show the  error message   as “*Start Execution date must be before First travel date”*

4.Last Travel date should be greater or equal to End execution date, else it will show the  error message   as “*End Execution Date cannot be future than Last Travel Date”* . 

First travel date, Last travel date, Start execution date, End execution date  is validated by considering the year .

Thanks & Regards,

Abdul Kader Nabil.
column1860:
24/Jan/23 12:37 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef] ,

Thanks for the update.

1.Can you confirm that the logic you’ve described is the same regardless of whether the values in these fields already existed or is newly entered by editing in CMT?

2.When I look in the DB for the dates stored for first and last fixed travel date, they all have been stored with a year. (eg FIRST_DEPARTURE_DATE and LAST_DEPARTURE_DATE in the parent_cmt_fh table).Does the CMT logic simply extract the value from the DB…and in the situation where the value isn’t amended…does it just try to reinsert the same value?  ie there is no consideration that the start and end dates may be applicable for future years?

Thanks,

Jon
column1861:
27/Jan/23 12:13 PM;63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef;[~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] Hi Jon.

1.yes,it is same for new and amended records for  cmt logic.

2.yes,the cmt logic only extracts the  travel date from the DB when it is not amended .When it amend, the travel date and execution date will be update in [DB. At|http://DB.At] the same time,It will not  consider the execution date  be a future date compare to travel date.For example:19/11/2022 as 19/11 for First travel date,29/11/2022 as 29/11 for last travel date,21/1/2023, 30/1/2023 for start and end execution date respectively.Here it is not assuming the  travel and execution date as same [year. It|http://year.It] will show error message because of that.If the first and last travel date is 19/11/2023 and 29/11/2023,ii will be committed.
column1862:
27/Jan/23 2:58 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Thanks [~accountid:63a52e287cde7bff9d77afef] 

So I think we have business workarounds for this issue.

When trying to add an End Exec date to an existing record with +specified travel dates+ that are +earlier in the year+, it will be necessary to:

* *Add a Start Exec date as well.* In the situation where we just want to suspend the search as soon as possible, setting both start and end exec dates to the current date will work in CMT
* *Make an update to the First travel date field to be a future date.* On the assumption that the business wanted to keep the same fixed calendar dates for the next year, they would need to use the calendar selection to pick the same first travel date +for the next year+.
* *Make an update to the Last travel date in the same manner* as per First travel date

When trying to add an End Exec date to a Rolling Search, the situation is easier and the business would just need to do the first step from above ie add a valid Start Exec date.

These CMT updates would allow the users to add end dates to stop execution, but also retain the details of the search for them to be run again next year. (avoiding them having to delete and then recreate the search next year.). *It would not take long for them to do this but we would want to document it as a workaround.* 

[~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1]  - I think we should do some testing around this area within the test plan for 3.2. From our discussion, it sounded like most of the  CMT amendment testing had been keeping the same basic structure of the record and updating values. So I think we need some tests where like adding values into fields that hadn’t been populated before and others removing values from ones that had. 

On a separate note, we should also test that if an unamended CMT record with fixed travel dates is left in the CMT, that the searches are triggered again next year.  (Something you haven’t ben able to test yet). We might need TCS to play with the system date or something else to trigger that test. 



Thanks,

Jon

column1: CNG - All API, Housekeeping - Impacted Component - Elastic Search, Kibana, Lambda - Identify if we can delete unwanted data from the index using existing ELS / Kibana functionality
column45:
There is no specific business requirement to deliver a mechanism to purge unwanted data from the CNG index. However Nigel has suggested that this might be a good idea in case we hit problems where the cached data is unreliable.

Kibana does have functionality called delete by querying that theoretically could be used to do this.

[https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs.html|https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs.html|smart-link]

It would be worth investigating this or alternative mechanisms to see 

* how well they work with small both small deletions
* same for mass deletions
* how  user friendly the API is using likely criteria for deletion
* whether there were any knock-on problems with the index after running them. (eg if we delete a specific ancillary id, can data be created again for the same ancillary id w/o issues).

Jon

column1: (3844) - Informational Logging - Batch Controller (CAPTWO)
column45:
[https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-69|https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-69] discusses logging error conditions from the batch controller.

In addition to this, the BAH Support team need visibility of any deliberate decisions made by the Batch Controller not to cache results for a particular ancillary id / product. In the following JIRAs we discussed criteria that needed to be met for the different propositions

[https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-421|https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-421] - FH 

[https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-444|https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-444] - FC

[https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-457|https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-457] - HO 

[https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-458|https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-458] - CO

If a decision is made to exclude a product based on these (or any other rules) then the following should be logged as a minimum:

* ancillaryId 
* product id
* reason that it was excluded

Ideally we would log the cngKey value (if it is available) which would take care of the first 2.

These informational entries in the log should be clearly distinguishable from error scenarios.

It is not required to log the following:

* If the lookup of reference data for a particular field failed...but this did not prevent the product being cached *(Confirmed)*
* anything for non-selected rates / products in the availability response - we never expected those to be cached

Thanks,

Jon
column1856:
03/Nov/22 10:30 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c],

Can I ask you to think about the 2nd to last point in the Description - ie potentially logging when the lookup of ref data has failed but it did not prevent caching.

*I am correct that this situation exists aren't I?*

My initial view is that we wouldn't log this because:
 * If reqd, we could query Kibana to identify empty reference data fields
 * I'm not sure how useful the data would be without actually implementing it
 * I think it would lead to lots of data and repetition within the log - if an ancillary id bursts 50 searches then the product with a problem would probably get flagged 50 times..+.every time+ the ancillary id was triggered.
 * Depending on the issue, we might not be able to rectify the issue with the source data anyway ie we don't always control the source data

*Is there anything that I've missed, or do you agree with this?*

If so, we'll keep that out of scope and rely on ad-hoc manual queries when needed.

Thanks,

Jon

column1865:

I assume that we will continue to cache other hotels from the same availability response (assuming hotel lookup is successful)? If that is the case, I agree with the logic. If this hotel lookup fails, we would be missing quite a few fields for the hotel (eg hotel description) and not have sufficient info to sell the package effectively.  

I’ve looked at some examples in SIT in the evm-bahem-Error log and it looks like we are clearly outputting the ancillaryId and the reason the product was excluded. 

What we are missing is something that would uniquely identify the affected product / cngKey. At the moment we would know that an ancillaryId has problems -  possibly multiple ones - but we wouldn’t be able to identify the products. 

The other point is a general one for all logging. These messages are being written out as WARN level…will this level be enabled in live? If not, we will need to write them out as actual errors to make them visible.

Thanks,

column1865: 13/Dec/23 11:31 PM;635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358], does this Jira ticket need to be delivered as part of this project?
column1866:
14/Dec/23 8:56 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20] - This does not need to be delivered before go live. 

In the brief discussions we had with Nigel about this, it does not sound a simple change. He was recommending that the best way of handling multiple images would be to change the structure of how we hold images within the cache. His thoughts were that rather than storing the same images against multiple sets of search results, it would make sense to hold the images once in a separate part of the cache. 

The change also has knock-on implications for batch controller and full API to retrieve and send multiple images. So it’s not something to do as a quick fix immediately after go live either.

I’d already labelled this as Not-Day1.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: CNG - Batch (CAPTWO) - Impacted Component - Service, Database, XDistributor -Additional Flight Selling Engine data needs to be setup to support IB brand CNG
column45:
Sushant has reported that IB brand queries from CNG to xDist are not returning availability and erroring.

Errors of the following form are being seen on the OJ side after the Package availability request is sent:

<Error Code="BAH_PAA_1003" EchoToken="tx-08-01-1-56d467b4-0796-4aa9-bf72-812889730ece" Tag="CALL_TO_PROVIDER_SERVICE_FAILED"/>

This is being returned from the Air Low Fare Search and is causing general PCK.001 availability errors in xDist.

Upon investigation by Nigel & Shyam, this looks to be because there is insufficient data on the BA side to determine which flight engine should be used for the requests (IB brand searches with Source="APC").

Shyam advised the additional data is required in the following tables.
 
Table : SELLING_ENGINES, ROUTE_ENGINE_MAPPING.
 
This task looks to have 2 parts:
1. Setup of additional data in order to allow UAT and e2e testing (TCS deliverable)
2. Implementation task to confirm exact data updates reqd with Commercial (if diff to the above) and then use BA BAU process via Matt Kelso & Tom Reynolds to load data into live
 Jon
column1856:
29/Jun/22 5:50 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Paraphrased from the email discussion....

---------------
Testing with the FH-IB-Request-JF.xml message
 * Initial send with  AirlineBrand="IB" and source="APC" - gives following errors:
 *  <Errors>
            <Error Code="BAH_PAA_1003" EchoToken="tx-08-01-1-56d467b4-0796-4aa9-bf72-812889730ece" Tag="CALL_TO_PROVIDER_SERVICE_FAILED"/>
            <Error Code="BAH_PAA_1003" EchoToken="tx-08-01-1-be02c816-c858-4bb4-a0c1-d6c23bc308aa" Tag="CALL_TO_PROVIDER_SERVICE_FAILED"/>
            <Error Code="PCK.001"/>         </Errors>
 * *Note this isn't the same error as Sushant has reported*

 * Removing the source="APC" and resending - returns availability
 * Changing the brand to BA and resending - returns availability
 * Keeping brand = BA and adding in source="APC" - returns availability
So for this test, the APC attribute appears to control whether we get IB availability, however...
 
Testing with FH-BA_REQUEST (1).xml message
 
 * Initial send with AirlineBrand="BA"  , source="APC" - returns availability
 * Updating AirlineBrand="IB" and refiring - gives following errors 
 *   <Errors>
            <Error Code="BAH_PAA_1003" EchoToken="tx-08-02-1-e901858d-434c-482d-b256-7a9d32b45d75" Tag="CALL_TO_PROVIDER_SERVICE_FAILED"/>
            <Error Code="BAH_PAA_1003" EchoToken="tx-08-01-1-66c41269-61c1-4fcd-8e13-ffa9a38cde94" Tag="CALL_TO_PROVIDER_SERVICE_FAILED"/>
            <Error Code="PCK.001"/>         </Errors>

 * Removing source="APC" and refiring makes no difference. This returns the same errors as above and is different to the equivalent test with previous file
 * I wondered if this was related to them having different destinations. So, I replace all CITY_DXB_AE with CITY_BCN_ES, still no source parameter. This still returns availability
 * Re-added in the source="APC" parameter and resend, still returns availability

Jon

Nigel

 

-----------
Yes. We have to insert more rows for IB airline brand with a APC channel into the selling engine configurations table.
 
Schema : SSE08_E2E_DATA
 
Table : SELLING_ENGINES
 
Example entries,
Insert into SELLING_ENGINES (AIRLINE_IATA_CODE,CHANNEL,SELLING_ENGINE,ORDER_PREF,TRANSACTION_LIMIT,TRANSACTIONS,GRP_OVERRIDE_ID,COMPLEX) values ('BA','APC','FlexPricer',1,500000,0,0,'N')/
Insert into SELLING_ENGINES (AIRLINE_IATA_CODE,CHANNEL,SELLING_ENGINE,ORDER_PREF,TRANSACTION_LIMIT,TRANSACTIONS,GRP_OVERRIDE_ID,COMPLEX) values ('BA','APC','FlexPricer',1,500000,0,0,'Y')
 
We also need to add entries into ROUTE_ENGINE_MAPPING.
 
[http://cap-subversion.baplc.com/svn/repos/CAPTWO/captwo-database-changes/08/2018-SEP-CAP2-COM8-30/common/sse/02_ROUTE_ENGINE_MAPPING_BAH.sql|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcap-subversion.baplc.com%2Fsvn%2Frepos%2FCAPTWO%2Fcaptwo-database-changes%2F08%2F2018-SEP-CAP2-COM8-30%2Fcommon%2Fsse%2F02_ROUTE_ENGINE_MAPPING_BAH.sql&data=05%7C01%7Cjon.funnell%40holidays.ba.com%7Cb525bdb8f00a4d14462508da59caddcb%7Cddd66cceffe14029967c5e15ef73127f%7C0%7C0%7C637921025080031952%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=g0fzbWZ4rjeiIpfq6VFZI0Np9vlCUvkUZAZwGX9dP18%3D&reserved=0]
 
This table supports various configuration types e.g REGION-REGION , CITY-CITY , COUNTRY-COUNTRY etc..
All our entries are REGION-REGION.
 
The above tables are managed by BA RevMan and they can update them using DMT.
Matt Kelo/Tom Renolds from BA RevMan can add this in live after our testing in e2e.
 
Shyam
 
----------

column1: CNG - Batch Jobs - Impacted Component - On Premise Database - Refactor the current midnight refresh and housekeep jobs to match the expected functionality
column45:
1) The Current midnight refresh jobs are working partially and need to enhanced to meet the expected functionalities. 

a) Its not handling the selling range validation (355 days) and inserting into ancillary tables for next year.

b) The implementation for first and last travel date is  not working .

c) The duplication check before inserting into ancillary tables are not complete

d) The expiry time logic is not done correctly.

These need to be corrected in all 4 refresh stored procs. (cmt_refresh.refresh_anc_fh, cmt_refresh.refresh_anc_ho, cmt_refresh.refresh_anc_fc, cmt_refresh.refresh_anc_co).

 

2) The existing housekeeping jobs is handling only deletion of records which is done through CMT GUI. Its not handling the a) deletion of records having old departure dates b) deletion of records when it reacheds end execution date. This logic need to be amended. in CMT_HOUSEKEEPING_Jobs package.

column1: (3844) - New (Full) API for Internal & External Consumers
column45:
_This is a high level 'Umbrella' requirement for the Full API - the detailed reqs are actually split across many different JIRAs_

 

*Background:*

Internal and External users currently make use of cached data from the APC but they will need to move to querying CNG instead. As well as providing backwards compatible interfaces to CNG, a new more comprehensive API is also required.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all authorised users of APC / CNG cached data (new, future, internal & external) to be able to make use of a new API *so that* they can benefit from the additional functionality it provides.

 

*High Level Acceptance criteria:*
 * Full API will return all existing APC data fields unless here's been a specific agreement that data is not longer required (eg https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-339 )
 * Full API will return all requested new data fields unless these fields have been categorised as sensitive data (https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-84 )
 * Full API will have relevant data security (https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-391, https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-87)
 * All existing APC data requests can be converted into equivalent CNG requests that will return 'equivalent' datasets to the requestor. (the format of the request and response may be different but the requestor can still get the same number of rows / products back as per their original query)

 

    The above list is a high level summary rather than an exhaustive list. 

 ** 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

Martin Brine

Sarah Boyett

Katy Flood

Julia Ayala Paviour 

 

 

 

*Assumptions:*

 

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*

column1: (3844) - Data Security - Controlling Access - Full API
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.23|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 *Background:*

As External consumers will need permission to consume BAH cached data, there needs to be an approval process and security layer to ensure only approved consumers are able to access the cache.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to ensure that only permitted users can access the cache *so that* BAH retain full knowledge and control over whom their clients are 



*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - Only allow authorised requests*

*Given* all consumers must seek permission to use cached data

*When* permitted users are attempting to access the cache

*Then* they must do so with their credentials that were authorised during onboarding process

*And* any requests submitted without authorised credentials are denied access to the cache

    

*Key Info:*

* Consumers must sign agreements to access the cache. 
* All external consumers of the BAH cache must be approved and comply with BA's third party access agreement.

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* Caroline Easton
column1856:
15/Mar/22 1:15 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;It was agreed in the last working group that we needed to requirement https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-87 at a lower level (3 reqs) to cover the following:
 * Preventing Malicious activity (same solution for increment 3 and 4)
 * Controlling Access - Full API (increment 4)
 * Controlling Access - b/w SIP (inc 3).
 * Nothing is reqd for b/w compatible SOLr (there is currently no access control for SOLr and we do not want to implement this because it would prevent existing users from using SOLr without them making changes) 

This requirement covers Controlling access for the Full API

Jon

column1: (3844) - Error Logging  - Indexing (OpenSearch - application)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.28|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

During the caching process, there could potentially be several failures or errors that could occur around the schedule, search requests and responses to suppliers and indexing. When any error that has occurred during the process, this will need to be logged to allow DBS Support to identify when errors have occurred

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all Indexing related errors to be captured *so that* all related failures are able to be identified easily and investigated

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Logging cache errors*

*Given* search results are required to be indexed

*When* any type of failure or error occurs

 

*Then* all errors are logged with sufficient context information for DBS Support to understand what has happened and investigate them. The actual data to be logged will be confirmed later on.
 * -TLOGGED-
 * -ERRORID-
 * -SEARCH REQUEST ID-
 * -ANCILLARY ID-
 * -ERRORCODE-
 * -ERRORMESSAGE-
 * -SESSIONID-
 * -SERVERNAME-
 * -SUPPLIER-
 * -PROPOSITION-
 * -PRIORITY-
 * -FREQUENCY-
 * -ORIGIN-
 * -DESTINATION-
 * -REQUEST-
 * -RESPONSE (see below comment)-
 * -KEYDATA-
 * -NUMADULTS-
 * -NUMCHILDREN-
 * -CHILDAGE-
 * -NUMINFANTS-
 * -SEARCH REQUEST CREATEDDATE-
 * -AIRLINEBRAND-

*And* Session ID affix to show as 'ES'

*And* all errors to be time stamped and show as DD-MM-YYYY HH:MM:SS

*And* all indexing errors to be re-attempted a maximum of three times

*And* each indexing error to be logged

e.g. First attempt fails, second attempt is successful. First attempt is logged as an error

     

*Key Info:*
 * The decision has been made not to have an independent cache error_log 

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Iain Laird
 * Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 * -The columns listed are based on existing columns available-

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*
column1856:
23/Feb/22 10:10 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;This requirement was split out of #69 by technology area. This requirement will cover indexing errors occurring within Elastic Search

The actual information available to be logged is likely to depended on the type of error encountered. The fields listed here are probably only applicable for some types of errors. The key thing is that enough information is logged to tell BAH Support what has happened and allow them to follow it up. 

Some specific testing will be reqd to evaluate the quality of information being logged to see if it is sufficient for Support needs. This will involve triggering different failures to see what is logged.

Jon

14/Dec/23 11:58 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20] ,

When we identified that these tables didn't have an update mechanism in CNG, the technical mechanism that was proposed was doing this via user entry in the CMT.

Information similar to some of these tables exists in the OJ DB and I'm wondering if automated solutions are possible for some of them. If that’s the case then it would be a decision between developing an automated solution (rather than CMT solution ) vs a support process for day 1.

CAR_INSURANCE.

* The data held in this table  in APC (dp_agp.car_insurance) is similar to a subset of data in OJ table (CAR.insurance_types) but not exactly the same
* The entries in APC table are long standing and I’m not sure when they last changed…years ago I suspect
* I don’t think this table is worth developing a tech solution for and would recommend a support process for the very rare updates

MARKET

* Not quite sure why the APC has a stand alone table for this and doesn’t populate it from relevant columns in OJ DB PACK.market_lookup
* Only difference is that the APC list only has some markets where as OJ has a complete list
* New markets do get introduced but it’s a rare event though. Probably don’t need a tech solution for Day 1 and can just have a support process. I’ll check this with commercial.

AMENITIES and PROPERTY_TYPES

* No way of getting these from the OJ DB, so would have to be a CMT based solution
* But change very rarely, so I think all we need is a support process for Day 1

HOTEL_BRAND_CHAIN_NAMES

* Can’t get the data from OJ (the chosen o/p brand and chain descriptions only exist in the CNG table), so would either have to be CMT solution or support process
* I’m unsure how frequent changes are likely to be for this table, so I’ll need to talk this through with Martin Brine

I’ll also look at MEALPLANCODES  [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-440|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-440|smart-link] in the same manner.

Jon
column1873:
14/Dec/23 4:02 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:635145e8f7ad721e784c7e20] ,

I’ve talked thru these tables (inc MEALPLANCODES in #440) with Martin Brine to see how likely they are to change. With the exception of HOTEL_BRAND_CHAIN_NAMES, changes to the data will be rare and Martin is happy to go with a support process for day 1, rather than developing CMT screens.

Changes to HOTEL_BRAND_CHAIN_NAMES are likely to be more frequent and Martin would like this table to be maintainable via the CMT. Visibility of the data in the CMT will also be helpful in case any discrepancies need resolving.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: CMA - Default Hotel searches to headline pricing for consumers who have migrated to the new cache (Full API)
column45:
*Background*

Following industry-wide pressure from the Competitor Markets Authority to offer customers fully transparent pricing, BAH developed the ability to offer customers two different types of pricing. 

# Headline Price - *inclusive* of any additional fees that travellers have to pay upon arrival e.g. local fees / taxes etc

# Selling Price - *exclusive* of any additional fees that travellers have to pay upon arrival e.g. local fees / taxes etc

Post Covid-19 pandemic, the CMA appear to have not restarted their initiative. Therefore due to the complexities in sourcing/maintaining all locally payable fees, BAH never completed their business implementation, even though the development was delivered.  

Should BAH complete their full implementation of headline pricing, the +*_Full API needs to return headline pricing to Hotel based searches and Selling price to Car based searches as local fees only apply to Hotels._*+



*Requirement*

*I want* the full API to return Headline Prices to internal consumers by default for FH and HO searches whenever they’re available in the Index

*So that* BAH prices displayed on the front end will be compliant with CMA by including all payable fees and taxes



*Acceptance Criteria*

*AC1: Internal Cache Consumers querying via the full API's - Hotel searches*

*Given* the index holds FH or HO pricing

*When* an internal cache consumer queries for a FH or HO price via the full API's 

*Then* they are always returned the Headline Prices (per person, total and/or combine and save) whenever available in the cache

*And* they are only ever returned Selling Prices (per person, total and/or combine and save) if the Headline Price equivalents are unavailable in the cache

*And* they are informed which price (headline or selling) they've been returned in order to output relevant copy



*AC2: Internal Cache Consumers querying Elasticsearch via the full API's - Car searches* 

*Given* the Index has been populated with FC or CO pricing

*When* an internal cache consumer queries for a FC or CO price via the full API's 

*Then* they are only ever returned Selling Prices

column1: CMA - Default Hotel searches to headline pricing for consumers who have not migrated to the new cache (Backward Compatible SOLR)
column45:
*Background*

Following industry-wide pressure from the Competitor Markets Authority to offer customers fully transparent pricing, BAH developed the ability to offer customers two different types of pricing. 

1) Headline Price - *inclusive* of any additional fees that travellers have to pay upon arrival e.g. local fees / taxes etc

2) Selling Price - *exclusive* of any additional fees that travellers have to pay upon arrival e.g. local fees / taxes etc

Post Covid-19 pandemic, the CMA appear to have not restarted their initiative. Therefore due to the complexities in sourcing/maintaining all locally payable fees, BAH never completed their business implementation, even though the development was delivered.  

Should BAH complete their full implementation of headline pricing, the backward compatible Solr API needs to return headline pricing to Hotel based searches and Selling price to Car based searches as local fees only apply to Hotels.

 

*Requirement*

*I want* consumers who remain on the backwards compatible API's to receive the Headline Prices by default for FH and HO searches if headline prices are available in Elasticsearch

*So that* BAH prices displayed on the front end will be compliant with CMA by including all payable fees and taxes



*Acceptance Criteria*

*AC1: Consumers querying SOLR for Hotel pricing*

Given Elasticsearch has been populated with FH or HO pricing

When an internal or external client queries SOLR for a FH or HO search

And are redirected to Elasticsearch via the backwards compatible API's

Then they are always returned Headline Prices (per person, total and/or combine and save) whenever available in the cache

And they are only ever returned Selling Prices (per person, total and/or combine and save) if Headline Price equivalents are unavailable in the cache

And they are aware which price (headline or selling) they've been returned in order to output relevant copy 



*AC2: Consumers querying SOLR for Car pricing* 

Given Elasticsearch has been populated with FC or CO pricing

When an internal or external client queries SOLR for a FC or CO search

And are redirected to Elasticsearch via the backwards compatible API's

Then they are only ever returned Selling Price



*Design Consideration*

_The updating of this business requirement in November 23 should not alter the pre-existing design concept of using a ‘display' price to determine ‘headline’ vs 'original’._

column1: Backward Compatible SOLR APIs must only return prices for BADP & 2 Adults
column45:
*Background:*

CNG introduces the ability to do additional kind of searches such as different airline brands (BA or IB) and different pax mixes-.- Existing APC does not have these capabilities, the responses in the backward compatible APIs will not include these fields and clients will not be able to handle responses that include unexpected variations in these fields. Hence the SOLR-like backward compatibility API must only return:

BA airline brand

2 adult passenger mix

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* existing consumers who do not migrate to the full API’s to only ever be returned the same variable search data that Solr offered *so that* they are not returned unexpected data



*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC. 1 - Only return 2 Adults & BADP to b/w solr API*

*Given* consumers querying the new cache via the backward compatible Solr API do not specify pax mix or Airline Brand in their requests

*When* there are matches found in the cache for varying pax mix or Airline brand

*Then* only results based on 2 adults and BADP are returned

column1: Elastic Search/Logstash/Kibana - Log4Shell security vulnerability
column45:
Elastic Search/ Logstash / Kibana are vulnerable to Log4Shell security vulnerability.  Before we start up any of our environments for the restarted CNG project, apply the mitigations.

 

We received this advisory from elastic search:



Dear Customer,

This email is to provide details on Elastic’s response to the high severity vulnerability (CVE-2021-44228) impacting multiple versions of the Apache Log4j 2 utility.

*Context*: A high severity vulnerability (CVE-2021-44228) impacting multiple versions of the Apache Log4j 2 utility was disclosed publicly via the project’s GitHub on December 9, 2021. The vulnerability impacts Apache Log4j 2 versions 2.0 to 2.14.1.

*Elastic Software Implications*: Log4j is used as a component of Elastic products to output log statements that help Elastic and our users to troubleshoot problems.

A security investigation to determine whether there was any impact to Elastic or our customers has been executed and we are centralising the most recent updates from Elastic into the following [Security Announcement|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWtJCnr0OIwjnlxXcMq0cA6zNRsH2iCOZMWw2ubA8EHXMys5iY5v25Le4U4B-xbQWaC0%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593863656%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=hY2t%2BK13yhtbP2azwT2fzWYqxP3f5LxVdh9y0qu9uTE%3D&reserved=0].

The following products are potentially affected - please see the relevant product specific section of the [Security Announcement|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWtJCnr0OIwjnlxXcMq0cA6zNRsH2iCOZMWw2ubA8EHXMys5iY5v25Le4U4B-xbQWaC0%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593873611%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=E8pKRwx9%2BEJuotqBgXjkUltsMF3fGk44XuO1UJ%2BxjZs%3D&reserved=0] for more details:
 * APM Java Agent - exposure to the Log4j 2 exploit (CVE-2021-44228) in certain conditions, mitigation requires config setting or upgrade to latest available version (1.28.1)

 * Logstash - Log4j 2 (CVE-2021-44228) exposure to remote code execution on JDKs prior to 8u191. On newer versions of JDKs there is exposure to Denial of Service and information leakage. Requires JndiLookup class removal or update to Logstash version 6.8.21 or 7.16.1 when released on December 13th.

 * Elasticsearch - Log4j 2 (CVE-2021-44228) no exposure to remote code execution for Elasticsearch 6 and 7, but potential exposure to information leakage, full mitigation requires config setting, or update to Elasticsearch version 6.8.21 or 7.16.1 when released on December 13th. Investigation into Elasticsearch 5 is ongoing.

We have validated that the vulnerability does not exist in the following Elastic products:
 * APM Server
 * Beats
 * Cmd
 * Elastic Agent 
 * Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE)*
 * Elastic Cloud on Kubernetes (ECK)*
 * Elastic Endgame
 * Elastic Maps Service
 * Endpoint Security
 * Enterprise Search server
 * Fleet Server
 * Kibana
 * Machine Learning
 * Swiftype

*Orchestrated environments should be assessed for impact to deployed products.

*Elastic Cloud Implications*: Customers hosting Elasticsearch deployments with version 7.2 and higher in [Elastic Cloud|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWuOzHSrbRPgwGRFp0iYOXgcY3IulJdNFERDNqdaGMULipKXgCcf6mzhgdAj9-xrO16Y%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593873611%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=qVDwjc8L%2FXOeBSK7gagFEF7NiRN9svEJV38UE2PyimQ%3D&reserved=0] are not impacted by the RCE exploit nor the information leak.

All deployments hosted on[ Elastic Cloud|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWuOzHSrbRPgwGRFp0iYOXgcY3IulJdNFERDNqdaGMULipKXgCcf6mzhgdAj9-xrO16Y%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593873611%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=qVDwjc8L%2FXOeBSK7gagFEF7NiRN9svEJV38UE2PyimQ%3D&reserved=0] have been updated to leverage the JVM Option -Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true to mitigate any potential information disclosure. This will take effect on restart of the deployment, or on any config change to the Elasticsearch deployment.

Customers hosting Elasticsearch deployments in [Elastic Cloud |https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWuOzHSrbRPgwGRFp0iYOXgcY3IulJdNFERDNqdaGMULipKXgCcf6mzhgdAj9-xrO16Y%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593883567%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=tfeYViCR%2FeBAzrlnGsXKDlOt8f6PhU4SRQdx32UMPEs%3D&reserved=0]on versions older than 7.2 are recommended to restart these deployments as soon as possible. Other customers can wait until they apply a configuration change to their deployments.

All new Elastic Cloud hosted deployments have this setting by default and are therefore not impacted by this vulnerability.

Latest Update: 20211212
 [Security Announcement|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWtJCnr0OIwjnlxXcMq0cA6zNRsH2iCOZMWw2ubA8EHXMys5iY5v25Le4U4B-xbQWaC0%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593883567%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=SLYR%2F%2B40B0MT%2BM%2F7Wfg%2BQytimmmxDg1qsLQCwTJY9Gk%3D&reserved=0]
 [Blog|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWdCTxLfeljdQU_oFAuUrs_S7WpildrrDpcYuy2fm5dqHQjUH4FOsVIXCiliwClgKg6w%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593883567%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=ljzOjTP%2FSBrxknjdYKjLjp4FcJlzl%2BvQqBfwzkBIr1o%3D&reserved=0]

All new advisories are announced in the [Security Announcements|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWVPcLyRyqTXQaus__c6T6mR-ltvQfIGxTUraAcVmB5ElI0rtYCfBNL4wwqjGYnKAlTM%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593893525%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=PdPfZD3Sn5TqDR5%2BPyX0MoDPo52fw2aGHJG25C8l9ok%3D&reserved=0] forum. These announcements may be tracked via an [RSS feed|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWs86-CI-WGYANpBpV4UYsSxaJjK2NEuJeO5rV5V2O42uQhmzyzenGUOj0cm46a27tD0%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593893525%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=GPf%2FhZXpZ6gP6APPnjGS36SsxSddwgpSIRXVR8FDjA4%3D&reserved=0]. 

The [Security Announcement|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWtJCnr0OIwjnlxXcMq0cA6zNRsH2iCOZMWw2ubA8EHXMys5iY5v25Le4U4B-xbQWaC0%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593893525%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=s8B3E6uuMJ6xt98neCStAoUjeCq3R0dYCaedj5n7KWw%3D&reserved=0] is the first place to be updated and general enquiries via support requests will be redirected there in the first instance. If you have further questions that are not addressed in the Security Announcement, please reach out to Support at [https://support.elastic.co|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flink.elastic.co%2FODEzLU1BTS0zOTIAAAGBUB5qWj9JOEi6LmSoMRwLP4FdG2Udzcl6BOYazauef7PGizyq5kv0UUi3TlvItznR0VdSc8g%3D&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Cedda912eba7148d4a53c08d9be4b7712%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637750053593903480%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=IgvBY1aLF4WYqWT1bqGKJPsS09O2SpKwjd%2BXaL6mXrw%3D&reserved=0]

{noformat}
 java.lang.IllegalStateException: jar hell!
class: org.apache.logging.log4j.util.LoaderUtil$1
jar1: /usr/share/elasticsearch/modules/x-pack-core/log4j-api-2.18.0.jar
jar2: /usr/share/elasticsearch/lib/log4j-api-2.18.0.jar

column1863:
05/Aug/22 5:00 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;It's because I made a mistake in the copying/replacing.
This jar actually relates to log4j version 1 not version 2:
/usr/share/elasticsearch/modules/x-pack-core/log4j-1.2-api-2.11.1.jar
and hence should not be replaced by
log4j-api-2.18.0.jar
but rather by
log4j-1.2-api-2.18.0.jar

I corrected this and now elasticsearch starts OK.

The "jar hell" error was because of 2 copies of log4j-api-2.18.0.jar in the classpath (even though identical)

column1: CNG - CMT- Impacted Component - GUI Application - BAHCMT - CVE-2021-44228 Log4Shell: Remote Code Execution zero day exploit found in log4j
column45:
See https://jira.baplc.com/browse/BAHS-273

and  [https://www.lunasec.io/docs/blog/log4j-zero-day/|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lunasec.io%2Fdocs%2Fblog%2Flog4j-zero-day%2F&data=04%7C01%7Cnigel.hassett%40iaggbs.com%7Ca8fe733344b248d5a31608d9bbd7d0a9%7Cc28eb601be1d491889f40d1b73c2ddc5%7C0%7C0%7C637747357867005434%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=r4YTO96I1BqNfHP%2FcQjme5GUsooL5hS%2Fb0sIoYLCo0M%3D&reserved=0]

BAHCMT is using a vulnerable version of log4j2  ./bahcmt/WEB-INF/lib/log4j-api-2.10.0.jar

For immediate mitigation, add to ../bin/setenv.sh JAVA_OPTS

-Dlog4j2.formatMsgNoLookups=true

(this mitigation does apply to 2.10.0 , so it should work)

 

And upgrade to log4j2 2.15.0 asap
column1856:
14/Dec/21 2:27 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;See also [https://spring.io/blog/2021/12/10/log4j2-vulnerability-and-spring-boot] : "Spring Boot users are only affected by this vulnerability if they have switched the default logging system to Log4J2. The log4j-to-slf4j and log4j-api jars that we include in spring-boot-starter-logging cannot be exploited on their own. Only applications using log4j-core and including user input in log messages are vulnerable"

I'm not quite sure the BAH-CMT slf4j logging configuration.  From startup error messages, possibly log4j2 tries to start up but fails because we have not deployed the log4j-core library, and slf4j reverts to a default basic logger.
{noformat}
catalina.out_log.20211213:ERROR StatusLogger Log4j2 could not find a logging implementation. Please add log4j-core to the classpath.                                                          
Using SimpleLogger to log to the console...
{noformat}
 
Anyway, we currently have not deployed the vulnerable log4j-core library and so probably bahcmt is not exposed to the exploit for now.
