column1: CNG - CMT- Impacted Component - GUI Application -BAH-CMT - review Cache-Control response headers
column45:
bahcmt seems to set response header
{noformat}
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
{noformat}
on every resource, including js, css, images.
This is very inefficient for browsers, they have to fetch the resources every time.

Of course, it is important to allow for application upgrades, in which case you do want browsers to reload all the js/css resources etc.  This can best be done with a version parameter.
Otherwise, you can set Cache-Control to a few hours, so that at least browsers will not have to reload resources every time.  But adding a version parameter is better.

column1: CNG - CMT- Impacted Component - GUI Application - microservices showing default error page, which is poor security practice
column45:
For example in the browser navigate tohttps://api-uat.poc.bahcache.com/?
you see:

Whitelabel Error Page
This application has no explicit mapping for /error, so you are seeing this as a fallback.
Wed Mar 11 18:46:51 GMT 2020
There was an unexpected error (type=Not Found, status=404).
No message available
 
Although it doesn’t give a version, from this you can easily tell it is a Spring Boot application. Attackers could use this to target any known vulnerabilities.
Instead, include an error handler and output our own neutral error page.

04/Aug/22 1:25 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;The web pen test highlighed  (Apache coyote 1.1). - this is in the response header

Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1

Additionally easily replicate further tomcat version disclosure "Apache Tomcat/7.0.92".  Logon to systest http://bhdev09.baplc.com:25080/bahcmt/  
change the URL in the browser to something invalid
http://bhdev09.baplc.com:25080/bahcmt/nosuch

HTTP Status 404 ? Not Found
Type Status Report
Message /bahcmt/nosuch
Description The origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.
Apache Tomcat/7.0.92
column1859:
04/Aug/22 1:38 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Fix applied in bhdev09:
/webserver/tomcat-bahcmt/conf/server-host.xml
add:
{noformat}
        <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve"
            showReport="false"
            showServerInfo="false"/>
{noformat}

restart tomcat-bahcmt service. Now repeat the test:
HTTP Status 404 ? Not Found

and the header
Server: Apache

Server is a mandatory header, so we can't remove it. But now it says just "Apache" without any version info.

See https://jira.baplc.com/browse/BAWM-40514, we did this fix for DP in 2020.B

column1878: 25/Feb/24 10:06 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;btw when checking this you should look at the response headers also. screenshots below Feb 23 only show the html page in browser. But I had a look in dev01 AWS, it’s still just Server: Apache per my comment August 4, 2022 which is OK.
column1879:
25/Feb/24 10:55 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Actually even live [http://bahcmt.baplc.com/bahcmt/|http://bahcmt.baplc.com/bahcmt/] is returning response header Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1

I guess this tells that it’s a tomcat server supporting HTTP/1.1.  

You can override this with the Connector server attribute and in tomcat 9 it’s not set by default [Apache Tomcat 9 (9.0.86) - Security Considerations|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-9.0-doc/security-howto.html#Connectors]

{noformat}The xpoweredBy attribute controls whether or not the X-Powered-By HTTP header is sent with each request. If sent, the value of the header contains the Servlet and JSP specification versions, the full Tomcat version (e.g. Apache Tomcat/9.0), the name of the JVM vendor and the version of the JVM. This header is disabled by default. This header can provide useful information to both legitimate clients and attackers.

The server attribute controls the value of the Server HTTP header. The default value of this header for Tomcat 4.1.x to 8.0.x is Apache-Coyote/1.1. From 8.5.x onwards this header is not set by default. This header can provide limited information to both legitimate clients and attackers.{noformat}

Anyway in AWS test01 [https://bahcmt-test01.dypkg-dev.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/|https://bahcmt-test01.dypkg-dev.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/] returns just response header Server: Apache

AWS reg1  [https://bahcmt-regression1.dypkg-reg.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/|https://bahcmt-regression1.dypkg-reg.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/] only returns Server: Apache

AWS prelive is also up [https://bahcmt-prelive.dypkg-prl.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/|https://bahcmt-prelive.dypkg-prl.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/]  and that likewise only returns Server: Apache

So, this is ok in AWS.
column1880: 25/Feb/24 11:08 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;btw the Server: Apache response header is set by apache httpd webserver (not by tomcat) and “Apache” is the minimum (well, there might be some way to remove it with mod_security but that can be quite complex)  [https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/core.html#servertokens|https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/core.html#servertokens|smart-link]  .  We are OK with Server: Apache
column1881: 25/Feb/24 11:26 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Merin, in your screenshot the tab in the middle shows title “Apache Tomcat/7.0.57 - Error”, which is clearly disclosing the server version.  What app does that come from?
column1882: 26/Feb/24 5:18 AM;62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c;That is my locally deployed application, Nigel.

column1: CNG - Full API- Impacted Component - Lambda, Kibana, Elastic Search - Remove totalRoundedPrice from full API
column45:
Currently the APC (and the CNG so far) outputs both a totalPrice and for HotelOnly also outputs a totalRoundedPrice 
However, xdist already rounds the price.
The cache should not be doing any pricing calculations - only xdist should do that.
Remove the totalRoundedPrice from the full API.

Ideally, if it is already present in the solr and/or sip API, change those services to calculate it from the totalPrice.  (Otherwise, if it's too late for us to change these, CMA project will do this.)

Note that for CMA project, it is planned to change the Batch Controller to remove totalRoundedPrice from the Elastic Search document.  CMA project will NOT create an equivalent headlineRoundedPrice field.
column1856: 12/Mar/20 12:21 PM;557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1;Jon to complete analysis (linked to CMA Project)
column1857:
13/Mar/20 2:20 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi,

I agree that the totalRoundedPrice field is not reqd for HO and can be removed from the full API. We should make a note of this in the API documentation to say why it has been removed.

The field needs to be retained for the BW compatible interfaces in case it is being used.

I wouldn't make any changes to the APC SOLr / SIP interfaces given there very limited lifespan before users need to switch to BW compatible ones.

As a matter of interest, can the totalPrice field decimals if they were present? I don't think this would be done intentionally but it's possible the rounding rules could fail to trigger.

Thanks,

Jon
column1858: 14/Feb/22 4:10 PM;5ce5329509f2de0dc750716a;Jon to review with Business
column1859:
15/Feb/22 11:20 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Emily is checking whether current CMA reqs covers the rounding of package and hotel prices once local fees are added to produce headline prices. If we get unrounded figures in the xDist response then that's what will get cached. The affects FH and HO, but FH does not have a separate rounded field. I'd like to know the answer to this before deciding what to do.

Jon
column1860:
15/Feb/22 6:01 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Emily has provided the following:

*OJ confirmed price returned for DP is always rounded.* Headline price is done based on the calculated price so if it was rounded before then will always be rounded and local fees are always rounded up - so price should be rounded.*
 * * FH, FC, CO, HO are always rounded. TRF and EXP aren't rounded but we aren't caching those.
 * This means the addition of local fees for CMA should result in non rounded prices coming thru to the cache
 * Therefore CMA doesn't give us a reason to retain the totalRoundedPrice for HO

Jon
column1861: 17/Feb/22 11:16 AM;5ad8cbca926ac92a7c0e11bb;EStimated as part of CMA changes for increment 02 only
column1862:
18/Feb/22 8:57 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I've had confirmation from the commercial stakeholders (Katy, Julia & Sarah) that they are happy for the removal of *totalRoundedPrice* from the full API.

Jon
column1863: 23/Jan/23 4:22 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Assigning to [~accountid:6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417] as part of Full API design. This will be tested by tony as part of increment 4. Jon
column1864: 04/Apr/23 8:43 AM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;Update: This field(totalRoundedPrice) has been added as excludeField as part of all APIs build. For Full API and SIP API build is in progress. [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358]  Kindly let us know if there is any discrepancy in our understanding.
column1865: 04/Apr/23 8:44 AM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;Once the build is completed for the relevant APIs, the same will be handed over to System testing.
column1866: 02/May/23 4:02 PM;557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1;Hi All, am I right in thinking the only way to check that this has been removed on front end will be to enable CMA so that local fees are included in the headline price displayed, and which it hasn’t been rounded up? As well as checking the package response to ensure the rounded up parameter is not in use? Thanks
column1867:
02/May/23 4:27 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Tony - have a look the e2e mapping document for HO and this might make it a bit clearer. [e2e CNG Mapping Document.xlsx|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/3844%20Additional%20Holiday%20Pricing%20CNG/4.%20Analysis%20%26%20Design/Data%20Mapping/e2e%20CNG%20Mapping%20OpenSearch%20Document.xlsx?d=w134cec7dca684ee68f7413199eb14115&csf=1&web=1&e=fVJ00p]

* This field no longer appears in the index and there are no mapping rules to send it out for the full API (this is regardless of CMA settings)
* The only place this field will exist is in the b/w SOLr response, where it will be created in the API logic. This will be mapped out of the display version of the price field (displayTotalPrice) because of CMA. Depending on the CMA field settings the displayTotalPrice will either contain the Headline value of the original totalPrice. Assuming that the population of  displayTotalPrice has already been checked, for this bug you would just need to confirm that the displayTotalPrice was used as the source and that it appears as an integer value.

Jon

column1: remove unneeded CMT shared libraries - including some with known security vulnerabilities
column45:
In bhdev09 looks like we have just copied the xdist shared libraries:
{noformat}
-sh-4.1$ ls -rtl /webserver/tomcat-bahcmt/shared/lib
total 9916
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache  139977 Oct  4  2018 ons-12.2.0.1.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache 4036257 Oct  4  2018 ojdbc8-12.2.0.1.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache 1099788 Oct  4  2018 ucp-12.2.0.1.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache  194354 Oct  4  2018 xml-apis.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache 1212965 Oct  4  2018 xercesImpl.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache 3078593 Oct  4  2018 xalan.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache  188893 Oct  4  2018 serializer.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache   73063 Feb 18  2019 el-api.jar
-rw-rw-r-- 1 wgapache wgapache  109269 Feb 18  2019 el-impl.jar
{noformat}
However, CMT does not use xalan (if it does, it cannot use the OJ version as that is an obsolete version, instead it would have to use the latest)
Hence remove
xml-apis.jar xercesImpl.jar xalan.jar serializer.jar

The oracle jdbc drivers are needed.
I presume el-api is needed (we are overriding the version in tomcat 7?) but it should be versioned (eg el-api-3.0.0.jar etc).

column1: CNG - CMT, Burst (CAPTWO), Batch (CAPTWO) - Impacted Component - GUI Application, Service, Database - configure CMT (and captwo?) Connection Pools for CMT database
column45:
Currently in bhdev09 /webserver/tomcat-bahcmt/conf/context.xml looks like we have just taken the xdist GCC Connection Pool config:
{noformat}
<Resource type="javax.sql.DataSource"
            name="jdbc/bahcmt"
            factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory"
            driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver"
            url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=bhdevdb05.baplc.com)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVICE_NAME=bhdev_cache_appsvr)))"
            connectionProperties="oracle.net.CONNECT_TIMEOUT=2100;oracle.jdbc.ReadTimeout=2100"
            initialSize="0"
            maxActive="10"
            maxIdle="10"
            validationQuery="SELECT 1 FROM DUAL"
            validationQueryTimeout="2"
            logValidationErrors="true"
            testOnBorrow="true"
            username="CACHENEXTGEN_ST"
            password="***"
            maxWait="2000"
            removeAbandoned="true"
            removeAbandonedTimeout="60"
            logAbandoned="true"
            maxAge="600000"
            jdbcInterceptors="QueryTimeoutInterceptor(queryTimeout=2)" />
{noformat}

some of these parameters are not appropriate for CMT.  In particular, consider:
1. Should we use the tomcat jdbc pool (https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/jdbc-pool.html)?  This is uniquely used for xdist GCC, in order to use it's jdbcInterceptors feature.  Other xdist connectors use the default apache pool (https://commons.apache.org/dbcp - NB, only version 1 in tomcat 7), and I believe captwov2 uses oracle UCP (for xdist we attempted to move to UCP but failed, BAWM-33600)  tomcat jdbc pool maybe perfectly OK, but this is one thing to consider.
2. Many of these parameters are to set an aggressive 2 second timeout.  That's needed for GCC, but is not desirable for CMT
3. removeAbandonedTimeout=60. This might be too short (it's in seconds) for CMT.
4. maxAge="600000"  [millis, ie 10 mins] This is intended to help keep the connections balanced across the database nodes.  After a node is stopped all connections migrate to the single running node.  Once the other node is restarted, by default these connection pools don't rebalance (unlike UCP) and so traffic could overload one node even though both are up. This maxAge ensures that after at most 10 mins, any connection is dropped and recreated thereby rebalancing across the nodes.
5. jdbcInterceptors="QueryTimeoutInterceptor(queryTimeout=2)"  This is a workround for GCC, and is not needed for CMT.  It adds a query timeout of 2 seconds to every SQL request. That's needed for GCC, but not for CMT: (a) CMT should set any query timeout itself, it should not rely on jdbcInterceptors feature which is not available in most Connection Pools (b) 2 seconds it too short a timeout for CMT

column1863: 05/Dec/23 10:55 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;this 2 second timeout is causing CMT startup failure in AWS [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/DCETEST-7213|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/DCETEST-7213|smart-link].
column1864:
05/Dec/23 11:55 AM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;fyi for [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/DCETEST-7213|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/DCETEST-7213|smart-link] in AWS I changed to use the default tomcat 9 connection pool (apache DBCP version 2). This is still under test in DCExit.

Note that tomcat 7 is different (the default tomcat 7 connection pool is the older apache DBCP version 1), so you cannot apply this as-is to the on-prem tomcat-bahcmt/conf/context.xml. See my comments that explain the parameters that changed, and links to the tomcat documentation

{noformat}<Context>
    <JarScanner scanManifest="false"/>
    <WatchedResource>WEB-INF/web.xml</WatchedResource>
<!-- nh DCETEST-7213/CNG-299 - note that these are for Tomcat 9.  
     For tomcat 9 https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-dbcp/configuration.html
     
     For Tomcat 7, https://javadoc.io/doc/commons-dbcp/commons-dbcp/1.4/index.html  Class BasicDataSource   
     maxTotal was maxActive and check the other parameters too.     
     removeAbandoned="true"  rather than  removeAbandonedOnBorrow
     maxWait instead of maxWaitMillis
     -->    
<Resource type="javax.sql.DataSource"
            name="jdbc/bahcmt"
            driverClassName="oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver"
            url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=rdi-dypkg-groundcostcache-dev-euwe1-oracle-01.csrwyymhuswo.eu-west-1.rds.amazonaws.com)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVICE_NAME=BH30)))"
            connectionProperties="oracle.net.CONNECT_TIMEOUT=10000;oracle.jdbc.ReadTimeout=60000"
            initialSize="0"
            maxTotal="8"
            maxIdle="8"
            maxWaitMillis="60000"
            validationQuery="SELECT 1 FROM DUAL"
            validationQueryTimeout="60"
            testOnBorrow="true"
            username="DPTEST01_BAHCMT_USER"
            password="DPTEST01_BAHCMT_USER"
            removeAbandonedOnBorrow="true"
            removeAbandonedTimeout="300"
            logAbandoned="true"
/>

</Context>{noformat}

column1861:
28/Mar/24 9:28 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;I have mostly written this.  It backs up the existing bahcmt application in tomcat, deletes it, installs a new bahcmt war , configures the tomcat-bahcmt, restarts tomcat-bahcmt (checks it starts OK and stays up for at least 5 secs), and without any additional manual action bahcmt application runs at [https://bahcmt-test02.dypkg-dev.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/|https://bahcmt-test02.dypkg-dev.int.iag.cloud/bahcmt/]

Main issue pending is that there are a lot of issues with the batch scripts , these cannot be deployed as they stand (neither in sublive nor live), quite a lot of rework will be needed, I will raise a separate jira.

[https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/DCETEST-16001|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/DCETEST-16001|smart-link]  is pending.

The installer is install-bahcmt.sh , in subversion [https://cap-subversion.baplc.com/svn/repos/CAP/dynamicpackaging/branches/cache_management_tool/installer/install-bahcmt.sh|https://cap-subversion.baplc.com/svn/repos/CAP/dynamicpackaging/branches/cache_management_tool/installer/install-bahcmt.sh]  and the tomcat-bahcmt config files are in [https://cap-subversion.baplc.com/svn/repos/CAP/dynamicpackaging/branches/cache_management_tool/installer/tomcat-bahcmt|https://cap-subversion.baplc.com/svn/repos/CAP/dynamicpackaging/branches/cache_management_tool/installer/tomcat-bahcmt] (conf and bin subfolders).

It works in AWS dev environments and - probably - will work in reg and prelive (but so far I only tested in dev 02). 

The bahcmt development team have to place the built war file for the application in a folder “bahcmt” in the “app” s3 bucket for the appropriate AWS account, for dev this is s3b-dypkg-dev-euwe1-app-01 - here is a direct link: [https://s3.console.aws.amazon.com/s3/buckets/s3b-dypkg-dev-euwe1-app-01?region=eu-west-1&bucketType=general&prefix=bahcmt/&showversions=false|https://s3.console.aws.amazon.com/s3/buckets/s3b-dypkg-dev-euwe1-app-01?region=eu-west-1&bucketType=general&prefix=bahcmt/&showversions=false] .   btw previously there was a requirement for proper build pipeline [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-293|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-293|smart-link], but that didn’t happen and it was discussed to just build manually and place the war in a known place in subversion. However at approx 100M it’s too big for subversion. Hence s3 bucket.  The war file has to be named like bahcmt-?[0-9.]*.war .  Although team didn’t update the version number previously - the original quiet-live version currently in live and prelive, and the subsequent version in bhdev56 are both “bahcmt-1.0.war”, hopefully in future the version number will increment. The installer handles that and by default picks the latest, or you can specify a specific version on command line (for usage install-bahcmt.sh -? ).

Initially I have placed the bahcmt-1.0.war there from bhdev56 with the log4j and spring-core jar files upgraded to the latest versions in order to fix the security vulnerabilities [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-366|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-366|smart-link] and CNG-1326.   For reg or prelive there are similar “app” s3 buckets.

Couple of other things pending: 

* refresh/clone database schema from prelive. I understand DP DCE project will take care of this and/or the on-prem DBA team who plan to implement a new database schema clone tool. 
* include install-bahcmt.sh into the main install_ba_apps script that DP env team run. I don’t want to do that until the DB schemas are all set up.

column1: Querying results for different paxmix  from the cache & age ranges
column45:
*Background:*

APC and SOLR only store search requests based on 2 adults. For Cache Next gen, CMT users can apply a variety of passenger mixes including adding children and infants to search requests to provide a larger array of search results.

-There are 5 different age ranges that can create a different price - Adults 18+, Senior Young Adults (16-17), Young Adults (12-15), Child (2-11) and Infants (Under 2). In order for Consumers to get the correct price, BAH would like it mandatory for Consumers to apply the total number of each bracket required.-



*Requirement:*

*I want* Full API consumers to state the quantity of each passenger type in their request *so that* a price can be returned to match the passenger mix requested



*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - Querying the Full API using paxmix* 

*Given* search results have been indexed based on multiple pax mix including child and infants

*When* Internal and External consumers query the Full API

*Then* their requests must individually state the number of: Adults (18+), Children (2-17) and Infants (<2)

*And* the above fields are mandatory even if the number in an age category is zero 

*And* an exact age is also required for each child

*And* the data returned to the consumer is appropriate for the paxmix requested

*And* Deeplinks returned to the consumer will have the child ages as per +the Consumer request+

 

*AC.2 - Ability for BAH Commercial to configure what availability is returned for each child age*

*Given* storing every permutation of child age in the index would take up a huge amount of capacity

*When* an API request is received that contains a child age

*Then* the child age requested by the consumer is mapped against a child age range preconfigured by BAH

*And* BAH can map ages differently for each Airline Brand

*And* the BAH mapped age is used to return cached pricing instead

*And* Deeplinks returned will have the child ages as per the Consumer request not the BAH mapping 

!image-20240216-145704.png|width=764,height=542!



*Design considerations:*

# The commercial caching strategy will involve only caching 1 exact child age in each child age category: Senior Young Adults (16-17), Young Adults (12-15), Child (2-11). A Configuration table will exist allowing Commercial to map between the child age supplied in the Consumers request and the child age that has actually been cached. 
# The child age categories are expected to be those that differentiate flight pricing but this could change over time, so this needs to be maintainable.
# If the age mappings need to be changed then BAH Commercial do not need to wait for a new release or a CR.

*Key Info:*

* This will only be available for the Full SIAs and b/w compatible APIs only handle 2A and so are unaffected 
* Internally to BA / BAH we have the concept of different child age categories, but this has no impact on how consumers of the cache will request data 

*Assumptions:* 

# Price per person is calculated by total package price / total passengers 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* Katy Flood
* Julia Paviour

column1862:
15/Feb/22 6:19 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Martin is off sick at the moment but I've discussed this with the other commercial stakeholders and agreed the following:
 * The Commercial approach to caching is the same as previously intended
 * Only 1 defined age will be cached for each child age category 
 * We've agreed that it doesn't make sense for internal & external partners to send availability requests to the cache using age categories
 * External partners  (Kayak, Travel Supermarket) collect exact ages and they can send them on to us. It's not unreasonable to ask BA to do the same - this is how search forms normally work
 * We'll need a configurable table that will define what the age ranges are and the exact age within each to be sent in CNG availability calls
 * We also need to be careful to return the age in the deeplink url correctly ie the age from the customer search not the cached age. *We can't do this unless we receive the exact age in the search* 
 * This is critical for the flow on our website where we deeplink customers straight to search results. The customer wouldn't know if we've populated the age correctly unless they launched a research

I'll update reqs and AC section to reflect this but I think we now how enough information from the business to allow us to start design & estimate it.

18/Mar/22 6:53 AM;62e3f1910b4bf7ad924bb236;Hi Jon,
  I m still quite unclear what we try to accomplish and why do we need all these configuration tables as we store only limited information in the cache.

 

From CMT perspective, we have defined adult count, No of children (with child ages) and no of infants.
 The child age validation happen in CMT itself. We don't have the concept of segregating the adult and child into different categories(Young, Senior etc) while populating the cache and in CMT( The attached sheet in JIRA shows that CMT will have pax mix with different age categories which is not correct)

{ "adultCount":"2", "childCount":"2", "childAges":"9,10", "infantsCount":"0" }

column1867:
18/Mar/22 10:26 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Suresh,

The CMT setup is fine. This uses no of adults , no of children and child ages and no infants. 

Users of the cache will need to provide all these details in their search requests including exact child ages...so this aligns with CMT design.

Neither of these has (or needs) the concept of child age ranges. (#)

The issue from a commercial perspective is the number of results that need to be cached in order to successfully return availability. This is due to the child age needing to match exactly. To successfully serve availability for 2A+1C, commercial would need to cache 2A+1C(2 years),  2A+1C(3 years),  2A+1C(4 years),  2A+1C(5 years).... 2A+1C(17 years) ie every single age. So the number of results required increases massively once children are involved. 

Commercial didn't want to have to cache as many results in order to return child availability - so they were looking for a way around this. This is the reason that child age ranges were introduced. These have no impact on how searches are setup in CMT or how results are cached. They are purely to allow commercial to serve availability whilst caching a lower number of searches.

The idea is to sub-divide the child age range into different age ranges and cache only 1 search result for each.  We would then serve this result set for any search within that age range. So for example if we have a child age category 15-17 years, we might cache results for child age of 16 years (a reasonable medium) but return these results for any search with a child age of 15,16 or 17. This would mean that we could always return availability having stored just 1 result instead of 3. This is a commercial compromise because the prices stored wouldn't be 100% correct all the time, but saving extra searches here would allow additional coverage elsewhere.

 

# Note - when Stew originally wrote this req it had a different form. He was thinking of getting the cache users to send through child age ranges in their search requests rather than exact child ages. This wouldn't have worked, so the requirement has been changed. Technically this wouldn't have worked because deeplinks involving children must have a child age in them otherwise they fail. The attachments are from how the reqs were originally written and aren't really applicable now - but I'm not sure we can delete them from JIRA. 

I think that our current logic for deeplinks is therefore incomplete and additional logic is reqd to add in the child age parameter. This age parameter will need to have the correct age as supplied by the requestor rather than the age we use to lookup search results).

Jon
column1868:
18/Mar/22 12:25 PM;62e3f1910b4bf7ad924bb236;Hi Jon, Per our discussions , I came up with the solution which would handle the cache requirements including error scenarios. Need some work to do in Increment 2 to support full api. Will plan that work, The high level logic is given below-

1) Have reference table for batch controller to read and map the child category for each child ages configured in CMT.
 2) the attributes in cache will look like the below ie, we know what child category maps to each child age in cache
 If there are no look up for a child age or return more rows(not possible ideally) , we wil handle that accordingly by having dummy category and match up with exact age while queriying the child age.
 Example cache would look  like this for 3 children dereived from user managed look up table. The count of childAges and childAgeCategories will match.

{ "adultCount":2, "childCount":3, "childAges": 16, 7, 4 "childAgeCategories": 16-17, 2-11 , 2-11 "infantsCount":"0" }

3) based on consumer requests with child ages, the API will do the below logic 
 a) fetch the matching results from cache based on child counts(example "childCount":3,)
 b) filter internally the matching results matching child age from consumer with child categories in cache .The consumer will get the results only if no of children and child category matches from cache. If the child category is not available in look up db for any child age(rare case), the exact age will be matched up.
 c) send back the results with deepink mapping to consumer child ages(childage deeplink attribute need to be confirmed)

-Suresh

column1873:
08/Jun/22 2:36 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Sushant,

I'm not sure what you mean be a 'maximum limit'. If you are thinking about total vehicle capacity, we don't / won't compare that with paxmix in the cache - we just display the occupancy details in the booking flow and the customer decides if it's big enough. For CO booking flow, we only collect the lead pax name and they need to check the vehicle matches the requirements of the whole party.

I think it might be worth use having a group discussion about CO paxmix handling in general (rather than just child-age categories) just so we are all clear how it should work.

My thoughts are:

Paxmix is essentially irrelevant from a CO perspective. The number of adults / children & infants do appear as fields in the SIP request, but I assume the current SIP logic must ignore them. It can't do a lookup based on paxmix as this isn't stored in the APC DB.

Similarly with CNG, we won't be able to lookup CO results based on paxmix as that's not part of the CMT request or availability response. So I'd imagine the b/w CO SIP will again just need to ignore paxmix but still be able to lookup results.

For b/w SOLr , I can't see paxmix in either CO request or response fields. so the logic needs to be able to handle requests w/o paxmix. We'd need to make sure this didn't cause a problem and we could lookup results. 

From a full API point of view, we need to decide if paxmix should be in the CO request, but from my perspective it appears to serve no purpose.

Thanks,

Jon
column1874:
10/Jun/22 12:06 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;All,

An update on this. Sushant and I have spoken about general handling of paxmix for CO. Sushant understands the issue and doesn't think there's an issue delivering a solution for b/w compatible and full APIs. Paxmix won't be used to lookup availability for CO.

For the full API, the mechanism for delivering it will need to be determined later on when Sushant has looked at the code. He can then determine whether the CO paxmix fields should be removed or made optional in the request - or if that's problematic, a way of ignoring values sent in the request (calling apps could just use the same default paxmix if this approach had to be followed).

For b/w compatible, there aren't any users of CO SIP and paxmix isn't used in SOLr calls so there shouldn't be an issue, but essentially we would just ignore any paxmix sent in the request.

column1884: 13/Apr/23 4:39 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:6365c865f7ad721e78509db6]  - thanks for the update. I'm still not 100% clear what the matching logic is you are proposing. Would it be possible to describe the actual lookup logic with some different example pax mix / child ages. Thanks - jon
column1885:
14/Apr/23 1:20 PM;6386322e9e48f2b9a6149417;[~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358]  Please find below the few scenarios:

# *Scenario - 1:*
## childCount : 2 and childAges : 7,9  - expectation is to pick only records matching childAgeCategories as "2-11,2-11"
## If we try to childCount: 2 and childAgeCategories : "2-11,*" -- this way is picking all records having 2-11 combination in it like
"2-11,2-11","2-11,12-15","2-11,16-17","16-17,2-11","12-15,2-11" which is not expected. we need to pick only "2-11,2-11" records.
## Instead we can have it as direct match of childCount as 2 and childAgeCategory as “2-11,2-11” in elasticSearch
# *Scenario - 2:*
## childCount : 2 and child Age: 7,15  - expectation is to pick only records matching "2-11,12-15" and "12-15,2-11"
## If we try to match childCount: 2 and childAgeCategories as "2-11,*" as mentioned above all combinations will be picked up irrespective of "2-11,12-15" and "12-15,2-11"
## To apply direct match we need to build both (childAgeCategories as "2-11,12-15" and "12-15,2-11") the combinations in full API 
# *Scenario - 3:*
## childCount: 3 and child Age: 5,14,17
## for this expected to pick childAgeCategories as
"2-11,12-15,16-17",
"2-11,16-17,12-15",
"12-15,16-17,2-11",
"12-15,2-11,16-17",
"16-17,2-11,12-15",
"16-17,12-15,2-11"
## We cannot build all these possible combination in FULL API build as conditions of elasticSearch query match which will make the query as complex (if the childCount is increasing beyond 2.)
column1886:
14/Apr/23 1:43 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Abinaya / Sushant - thanks for the examples.

Does this mean that with the current approach we can’t support anything with childCount > 2? I don’t think that’s acceptable.

The other thing I’m not sure about is why the ordering is so important…doesn’t this just make things more complicated.?

From a simplistic view, can’t we treat the lookup of age categories within child almost like they are separate paxmix fields? ie

scenario 1 is really a lookup with x adults, y infants, 2 children 2-11, 0 children 12-15, 0 children 16-17

scenario 3 would be a lookup with  x adults, y infants,, 1 child 2-11, 1 child 12-15, 1 child 16-17 

This approach doesn’t rely on ordering and it doesn’t appear to get more complicated as the child count grows. 

It does rely on being able to ‘convert’ the childAgeCategories string into separate counts for each child category. Is this a better approach?

Thanks,

Jon
column1887:
17/Apr/23 11:56 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;After discussion with Sushant, we can use the approach suggested but the number of options can be controlled by the batch controller always writing the age categories into the field in age order. The logic isn’t currently present in batch controller, so this needs a CAPTWO change.

column1888:
17/Apr/23 12:04 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;We also discussed the scenario of what would happen if the age categories classifications needed to be updated.

As the lookup against the index is done by matching the age category range strings (not exact age), this would not match the updated strings and so this would results in no availability being returned immediately after this change. However the next time the ancillaryId ran, it would be cached with new age ranges and availability would be returned from that point onwards.

Changes in the age categories would be very rare, (if at all) but the issue of temporarily returning no availability should be factored into any business decision about how  when to do this. Jon

column1: (3844) - New data - Caching Hotel Biasing Rating
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

 

*Background:*

BA Holidays use Hotel Bias rating to order search results in to a preferential order to help promote recommended hotels on BA.com for live searches. BAH would like to use this for Holiday Finder, to ensure that Hotels are most popular or benefit BAH contractually can be placed at the top.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to cache the Hotel bias rating for each available hotel *so that* I can use the ratings across all BA and IB exploitation channels to order search results on consumer tools i.e. Holiday Finder

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

column1: (3844) - Deeplink domain configuration
column45:
*Requirement*

We should set the domain (and protocol) in the adapter service(SIA).  ES will store only relative urls without domainname.

* for sublive only (eg if enabled by a config param say USE_DPSOURCE_DEEPLINK_DOMAIN), if the client passes http query parameter dpsource (which may include port) use that as the domain-; the client may additionally pass dpprotocol to specify the protocol (https or http-). This will enable correct links back to whatever calling capdev/reg/prevlive environment made the CNG API call, though only after we change all the calling apps (ALP, holiday finder, etc) to pass the dpsource param.
* for sublive only, if no dpsource parameter and if enabled by a startup configuration parameter (say USE_REFERRER_DEEPLINK_DOMAIN), and there is a Referrer header, use the -protocol and- domain in the Referrer header. This will enable correct links back to whatever calling capdev/reg/prevlive environment made the CNG API call, without any client changes.  However it won’t work where there’s no header, eg probably for the CAPTWOv2 direct calls – those will need to use dpsource to get dynamic domains.
* for sublive (if not overridden by the first 2 options) and for live, configurable startup parameters should set the domain depending on the airlinebrand, eg for live BA -> [https://www.britishairways.com|https://www.britishairways.com/], IB -> [https://viajes.iberia.com|https://viajes.iberia.com/].  This will also enable us to put a prelive API on top of the live ES stack, with correct deeplinks pointing back to the originating domain.

We can assume the protocol in the deeplink will always be https, never http, since we nowadays run all the [ba.com|http://ba.com] sites https even in test.

column1: (3844) New Data - Meal plans
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

Ref:  (4033) Meal Plan Presentation

*Background:*

For Project (4033) Meal Plan Presentation, the way xDistributor returns meal plan information will change.  
See full OJ design at [https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/BAHProjects/(4033)%20Meal%20Plan%20Presentation/ES7iiJ9GiZFOuR4ujXVGmbAB42mGP8Ig_VM18ZLmQmbjuw?e=TZaSvH|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/BAHProjects/(4033)%20Meal%20Plan%20Presentation/ES7iiJ9GiZFOuR4ujXVGmbAB42mGP8Ig_VM18ZLmQmbjuw?e=TZaSvH] 
CNG project will need to accommodate this.

The immediate business driver for (4033) Meal Plan Presentation, is to correctly display Disney meal plans which are varied.

*Requirement:*

*I want* to be able to cache Meal Plans *so that* they can be exploited for future promotions

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - Taking meal plans from one of two sources*

*Given* the way meal plans are returned by xDist have been changed by (4033) Meal Plan Presentation project

*When* a meal plan is returned in the OpenJaw response 

*Then* it should be cached from the following xpath RoomRate/MealPlan/MealPlanName/Text[@Language="en" 

*Else* use the current APC logic i.e. use RoomRate@MealPlanCode attribute and lookup the name in the mealplancodes table.
column1856:
09/Oct/19 2:52 PM;5ddeb2b0752c1b0d114eb809;Legacy APC (and CNG as currently built) derives the meal plan name by decoding an OTA code using the mealplancodes table, with values like:
{noformat}
ID NAME
1 All inclusive
2 American
3 Bed & breakfast
4 Buffet breakfast
5 Caribbean breakfast
6 Continental breakfast
7 English breakfast
8 European plan
9 Family plan
10 Full board
11 Full breakfast
12 Half board
...{noformat}

For the (4033) Meal Plan Presentation project, planned to go live in 2020B (?), the xdist Package Search response for FH and HO will change to include (this xml snippet is abbreviated, some fields removed):

{noformat}
<RoomRate  MealPlanCode="BAHCode" RatePlanCode="A7W" SupplierCode="PEGSTOUR">
 <MealPlan>
    <MealPlanName >
       <Text Language="en">Disney Half Board - Premium</Text>
       <Text Language="es">Disney media pensión - Premium</Text>
    </ MealPlanName>
    <MealPlanDescription>
       <Text Language="en"> You can dine at the buffet Service restaurant of your Disney Hotel, the a la carte menu in Table Service restaurants
       </Text>
       <Text Language="es"> You can dine at the buffet Service restaurant of your Disney Hotel, the a la carte menu in Table Service restaurants
       </Text>
     </MealPlanDescription>
</MealPlan>
 <RoomRateDescription Name="Room Description">
      </RoomRateDescription>
 <Rates>
{noformat}

See full OJ design at https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/BAHProjects/(4033)%20Meal%20Plan%20Presentation/ES7iiJ9GiZFOuR4ujXVGmbAB42mGP8Ig_VM18ZLmQmbjuw?e=TZaSvH 

The required CNG change is:
1. If any CNG CR to store content in multiple languages has been included (CNG-210, possibly , (3893) Language Deep Links?) look for the RoomRate/MealPlan/MealPlanName/Text[@Language="lang"] (where "lang" is the language required; if multiple languages are required then retrieve them all)
2. If this is not present (or if no language content CR is implemented in CNG), look for the en meal plan name: RoomRate/MealPlan/MealPlanName/Text[@Language="en"]
3. Otherwise use the current APC logic:  use RoomRate@MealPlanCode attribute and lookup the name in the mealplancodes table.

column1: (3844) - Iberia deeplinks
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

N/A

 

*Background:*

Deeplink URLs for BA.com are stored in APC/SOLR, which provide consumers with links to specific pages. For Cache Next Gen, search requests will be enabled for Iberia, where deeplink URLs are configured to allow consumers to apply specific links to pages on Iberia.com.

Currently, the Iberia team manually create deeplinks by using an Iberia tool (see key info). The tool will use the search parameters entered by the Iberia team to generate a link that has a unique reference. The Iberia team take the unique reference and apply to a spreadsheet that stores other manually created info i.e. prices before being sent to Iberia. Iberia will then build a pod containing the lead in price offer and the generated link will be embedded in to the pod to allow the user to deeplink to search results on Iberia.com

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* deeplink URLs for Iberia search requests to be directed to Iberia.com *so that* search results are relative to the selected Airline brand

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - Iberia deeplink URLs*

*Given* I have applied 'IB' as an Airline brand to a CMT search request

*And* the search request has been committed

*When* the search results for Iberia has been returned from xDist

*Then* a deeplink URL is cached directing users to viajes.Iberia.com based on the respective search parameters

*And* Language parameter for IBDP search requests will be hardcoded to Spanish language i.e. Iberia.com/....ES-ES (Market based on CMT entry)



*AC.2 - Iberia Interstitial Page*

*Given* I have clicked on an Iberia deeplink 

*When* I am waiting for live search results to load

*Then* I am shown an interstitial page that is the same as the page shown after generating a holiday search from the plan frag on the [Iberia.com|http://Iberia.com] homepage 

*And* the language of the copy shown on the page matches the language parameter included within the deeplink

*And* this page is replaced with live search results when the the deeplink has been processed 



!image-20240216-163550.png|width=1912,height=932!

_Screenshot of Iberia’s current IB-BAH interstitial in Spanish_



*Design Considerations*

Iberia may want to utilise their own Interstitial page to satisfy AC.2 when customers move from [iberia.com|http://iberia.com] to [viajes.iberia.com |https://viajes.iberia.com/i]and iberia.com. However, this will not be possible for deeplinks initiated outside of [iberia.com|http://iberia.com]. Design should ensure that an IB skinned interstitial page is shown for every scenario, regardless of whether the page owner is IB or BAH. 

Deeplinks will be hardcoded in ES for IBDP, therefore the copy on this page will also only ever be shown in Spanish. In the future, there may be a CR to introduce other languages into deeplinks, so this page must be able to respond to the language parameter received in the deeplink. In light of this, full translations have been provided now and can be tested by overwriting the deeplink language parameter.

*Translations:*

|EN|We are redirecting you to British Airways Holidays to find the best combination.
Good things are worth waiting for…|
|ES|Te estamos transfiriendo a British Airways Holidays para buscar la mejor combinación.
Lo bueno se hace esperar…|
|IT|Ti stiamo trasferendo su British Airways Holidays per cercare la migliore combinazione.
Le cose belle si fanno attendere…|
|DE|Wir leiten Sie zu British Airways Holidays weiter, damit Sie die beste Kombination finden können.
Das Gute wartet auf Sie…|
|PT|Estamos a efetuar a sua transferência para a British Airways Holidays para pesquisar a melhor combinação.
Quem espera sempre alcança…|
|FR|Nous vous transférons vers British Airways Holidays afin que vous obteniez la meilleure combinaison.
Tout vient à point à qui sait attendre…|

*Key Info:*

* There are immediate plans for an Iberia Holiday Finder and Iberia exploitation pending the implementation of CNG Full API
* Iberia deeplink generator tool [{color:#000000}http://www.iberia.com/web/bahLandingSearchFull.do{color}|http://www.iberia.com/web/bahLandingSearchFull.do]

* Generated links via the tool will be stored below the plan frag, an XML is stored in an Iberia db and encrypted.
* For CNG, Content will remain in English.

  *Key Stakeholder/s:*

* John Price
* Jonathan Smart
* Martin Brine
* Sarah Boyett

column1872:
04/Apr/23 10:36 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:62e3f1525f7842fb1294980c] - the link that you have given here just takes the customer to the Iberia homepage. 

The purpose of a deeplink it quite different. The purpose of a deeplink it to automatically send the customer to a search results page that matches the availability search that was done for the cached results (ie same dates & duration). To achieve this, the deeplink needs to be converted into an xml handoff (done by CAP) and this results in an availability request being triggered to OJ.

Jon

column1878:
19/Jul/23 3:28 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I was trying to think why this Jira would marked as relating to b/w AIPs, when we don’t currently cache IB availability or IB deeplinks today. 

I can’t remember the original line of thinking, but when Nigel was discussing potential ways that the CAP change could be delivered, it did sound like it wasn’t simply a case of adding IB logic…the overall structure of the logic may change (eg to handle airline brand as a variable allowing for others in the future) and therefore the existing BA code could / would be restructured. If this is the case, then the BA deeplinks being sent out in the b/w interfaces would be affected and need retesting.

It therefore seems sensible to leave this Jira associated with the b/w interfaces.

Jon

column1891:
03/Nov/23 7:22 PM;62e3f2ca0b4bf7ad924bb2c6;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] 

Please find my response below:

*Query 1:*  For the  <POS> element, I don’t think there’s anything in the HO / GO deeplinks to populate this, is there? Not sure how this currently works for BA brand but presumably IB can work in the same way

*Answer:* Yes, deeplink URLs dont have direct value of POS element but we have logic to identify the POS value in our code. There is tables in backend to decide these values based on UserCountry . (For Ground products, we use Redemption_Info table and for packages we use city_airports table ). So this logic is automatically going to work for IB also.

*Query 2:*  There’s no mention of the following params for IB, which are designed to identify price changes between cache and live prices (so they can be displayed to the customer). Can you consider them as well:

{noformat}<TotalPrice>5839.0</TotalPrice>
<Currency>GBP</Currency>{noformat}

*Answer:* Yes, these fields are also going to be available in handoff xml. Even now also if I am hitting IB deeplink URLs then it is getting set in handoff xml. The attached handoff element document is just sample one that’s why i mentioned there (after HandbackURLs nodes) that as per the request type, fields could be changed.

!image-20231103-191810.png|width=100%!

Please let me know in case of any further queries.

29/Feb/24 11:30 AM;62441749f6a26900695c6645;Hi [~accountid:557058:823955d3-b26c-43aa-abf5-71f891bc96e6] 

As part of the IB Interstitial page, we are assuming the below considerations.

*For Language Translations* - As of now BAH is supporting  6 DP languages (EN, DE, ES, FR, IT,PT) .

In the IB Interstitial  page implementation, The  language text displayed on the IB Interstitial page depends on the language parameter specified in the deeplink. To meet the language-specific requirement, Business must provide translations for all supported languages.

!image-20240229-112512.png|width=890,height=341!



*For cookie consent popup* - The cookie consent popup related to ensighten Bootstrap JavaScript is automatically triggered based on the Airland band. TCS is not required to make any changes in the cookie consent popup.

!image-20240229-112443.png|width=675,height=359!



*For Additional query parameter* - Iberia is going to add one additional boolean type query parameter 'showIBInterstitial’. IB team will take care to add additional  boolean type query parameter.

column1: (3844) - Spanish language availability searches for Iberia
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

N/A

 

*Background:*

BA is the only Airline brand that is used as part of the APC/SOLR cache process and all BA APC searches are created English availability searches. Iberia will be introduced as part of Cache Next gen, where as Iberia is a Spanish company for mainly Spanish customers, the cache would need to create Spanish availability searches and store the info within cache.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* Iberia searches to request Spanish language *so that* content is captured in the native language

*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - Spanish availability search for Iberia*

*Given* I have applied IB to the Airline brand on a CMT search request

*When* the search request has been committed to be searched

*Then* availability is requested with a language of ES

*And* available products and supporting information is cached

 

*Key Info:*

* BA will continue to be in English
* 3893 - Deeplink language URLs has requirements to cache multi-language content. Spanish content can be manually obtained to offers until 3893 has been implemented
* Iberia do not currently offer ground only propositions but may potentially do this in the future. CMT will allow this for CNG

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* John Price
* Sarah Boyett

 

*Design considerations:*

* When BA is selected as the Airline brand on a CMT search request, the search request will be hardcoded to create an English availability search.
* When IB is selected as the Airline brand on a CMT search request, the search request will be hardcoded to create a Spanish availability search

Agreed between Mel Watts, Susie Nicol, Nigel Hassett and Stew Fuller - 18/10/19 3.15pm

1. For IB brand, we have to make Spanish Language availability search request (by sending lang=ES in Package Search Request)
2. OJ should send Spanish product in Package Search Response
3. CNG will store those information in Elastic Search in English text only (information like, special offer, meal plan).
4. Even OJ send package search response in English + Spanish (both language) then CNG only consume English content and store it in elastic search. 
5. There is no change in Elastic Search (there is no change will be made in elastic search to support multi language content)
6. All SIA response will be in English language only (hotel name, description , special offer, meal plan)
7. There is no change for BA brand (since BA is already doing English search)

 

*Assumptions:*

# BA availability will continue to be in English
# The Backward compatible SIAs for SIP and SOLR will remain in English but the full SIAs for Internal and External consumers will default to English for BA and Spanish for IB
# Does not require any Openjaw changes
# Caching Content for other DP Languages is not in scope and will remain in English (3893 - Deeplink Language URL will introduce multi-language content)
# Deeplink URLs will be relevant to the Airline brand, Market and Language selected on the search request i.e. Iberia.com/....ES-ES
# To future proof Iberia, Spanish availability request will be applied for Ground only products as well as DP, despite Iberia not currently offering GO.

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*

1. For IB brand, we have to make Spanish Language availability search request (by sending lang=ES in Package Search Request)
2. OJ should send Spanish product in Package Search Response
3. CNG will store those information in Elastic Search in English text only (information like, special offer, meal plan).
4. Even OJ send package search response in English + Spanish (both language) then CNG only consume English content and store it in elastic search. 
5. There is no change in Elastic Search (there is no change will be made in elastic search to support multi language content)
6. All SIA response will be in English language only (hotel name, description , special offer, meal plan)
7. There is no change for BA brand (since BA is already doing English search)

column1: (3844) - Extreme prices Report
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * N/A

 

*Background:*

When Suppliers load artificially high rates or if an OJ pricing bug occurs where extreme prices are created, CNG-91 was created to prevent any prices from being indexed, however it was agreed that CNG-91 is out of scope for Cache next gen. Commercial have an existing SQL query that queries APC/SOLR to identify extreme prices in the cache. Where APC is being restructured and SOLR is being replaced by Elasticsearch, BAH Commercial want the report to be adapted to the new cache process.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all extreme prices that is outside of the specified range to be applied to a daily report *so that* BAH can assess the reasons why those extreme prices have been applied

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Extreme prices report*

*Given* Suppliers occasionally load extreme prices to prevent users from booking hotels when unavailable

*When* cache prices have been returned from xDist and has been indexed

*Then* BAH Commercial can run the query to obtain a report to identify extreme prices

*And* Users are able to access the queries

*And* Users are able to add to, amend or delete the query e.g. change threshold figure or add markets to the query

 

*Key Info:*

 * Martin Brine

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*

column1: CNG - Batch - Xdistributor - ST - (3844) - Configuring the batch controller
column45:
*Background:*

During Jan 2019 sale, CTT dynamically switched servers between the APC and the online cluster to maximise server utilization. Overnight, they utilised space online capacity by switching servers onto the APC cluster, this allowed the APC to complete sooner and so during the day they could switch APC servers over to the online cluster to support sales loads. However, since it was not possibly to dynamically change the rate of xdist searches that the CRP sent into the APC cluster, we couldn't

 

*Requirement*

I *want* to be able to dynamically increase or decrease the size of the xdist cluster, and be able to dynamically (or automatically) adjust the rate of search requests into the cluster to maximise throughput.

However, since it was not possibly to dynamically change the rate of xdist searches that the CRP sent into the APC cluster, we couldn't

column1862:
01/Jul/22 6:11 PM;616007b564ff01007180a9c5;Discussed with Sushant and Shyam ..
rather than implement throttling logic within the captwo batch controller, instead we can just let the load-balancer (on dp-apc.baplc.com) do the throttling.  AWS load-balancer surely has a better implementation than we can do
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-request-throttling.html

However we will change the Batch Controller to better handle the possible HTTPS status codes such as 429 Too Many Requests  or 503 Service Unavailable. Currently we can configure to backoff/retry in the _Burst_ Controller (ie send the request around again after some delay), however the Batch Controller will immediately take the next request from the queue and send it - this will be rejected with the same "Too Many Requests" and so on until the load balancer is no longer busy. Instead, better for the Batch Controller itself to backoff-retry in response to specific http status (eg 429 from AWS load balancer, or 503 ), ideally obeying the RetryAfter response header if present. This should be configurable in the same table we already have for burst/batch controller error handling rules.

There can also be 503 Service Unavailable which likewise might return a RetryAfter header, there might be others.  
Bruce’s idea was for a filter in the xdist instances to monitor its capacity (cpu/memory/number of queued request) and return 503 if it was full.

F5 BIGIP possibly can also have irules with some throttling limits and return 50x, but not sure how feasible that is. Unlikely we would implement such throttling on-prem , however after DP DC Exit we can implement throttling in the AWS load balancer, and these Batch Controller changes prepare for that.

column1875:
17/Jul/23 3:47 PM;6392214d3c26ca7fa0d75c1d;Hi Team,

We are working on implementing the below functionality without disturbing the exiting functionality:

# Once we get XDIST BUSY(EVM_BAHEM_9010)/ XDIST UNKNOWN ERROR(503) / CALL_TO_XDIST_SERVICE_FAILED(EVM_BAHEM_1002) we will stop the batch process for a specific time (which can be configured in DB ) and will update the records that are in queue as BATCH_ON_HOLD in request status till the specified holding time get over. 
# Once the specified time for stopping the batch process gets completed, the records with BATCH_ON_HOLD status will be pushed for batch process.
# If we still get any error codes related to XDIST ,then we will stop the batch process again for the specific time mentioned.

Currently we have completed unit testing for FH proposition and testing for other propositions.

Thanks,

Pooja

column1: (3844) - Data Security - Prevent Malicious Activity
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.23|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

*Background:*

API’s are a common target for malicious activity. Solution must robustly defend against all forms of attack e.g. Man in the Middle, Denial of service, Data Scraping, Code Injections, Session Hijacking, Credential Theft etc. 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to safeguard our systems and data from malicious activity *so that* the integrity and availability of the cache is maintained, allowing BAH to offer a reliable service to genuine users 

*Acceptance criteria:*

*Given* an API implementation introduces a potential security vulnerability

*When* the solution is being designed 

*Then* all necessary preventative measures are implemented as agreed between IAG and TCS Technical and Support teams

*Background:*

To troubleshoot and test fixed bugs associated with new functionality acting as each internal and external consumer, there will need to be a test environment to ensure this is working as expected prior to being released in to live.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* a test environment to mirror Internal and External consumers access to the Index *so that* all functionality can be tested and verified prior to being released in to live

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Internal consumers Test environment*

*Given* the test environment is available

*When* a Test Analyst needs to test the functionality of the Index

*Then* All of the following Internal consumption tools are available for Project and Release testing:
 > SFD
 > Holiday Finder (including Modal)
 > PEGA / BA Homepage
 > Team Site
 > Hotel Details
 > ALP
 > Flight Summary page
 > MMB
 > Servicing Emails

-> Pegasus-

> Pega email - Get Travel ready

*And* all existing functionality is available and able to be tested prior to release

*And* new change requests and bug fixes are able to be tested within the environment

 

*AC.2 - External consumers Test environment*

*Given* the test environment is available

*When* a Test Analyst needs to test the functionality of an External consumer

*Then* all External consumer routes are available for Project and Release testing

*And* all existing functionality is available and able to be tested prior to release

*And* new change requests and fixed bugs are able to be tested within the environment

     

*Key Info:*

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 # How the Test Analyst will be able to test the functionality will be explained prior to UAT
 # The environment will continue to be available after functionality has been implemented i.e. to periodically use functionality

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*

column1: (3844) - Sensitive data
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.23|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

As Internal and External consumers are able to access new and existing cached data, sensitive data will need to be protected to prevent internal tools and existing consumers from displaying sensitive information publicly. Competitor Analysis and other internal BAH reporting, will need access to all data including sensitive data, to ensure sensitive data can be manipulated and analysed

When this requirement was originally written, a list of sensitive fields were defined based on the data held in the APC’s Solr Views. This was reviewed in Jan 2023 and updated (see comment on this Jira 26/01/23). Every field that is now considered sensitive has been marked accordingly on the E2E mapping document and is linked within the acceptance criteria below.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to prevent sensitive data held in the cache from being included in Full API responses *so that* sensitive data can only be viewed by authorised BAH staff querying the cache directly   



*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC1 - Excluding Sensitive Data from API response*

*Given* the cache will contain sensitive data

*When* either Internal or External consumers query the cache via the Full API

*Then* any data marked as sensitive within the [E2E mapping document|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/3844%20Additional%20Holiday%20Pricing%20CNG/4.%20Analysis%20%26%20Design/Data%20Mapping/e2e%20CNG%20Mapping%20OpenSearch%20Document.xlsx?d=w134cec7dca684ee68f7413199eb14115&csf=1&web=1&e=fVJ00p] is excluded from the API response 

*And* this applies even if the sensitive data was specifically asked to be returned in the response



*AC.2 - Querying cached data using Sensitive data via full API*

*Given* cached search results will contain sensitive data 

*When* an API request is received that tries to execute an operation on a sensitive data field  

*Then* the response should fail 

*And* the consumer is made aware they’ve request was invalid



*Design Consideration*

* *SOLR b/w API must return all fields that it does today. This is of specific interest to the HO field - isPackageRateOnly, which is present in SOLR but is also defined as sensitive.*
* It is imperative that sensitive data is present in Kibana and Commercial Analysis SQL server. Any users to these applications will be privy to the data contained within. User access to will be appropriately managed via the Corporate Directory
* Although unlikely, it’s possible to ascertain sensitive results, by querying upon it. To mitigate this, the design may offer similar capability to Solr i.e. any *request that attempts an operation on sensitive data should give an errored/failed response. If the sensitive data is only mentioned as a value to be returned i.e. fl, then the result should be returned as if this parameter was not present.* Nigel recommends this is applied to both Solr b/w and Full API’s.

*Assumptions:*

* If new data needs to be applied as sensitive or non sensitive data then Commercial do not need to wait for a new release or a CR   

*Key Info:*

* Consumers must sign agreements to access the cache. This requirement needs to also prevent any malicious activity
* The list of cached data items have been identified as Commercially sensitive data - please see attached 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* Caroline Easton

column1: (3844) - New Consumers
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.20|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]
 * ER.21

 

*Background:*

Following the implementation of the new cache solution, the solution will need to be able to accommodate new consumers and tools that will want to use cached data. Any new tools and consumers being added will be out of scope for this project and will be subject to a Change request or consumer application process.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* new consumers to be able to access the cache *so that* more consumers are able to promote pricing and offers once approved

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC. 1 - Internal consumers*

*Given* new tools can be created to promote lead in prices

*And* the new tool is to use cached data

*When* the tool is ready and permitted to consume cached data

*Then* new Internal consumers are able to access the cache

 

*AC.2 - New External consumers*

*Given* new External consumers will want to promote BAH prices

*When* new External consumers have requested to access new cache

*Then* once permitted, new External consumer access all non sensitive data

    

*Key Info:*
 * Currently, External consumers request access via the SIP and the process takes any between 6-18months, where partners connect between 6-8 weeks with competitors
 * Access is requested to the SIP team and subject to approval

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Katy Flood
 * Julia Ayala Paviour 
 * Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*

 

*Queries:* 
 # Will applications for new consumers be a quicker process instead of 6-18 months it takes external consumers to start accessing the cache?
 # Who will control the new consumer process?

 

*Dependencies:* 
 * Backward compatibility SIA is able to allow External consumers to retrieve cached data until the full SIA is available

column1: (3844) - External Consumers via Automated pricing feeds (Backward Compatible SOLR)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.21|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Automated Pricing feeds allows third party digital display and paid search agencies to query SOLR, which automatically pulls through the desired price and information to the advert

It is imperative that when a new BAH cache becomes available, these consumers still display lead in pricing as per today without any impact to how they currently interface.

It is accepted that should consumers wish to benefit from enhancements a new cache will offer, then they would be forced to change how they interface (CNG-393).



*EPIC description, acceptance criteria and Definition of Done:*

* BAH require a b/w SOLR API that only returns searches for BADP airline brand and passenger mix based upon 2 adults. Any other airline brands or passenger mixes would be unexpected by current consumers and must only be returned via full API’s.
* BAH UAT confirms that all AC listed below are working as expected for all existing users of SOLR
* The relevant code and artefacts are moved into production and transferred into BAU support successfully

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* existing external consumers of BAH’s cached index (Solr) to be wholly unaffected by this projects implementation *so that* we don’t depend on consumers making changes to simply retain the as-is



*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - FLYR*

*Given* BAH advertise pricing externally via a 3rd party agent (MGOMD) who provide Digital Display and Pay per Click Advertising

*When* their data feed provider (FLYR) queries Solr following the implementation of CNG

*Then* the responses they received will be unchanged from what they would have received from the APC

*And* BAH’s advertising campaigns are wholly unaffected by the implementation of CNG        



*Key Info:*

* FLYR provide a data link between BAH and the 3rd party agencies who run our advertising campaigns.
* FLYR offer self-service software whereby BAH can set up the routes they want to advertise, this then dictates the Solr data that FLYR query
* Following the link below shows the data that FLYR passes through to Adylic (part of MG OMD). In this example it's just Sharm el Sheikh and Malta, but the link will work with any 3 digit IATA code at the end. 
[https://ba-api.xcheck.co/v2/tables/ac418d52-6e73-4106-a1ad-a5f5bb333bed?format=html&destination=SSH,MLA|https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fba-api.xcheck.co%2Fv2%2Ftables%2Fac418d52-6e73-4106-a1ad-a5f5bb333bed%3Fformat%3Dhtml%26destination%3DSSH%2CMLA&data=05%7C01%7Csam.miles%40holidays.ba.com%7Ce861df7b1baa459b451708dbdb8f8ca8%7Cddd66cceffe14029967c5e15ef73127f%7C0%7C0%7C638345181803031134%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=YODXqssc4%2FIrVLVctE%2FTY3yAzxldEJQBYPuhHWVE2no%3D&reserved=0] 
* It is not yet currently known what data this API generates is taken directly from Solr in comparison to data created/mapped/sourced by FLYR.



*Key Stakeholder/s:*

Martin Brine

Sarah Boyett

Katy Flood

Julia Ayala Paviour 

Hugh Warmisham
