column1: (3844) - Internal consumers (Backward Compatible SOLR)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.20|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS] 



*Background:*

There are various Internal tools around BA.com that are used to further promote DP and GO lead in prices and offers such as the [Ba.com|http://Ba.com] homepage or Holiday finder etc. 

It is imperative that when a new BAH cache becomes available, these consumers still display lead in pricing as per today without any impact to how they currently interface. 

It is accepted that should consumers wish to benefit from enhancements a new cache will offer, then they would be forced to change how they interface (CNG-393).



*EPIC description, acceptance criteria and Definition of Done:*

* BAH require a b/w SOLR API that only returns searches for BADP airline brand and passenger mix based upon 2 adults. Any other airline brands or passenger mixes would be unexpected by current consumers and must only be returned via full API’s.
* BAH UAT confirms that all AC listed below are working as expected for all existing users of SOLR
* The relevant code and artefacts are moved into production and transferred into BAU support successfully



*Requirement:*

*I want* existing internal consumers of BAH’s cached data (Solr) to be wholly unaffected by this projects implementation *so that* we don’t depend on consumers making changes to simply retain the as-is



*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1a – Flight Summary Page - Partial date range selected      [BA stakeholder -* [*Ba.com*|http://Ba.com] *Book team]*

*Given* the cache has been populated with GO search results 

*When* the Customer made a search via Flight only proposition on BA.com and lands on the Flight summary page

*And* has amended the dates of the original search

*Then* cached prices are used to promote Hotel only and Car only pricing to encourage Customers to add to their booking

*Please see attached Use cases and screenshots for reference



*AC.1b – ALP / Flight Summary - Realtime package rate call is not successful     [BA stakeholder -* [*Ba.com*|http://Ba.com] *Book team]*

*Given* the cache has been populated with GO search results 

*When* the Customer made a search via Flight only proposition on ba.com -a-nd lands on the Flight summary page

*And* the real time xDist call does not return package prices

*Then* GO cached prices are used to promote Hotels and Cars to encourage Customers to add to their booking



{color:#172b4d}*AC.2 - MMB*{color}

{color:#172b4d}*Given*{color}{color:#172b4d} the cache has been populated with GO search results {color}

*When* the Customer has logged into any of the current live versions of MMB (new design, beta design, legacy)

{color:#172b4d}*Then*{color}{color:#172b4d} BAH cache pricing is displayed subject to MMB propensity rules (example attached) {color}

{color:#172b4d}*Please see attached Use cases and screenshots for reference{color}

*New MMB design does not currently show Car lead in prices, but is expected into production prior to CNG

 

*AC.3 - Holiday Finder*

*Given* {color:#172b4d}the cache has been populated with FH search results for 2 adults from London airports{color}

*When* the Customer accesses Holiday finder directly e.g. via Discover section of BA.com

*Or* by deeplinking to Holiday Finder via offers around BA.com e.g City breaks page

*Then* Holiday finder continues to show available cached prices and data based on Flight and Hotel, 2 adults from London airports regardless if filtered or unfiltered view

*Please see attached Use cases and screenshots for reference

 

*AC.4 - Holiday Finder modal*

*Given* the cache has been populated with FH search results 

*When* the Customer has clicked on the Hotel offer on Holiday Finder

*Then* cached prices and data for available dates continue to be shown in calendar format for Economy, Premium Economy or Business Class (if applicable)

*And* 'the following information is still able to be obtained via the cache:

* Hotel name
* Star rating
* Trip advisor details
* Hotel description
* Price per person form
* Departing information e.g. route and dates
* Returning information e.g. route and dates
* Accommodation details

*And* Any unavailable dates will remain unpopulated

*Please see attached Use cases and screenshots for reference

  

*AC.5 - (HF) Hotel Details page*

*Given* the cache has been populated with DP and GO search results 

*When* the Customer has clicked through from Holiday finder

*Or* clicks on to the Hotel details page via BA.com offers

*Then* cached prices against each available date are shown within a calendar view on the Flight and Hotel and Hotel only tabs

*And* any unavailable dates will remain unpopulated

*And* the following information is still able to be obtained via the cache:

* Price per person form
* Departing information e.g. route and dates
* Returning information e.g. route and dates
* Accommodation details

*And* Supporting information continues to be available (left of the POD) providing richer content e.g. Hotel address, check in / out details etc

*Please see attached Use cases and screenshots for reference 

 

*AC.6 - Teamsite*

*Given* the cache has been populated with DP and GO search results 

*When* the Customer navigates around the following Teamsite pages to view lead in prices:

> BA.com homepage

>...flights-and-holidays/holidays
>...destinations/holiday-types/city-breaks
>...destinations/holiday-types/beach-holidays
>...offers/late-deals
>...offers/flight-deals
>...destinations/holiday-types/all-inclusive-holidays
>...destinations/holiday-types/luxury-holidays
>...flights-and-holidays/car-hire

*Then* all lead in prices are pre-populated with cached prices and data e.g. Price per person, duration, dates and destination Cities.

*And* clicking on Teamsite offer deeplinks the Customer to {color:#172b4d}Holiday Finder or Search results{color}

*Please see attached Use cases and screenshots for reference
  

+*Key Info:*+

BA Digitals' version of the [ba.com|http://ba.com] homepage (classic HP) effective Q3 2023 does not have anything similar to the old SFD’s proposition pods that used to present lead in pricing.  BAH are currently 'negotiating' with BA if/when they can be added back in to the search bar. Nexus homepage have indicated Q1, classic HP (BA Digital) had said Q4 but this may slip. In summary, there may be a new consumer of old Solr prior to the go-live of CNG.

*Flight summary*

* Flight summary has replaced ALP pages for the large majority of scenarios and only used for Hotline. Katy Flood happy with us to only test Flight summary but we can test ALP if we have capacity to do so as a low priority
* Switch sell uses live searches 

*MMB*

* Depending on the original proposition the customer made the booking under, Hotel and/or Car offers will be shown e.g. Flight and Hotel will only show Car

*Holiday Finder*

* Currently Holiday Finder only uses Flight and Hotel, from London airports and for 2 adults.
* Future exploitation would be to allow any pax mix, all propositions markets and any airport
* Default screen is non-filtered
* No availability on live searches takes user to Holiday Finder for certain scenarios

*Holiday finder Modal*

* When a user has clicked on a Hotel name, a Pop up is presented with more details and availability for that Hotel. Information on the pop up is predominantly taken from cached data (See AC.5)

*Teamsite*

* Listed Teamsite pages are only the key pages and not the exhaustive list.
* From the cached price, Teamsite is configured to take the user to Search results, Holiday finder or BA Hotel details

*Hotel details*

* Hotel details page has a Calendar pod with supporting cached information for lead in prices e.g. [http://www.britishairways.com/destinations/hotel-information/barcelona/san-agustin/ES-BCN-3181658|http://www.britishairways.com/destinations/hotel-information/barcelona/san-agustin/ES-BCN-3181658|smart-link] 
* Hotel details page makes an additional call to xHotel to obtain richer content for supporting info such as accommodation details i.e. address, check in / check out



+*Note - SFD pods, Servicing Emails, PEGA and Pegasus were all originally specified within dedicated acceptance criteria's when this requirement was first written, but have since been withdrawn over time and do not require consideration for development or test execution.*+ _See the History of this Jira for original AC’s and Key Info._



*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Matthew Parratt - BOD
* Katy Flood - BAH (SFD, ALP/Flight summary, Holiday Finder inc modal, MMB and Hotel details)
* Hugh Warmisham - BAH (Teamsite and PEGA)
* Martin Brine (CNG - Commercial)

column1873:
30/Mar/23 2:44 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Some additional information from Martin Brine about the ALP page logic:

* There is additional logic to used cached pricing on the ALP page if the real time call to xDist for package pricing fails (eg timeout, price cheaper than FO)
* The system searches for a GO price for the full package duration
* Eg if the package search is for 7 nights
* it will use a 7 night/day duration* from the cache if loaded for HO/CO
* If there is no 7 night/day duration* it takes the next best shorter duration fit
* Whilst it uses a 7 or x duration…and this is the bit I cant recall exactly, it divides by the duration to display per day price
* In reality we have limited HO/CO durations loaded so ifs often a best fit.

The above logic is in addition is separate from the logic where a SOLr call is made if the customer selects a partial date range, meaning package prices need to be replaced by daily (GO) prices.

[~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1] will include this scenario in his test plan. Martin’s idea for testing this scenario is to unload hotels for a destination in the switch sell table, to ensure package prices cannot be returned.

Jon

column1: (3844) - Non-Functional Requirement - Response Time
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.3|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Both Internal and External consumers will need to obtain prices immediately. Internal consumers will need to be able to populate lead in prices on consumer tools such as Holiday finder and SFD, which provide prices when search criteria or filters have been applied. External consumers will need to populate prices when customers apply searches to their websites

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* consumers to be provided with cached prices within a second *so that* lead in prices and search results can be populated without any noticeable delay

 

*Acceptance criteria:* 

*AC.1 - Consumers accessing indexed prices*

*Given* either an internal or external consumer has made a request for cached pricing

*When* the request is received by either the backward Solr API or the full API 

*Then* a response is returned to the consumer within 1 second



*Design Consideration*

It is accepted that the full e2e response time starting from when a user interacts with the front end and ending with when data is rendered back to them may be greater than one second due to processing unrelated to Solr. This requirement should measure the time between a request being received by CNG and response being sent back to the consumer.  



*Queries:* 

# Can expected consumption speeds be provided to BAH during performance testing?

*Dependencies:* 

# Consumers are pointing at the correct end points to ensure they can consume the data

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* Sarah Boyett
* Katy Flood
* Julia Ayala Paviour

column1: (3844) - Price refresh
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.22|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]
 * ER.27

 

*Background:*

DBS Support have frequent requests from Commercial about when prices will be refreshed ready for planned promotion/campaigns. To assist DBS Support in answering queries, they would like a forecasted date and time of when the price will next be refreshed

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* the date and time of when cached prices will be next searched and indexed *so that* refresh timescales are readily available for the business

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Price refresh*

*Given* prices are refreshed based on the frequency set in the search request

*When* the search has been indexed and has produced a price

*Then* the date and time of the next price refresh is able to be queried

*And* is available in the cache report

 

     

*Key Info:*
 * Forecasted price refresh is to approximately show when the price is likely to be refreshed for each search.

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Iain Laird
 * Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*
 *  Forecasted price refresh is calculated by indexing time + frequency

 

*Assumptions:*

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*

column1862:
11/Mar/20 12:06 PM;557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1;Hi Dhivya, thanks that's interesting!

My query is more around this bit from AC.1

*Then* the date and time of the next price refresh is able to be queried

*And* is available in the cache report

 

I get that we can check the price refresh once we've burst after a record has expired so should provide a new price (if applicable) but I'm not sure what this means around that the NEXT price refresh can be queried? And is available in a Cache report?

So to me it sounds like before the next price refresh (i.e. before the record hits the expiry time/date) that there is a way to know when the exact time will be for the next refresh?

 

Below is an example.

 

For any Search request which has plenty of time yet to run (i.e Start Execution Date was 21/2 and it has an End Execution date of 31/3) and it has a frequency of 72 hours. If the Business asked me, when is the next refresh of that record, how can I tell?

Is it displayed in the Schema (or anywhere else DBS Support can check) where I can see when it was last refreshed so I can calculate based on the frequency, when it's next due to be BURST? Is there something like that?

Does that make sense?
column1863:
11/Mar/20 12:48 PM;62fa71c79c368329a7aef470;Hi Tony,

Yes, we can see next refresh time in Schema, that field name is expiry time. which is available in all ancillary table. For your example next refresh will happen 24/2. You can see this value in expiry time field in schema.

Thanks
Dhivya

column1871:
06/Jul/22 2:42 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi [~accountid:557058:26b54124-fd3b-4446-a59f-fb232f56b6d1] ,

The basic testing for this could be done using the following type of SQL queries

*1. Lookup based on an ancillary id*

select ancillary_id, expiry_time, frequency, expiry_time + interval '1' hour * frequency as expected_refresh_time from ancillary_flt_htl_cache where ancillary_id = '66744'

*2. Lookup based on a CMT reference*

select ancillary_id, expiry_time, frequency, expiry_time + interval '1' hour * frequency as expected_refresh_time from ancillary_flt_htl_cache where ancillary_id IN
(
select ancillary_id from ancillary_flt_htl_cache where cmt_search_ref_id = '10140'
)

This works for the simple case where you know searches are enabled and supposed to be running.

If we wanted to run this say for all searches in the CMT, we would also need to allow for situations such as:
 * old ancillary ids awaiting cleardown by the housekeeping jobs
 * checking the scheduled execution dates to see if the search is due to run
 * checking the scheduled execution time...search will only run after this

So that's the kind of thing Support will probably want to run once we go live. Just need to have a think if we will need to do that as part of UAT as well.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: (3844) - Facility to compare cached data in index vs availability response from xDist (SOAP UI option)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.46|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Being able to generate availability responses helps to test availability responses for destinations or particular date ranges to help troubleshooting a cache availability issue, i.e. missing prices, price discrepancies missing hotels on HF.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to generate availability responses via SOAP UI *so that* price discrepancies can be compared when varying fare recommendations have been applied to booking flow (cabin upgrades disabled) and APC (cabin grades enabled) requests

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Generating Availability responses via SOAP UI*

*Given* an error has been reported to Support

*When* availability issue or price discrepancy has occurred

*Then* DBS Support are able to generate availability requests and responses via SOAP UI

*And* all Search request criteria is able to be manipulated to recreate search
 e.g. amend destinations, Pax mix, dates, airline brand etc

     

*Key Info:*
 * DBS Support have a SOAP UI project suite set up that allows them to generate APC responses to compare prices between live and the cache as some time price differences occur.
 * Examples of current SOAP Request and Response attached

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Iain Laird
 * Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 # The availability responses will match that received in live to ensure that DBS Support can troubleshoot

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*

column1857:
26/Jan/22 2:13 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;To clarify the confusion between reqs CNG-48, 74, 75, 76.

The overall support requirements in this area are:
 * Full e2e test capability from CMT thru to index caching (ie setup of initial test envs and the ability to create new test envs easily when reqd)
 * the ability to compare cached data in the index vs an availability request to xDist. Both in test envs and in live. (to allow us to highlight if there are problems with cached data).

Going forward will will treat the requirements as follows:
 * CNG-48 covers the CMT part of #1 
 * CNG-74 covers the firing search requests / caching / indexing part of #1
 * CNG-75 and CNG-76 are different options for launching xDist search requests ie #2, with the GUI version CNG-76 being the preference. 

I have updated the Requirement title to make this clearer.

Jon

column1: (3844) - Test environment setup (burst & batch controller, indexing)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [N/A|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

To troubleshoot or test fixed bugs and/or new functionality, there will need to be a test environment to ensure this is working as expected prior to being released in to live.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* indexing to mirror the live cached process *so that* all functionality can be tested and verified prior to being released in to live

 

*Acceptance criteria:* 

 

*AC.1 - Testing new and existing functionality*

*Given* a new index is being built

*When* the solution has been built

*Then* all existing functionality is available and able to be tested prior to release

*And* new Change Requests and bug fixes are able to be tested within the environment

*And* Test environments must be linked to a Searching tool and Index to allow for end to end testing 

     

*Key Info:*
 * Test environment to be available prior to release and continue to be available for future use.

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 * When Index is available for testing, index will be connected to the new searching tool so the populating cache can be tested thoroughly

 

*Queries:*

column1: (3844) - Housekeeping
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.25|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

As there will be a multitude of searches run each day, any redundant data will need to be removed from the index

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to ensure that no redundant data is stored in the index *so that* capacity or performance of the index is not compromised

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Purging Redundant data*

*Given* search results are indexed frequently

*And* prices are refreshed

*When* any data within the index becomes redundant

*Then* it becomes marked for deletion after 48 hours 

 

From a business perspective, index data is considered redundant if:

* The search that generated it is DELETED from the CMT
* The CMT search is AMENDED such that the original entries have been replaced and are no longer required
* The travel dates are prior to the current date (time?)
** this applies whether the search has been setup with fixed travel dates or leadtime (rolling searches)
* For searches with fixed execution dates which are prior to the current date
* The above confirms the business scenarios known to BAH. Further technical scenarios of redundant data may also be identified by developers when confirming the low level design.

Index data is not considered redundant purely if it’s 48 hours old. (It could be an active search running with a low frequency) 


*Key Info:* 

* Housekeeping of redundant data is expected to be a daily scheduled task (rather than continually running). It is therefore accepted that the actual time of deletion won’t be exactly 48 hours after the data becomes redundant. It will take place on the next scheduled run after 48 hours has elapsed.
* There is no requirement to archive any data as part of the housekeeping process - once it is deleted it is gone
* In an extreme situation where technical issues prevent prices from being updated in the index for a long period, it may become necessary to suspend the housekeeping job to retain older prices. This would be a manual process and is not expected to required TCS build.
* Commercial analysis queries will need to be aware of the presence of redundant data but the solution will be in writing the CA queries correctly. There are no additional housekeeping reqs as a result of this consideration.

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Iain Laird
* Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*

* As per the Business continuity requirement on CNG-66, if the design is reliant on backed up data that data may need to be kept for longer than 48 hours.

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies:*

column1863:
27/Feb/24 2:19 PM;6365c865f7ad721e78509db6;Hi [~accountid:5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358] , Could you please clarify below statements given in the requirement : 

_1) The travel dates are prior to the current date (time?)_
The travel dates to be considered would be CO - Pickup Date, HO - CheckIn Date and FH, FC - Departure Date. Please confirm these or any other dates to be considered.

_2) Index data is not considered redundant purely if it’s 48 hours old. (It could be an active search running with a low frequency)_ 

Because frequency won’t matter if travel date is older than 48hours as it anyways becomes redundant and other cases (date not older than 48hrs or current date or future date) it becomes non-redundant record.
column1864:
27/Feb/24 4:22 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Sushant

For 1) Yes those are the correct fields. Just remember that there’s some inconsistency with the naming of departure date

* SOLR b/w calls the field depDate for FH but departureDate for FC
* we are calling both depDate in their indices

For 2) . You are correct that frequency won’t matter if the travel date is older than 48 hours. My point is that we can’t just look at the expiry datetime to determine if something is redundant. ie  if we have a search that is for a future date, but it refreshes only every 3rd day then the price shouldn’t disappear after 2 days…because it  is not redundant.

Thanks,

Jon

column1: (3844) - Dashboard
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * N/A

 

*Background:*

BAH currently have to refer to many different areas to collate key information and also be aware of system performance. The preference would be for this key information and system performance can be contained 'one stop shop' and more visually accessible on the same screen

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* a dashboard that visually shows the performance of systems within the cache *so that* performance is monitored and assessed within the same area

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Displaying System status*

*Given* there are many systems that are included in the end to end cache process

*When* the systems have been implemented

*Then* all of the key system's status will need to be visually illustrated on a dashboard

*And* Green will represent the system is running a Normal service

*And* Amber will represent that the Service is delayed by longer than one hour

*And* Red will represent that the Service has stopped

*And* RAG status is configurable to define timescales

*And* the status is dynamically updated

 

*AC.2 - Schedule / Indexing Reports on the Dashboard*

*Given* the Schedule, Search & Indexing Report is being produced for DBS Support

*When* the schedule has started to run for the day

*Then* show and update the following schedule information on the dashboard:
 * Total searches scheduled
 * Schedule start time
 * Estimate schedule completion time
 * +/- of how the schedule is running against estimated times
 * Total successful searches (Count)
 * Total successful searches (percentage)
 * Total Failed searches (Count)
 * Total Failed searches (percentage)

*And* show the following Indexing information on the dashboard
 * Total searches indexed
 * Indexing start time
 * Estimate Indexing completion time
 * +/- of how the Index is running against estimated times
 * Total successful Index (Count)
 * Total successful Index (percentage)
 * Total Failed Index (Count)
 * Total Failed Index (percentage)

*And* progress bar displaying the progress through the schedule for that day

*And* all of the information is refreshed every 15 minutes

 

*AC.3 - Destination/Supplier failure Reports on the Dashboard*

*Given* a Destination and Supplier report is being produced for DBS Support

*When* the schedule starts running

*Then* the dashboard will dynamically present the top 10 destinations aggregated count of most failures

*And* will compare the average from the last 7 days vs the actual amount of failures at certain intervals i.e. Actual v Average of last 7 days

*And* the Intervals will be shown at 8am, 11am, 2pm, 5pm

*And* will be presented in a table format

*And* the Report when clicked on will be linked to the full Destination/Supplier failure report (see CNG-70, AC.2))

*And* all the report is refreshed every 15 minutes

 

*AC.4 - xDist CPU on the Dashboard*

*Given* xDist CPU is being produced for DBS Support

*When* the schedule starts running

*Then* the dashboard will dynamically present the xDist CPU graph from Today

*And* will display the date, heading and legend information (see CNG-70, AC.3)

*And* the graph is refreshed every 15 mins i.e. aligned with intervals shown in the graph

 

*AC.5 - Load Capacity - Forecast v Actual on the Dashboard*

*Given* a report is being created to provide forecasted and actual capacity percentage

*When* the schedule has prioritized at midnight

*Then* the forecasted load capacity percentage is presented on the dashboard for that specific date

*And* when the schedule has completed, the actual load capacity percentage will be presented on the dashboard for that specific date

 

 
 *Key Info:*
 * DP Stats to retain all graphs and reports 
 * APC CPU usage example - [http://dpstats.baplc.com/DP_Modelling_V3/2018-11/xdist-apc-cpu-30m.html]
 * DP APC Searches example - [http://dpstats.baplc.com/DP_APC_Searches/2018-11/APC_searches.log.15]
 * Historical data is retained
 * Graphs in a date range can be compared to another date range e.g. Todays graph can be compared to yesterdays graph

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Iain Laird
 * Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*

1. The stated refresh times are subject to technical advice

 

*Queries:*
 # Are new graphs able to be created in Kibana from data similar to the APC graphs and data in DP Stats?
 # If DBS Support wanted to add new parts to the dashboard from Indexed info, would this be available to them or would this require a CR?
 # Can expected indexing times be provided to BAH during performance testing?

 

*Dependencies:*

column1: (3844) - Monitoring
column45:
-*Epic requirement:*-
 * -[ER.27|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]-

 -- 

-*Background:*-

-Search requests will need to be monitored as they are being burst, searched and indexed, so in the event of any delays or stoppages that these issues can be resolved as quickly as possible.-

 -- 

-*Requirement:*-

-*I want* to be able to monitor the status of the burst, schedule and the indexing *so that* if there are any delays or stoppages that these are investigated and logged-

 -- 

-*Acceptance criteria:*-

 -- 

-*AC.1 - Monitoring delays and stoppages to the Burst controller*-

-*Given* Search requests are being burst-

-*When* the burst controller is about to process searches-

-*Then* Monitors are set up to identify delays and/or stoppages to the burst controller-

-*And* specified configurable groups are notified by email of any delays and/or stoppages to the burst controller-

-*And* email to contain the following information:-
 * -Date / time-
 * -Server name-
 * -Reason e.g. burst delayed{color:#ff0000} {color}-  

 -- 

-*AC.2 - Monitoring delays and stoppages to the Schedule*-

-*Given* Search requests are being scheduled and indexed-

-*When* the schedule is about to process searches-

-*Then* Monitors are set up to identify delays and/or stoppages to the schedule-

-*And* specified configurable groups are notified by email of any delays and/or stoppages to the schedule-

-*And* email to contain the following information:-
 * -Date / time-
 * -Server name-
 * -Reason e.g. Schedule delayed{color:#ff0000} {color}-  

 -- 

-*AC.3 - Monitoring delays and stoppages to the Index*-

-*Given* Search requests are being indexed-

-*When* the schedule is about to process searches-

-*Then* Monitors are set up to identify delays and/or stoppages to the index-

-*And* specified configurable groups are notified by email of any delays and/or stoppages to the Index-

-*And* email to contain the following information:-
 * -Date / time-
 * -Server name-

column1: (3844) - Reporting
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.27|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

*Background:*

* DPS Support use reports on DPStats ([https://dpstats.baplc.com/|https://dpstats.baplc.com/]) to assess system performance including the cache (APC)
* Not all of the current reports are used
* Some reports will not be affected by the switch to CNG
* Some of the used reports will require logic changes to ensure that they continue to report accurately



*Requirement:*

I want existing DPStats reports to continue to output accurate information:

# During the period where APC is still the live cache but searches start to be loaded and executed in the new CNG architecture as well (APC live, CNG quiet live checkout)
# When the APC has been decommissioned and all DP cache searches are running on the new CNG architecture



*Additional Information and assumptions:*

* reports on xRez servers will not need to change
* some xDist server reports (eg  DP_searches, DP_APC_Searches) use session id to identify APC search requests (like ‘apc%', not like 'apc%'). This logic will need to change to account for the different session id format for CNG ie 'tx-04%’
* other xDist reports use a server list to split between APC and non-APC activity. The logic for these should not need to change
* Certain reports have things like apc in the title or contents. I'm not intending at this stage to do any renaming of reports or folders etc as this are not critical changes.  
* For clarity, the following reports were considered but no changes are reqd:
** DP_APC_Backlog- we could update this but it isn't currently used.
** Solr_stats - this report relates to the creation of DP solr indexes and will cease to be relevant once we switch APC off
** Price-Feed - will cease to be relevant once we switch APC off and is currently reporting zeros anyway

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

The following reports are currently used by DPS Support and should accurately report non-cache / APC / CNG data as appropriate: 

+*DP daily log analysis menu*+



AC1. DP_searches

AC2. DP_APC_Searches

AC3. Thread-Queue-Stats



+*DP Graphs & Stats menu*+



AC4. Today's Graphs

AC5. History Graphs

AC6. xDist CPU usage

AC7. APC CPU usage

AC8. DP Searches Graphs



*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Iain Laird
* Caroline Easton
* Martin Brine

----



*-Background:-*

-DBS Support manually take time to collate information from different logs and reports to assess system performance. BAH would like reports to ensure that search requests are scheduled and indexed when expected with reports being presented and stored in the same place.-

 

*-Requirement:-*

*-I want-* -to create reports to illustrate system performance whilst searches and indexing are taking place- *-so that-* -DBS Support are able to evaluate the impact the cache is having on systems-

 

*-Acceptance criteria:-*

 

*-AC.1 - Schedule, Search & Indexing Report-*

*-Given-* -DBS Support need to analyse system performance-

*-When-* -each search has been scheduled, searched or indexed-

*-Then-* -a dynamic report is created containing the following information:-

* -Date-
* -Search Request ID-
* -Ancillary ID-
* -Airline Brand-
* -Market-
* -Proposition-
* -Origin-
* -Destination-
* -OJ City code-
* -Pax Mix-
* -Priority-
* -Frequency-
* -Time of each search is scheduled for-
* -Time of when each search response has been received-
* -Time of when each search is indexed-
* -Duration between search response received and index time-

*-And-* -time is to be HH:MM:SS-

*-And-* -the report is to indicate if the search and index has been successful or has failed-

*-And-* -the report to show a summary of the following:-

* -Total scheduled searches-
* -Percentage of progress through the schedule-
* -Total searches complete-
* -Total successful searches-
* -Percentage successful searches out of total searches-
* -Total failed searches-
* -Percentage failed searches out of total searches-
* -Total Indexed searches-
* -Total successful Indexes-
* -Percentage successful Indexes-
* -Total failed Indexes-
* -Percentage failed indexes-
* -Estimated completion time of schedule-
* -Estimated completion time of Index-

*-And-* -each of the above to be comparable with last 7 days e.g. 22/11/18 - 50,000; 21/11/18 - 45,000-

*-And-* -previous days reports are stored and retained e.g. 00:00-23.59 01/01/2018 of each report-

*-And-* -to be refreshed every 15 minutes-

 

*-AC.2 - Destination-*

*-Given-* -DBS Support need to evaluate errors for specific destinations-

*-When-* -search responses have failed for any reason e.g. supplier availability error-

*-Then-* -a dynamic report is created showing the aggregated count of failures by destinations, which can be broken down by suppliers and the failure reasons counts-

-e.g.-

* -New York 1000-
** -Pegstour 200-
*** -No availability 100-
*** -XML is not valid 100-

*-And-* -Suppliers and failure reasons are aggregated to show their total overall counts-

*-And-* -each count is supported by a percentage figure-

*-And-* -Destination-, Supplier- and failure reason aggregated counts only are comparable with last 7 days-

*-And-* -previous days reports are stored and retained e.g. 00:00-23.59 01/01/2018 of each report- 

*-And-* -to be refreshed every 15 minutes-

 

*-AC.3 - xDist CPU Report-*

*-Given-* -individual searches will be scheduled and searched via xDist-

*-When-* -search results are starting to be returned-

*-Then-* -a dynamic report of the xdist CPU usage is created-

*-And-* -the report is updated after every 15 minutes-

*-And-* -the results are shown as a graph showing each servers activity- 

*-And-* -previous days reports are retained and stored-

 

*-AC.4 - Last indexed price greater than 48 hours Report-*

*-Given-* -the schedule is susceptible to planned or unplanned delays-

*-When-* -any indexed prices have not been refreshed within 48 hours or more,-

*-And-* -where the lead times or travel dates are 330 days or less-

*-Then-* -a daily report is produced containing the following information:-

* -Date of range of Report-
* -Search request ID-
* -Ancillary ID-
* -Airline-
* -Proposition-
* -Market-
* -Origin-
* -Destination-
* -OJ city code-
* -Duration-
* -Frequency-
* -Travel dates-
* -Lead times-
* -Pax mix-
* -Cabin-
* -Date and Time last indexed-

*-And-* -the report is to be emailed at 9am every day to a shared BAH distribution list-

*-And-* -the report is to show impacted searches ranging from previous report to current report i.e.  9am the previous day to 9am on the current day-

*-And-* -BAH can manage the shared email distribution list-

*-And-* -both the duration price last indexed and lead time duration are configurable i.e. 48 hours and 330 days can be amended-

*-And-* -the report does not need to be emailed, ** if there are no impacted searches within the set criteria e.g. if no results in the report as all searches that are 330 days or less have been indexed within 48 hours-

{color:#d04437}-See below comment-{color}

 

*-AC.5 - Load Capacity Forecast v Actual Report-*

*-Given-* -individual searches are burst and scheduled at midnight-

*-When-* -the schedule has prioritised and ordered the searches-

*-Then-* -a daily report is created and contains the following information:-

* -Todays date-
* -Total Flight and Hotel searches - Forecasted-
* -Total Flight and car searches - Forecasted-
* -Total Hotel only searches - Forecasted-
* -Total Car only searches - Forecasted-
* -Total overall searches - Forecast (Four propositions combined)-
* -Schedule start time i.e. 00:00 (Actual)-
* -Forecasted end time of daily schedule  i.e. 22:30-
* -Forecast time capacity used percentage i.e. forecast percentage of the day to be used between 00:00 to 23.59-  -_(based on 22:30 and the calculation shown below e.g. 93.75%)_-

*-And-* -once the schedule has completed, the report the following 'actual' information-

* -Total Flight and Hotel searches - Actual-
* -Total Flight and car searches - Actual-
* -Total Hotel only searches - Actual-
* -Total Car only searches - Actual-
* -Total overall searches - Actual-
* -Actual end time of daily schedule  i.e. 23:30-
* -Actual time capacity used percentage i.e. forecast percentage of the day to be used between 00:00 to 23.59-  -_(based on 22:30 and the calculation shown below e.g. 97.92%)_-

*-And-* -the date information to be stored for 365 days e.g. logs 30/04/2019 and will be removed on 30/04/2020-

*-And-* -all times to be shown as HH:MM-

*-And-* -all percentages to be shown to 2 decimal places-

     

*-Key Info:-*

* -DP stats already provides information on APC searches and xDist APC CPU usage. BAH would like this to be available all one same tool as other reports-
* -DBS Support refer to Tableau for APC error tables for count by availability and destination for the last 7 days (see attached)-
* -Flight, Hotel and car suppliers to be included-
* -Refresh rate is 15 minutes, subject to load testing. This may be reduced to 30 minutes refresh if 15 minutes is impacting the system-
* -Load capacity report - Calculation for capacity has been the following  - =IF(H1956="","",(I1956+H1956)*24*60/1440*100) - See Load Monitoring attachment for APC example-

 

*-Key Stakeholder/s:-*

* -Iain Laird-
* -Caroline Easton-
* -Martin Brine-

 

*-Design considerations:-*

-AC.2 - Destination, Suppliers and Supplier error are able to be collapsible so that info is able to be expanded or reduced depending on users preference-

 

*-Assumptions:-*

# -DP Stats report - DP Searches (see attached) has a column called 'APC', this shows a count of of APC searches every minute. The assumption is that the cache searches will continue to be applied to the report-
# -All information captured within the report is able to be queried-
# -Cache report is easily accessible-
# -15 minutes refresh has not impact on performance and will be tested as part of the load testing-
# -The schedule will be able to provide forecasted times at midnight-

 

*-Queries:-* 

 

*-Dependencies:-*

column1883:
04/Nov/22 2:48 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;An update on this.

After speaking to Support and Martin, I think we will be able to simply these requirements.

+Support's general view+
 * Don’t need a lot of the complexity requested
 * Only use a couple of existing dpstats reports for monitoring the cache(dpstats.baplc.com)
 * DP APC searches (used)
 * APC CPU usage (used)
 * DP APC Backlog – Iain doesn’t think Support use this any more
 * These are the scheduled reports that are used, however most of the querying is done using adhoc SQL, the details of which will vary
 * Even if we come up with queries in advance these may need adapting as we move forward...for that reason it's better if BAH can control the code

I believe that the minimum Support reqs can be delivered by
- Ensuring that existing DPStats reports and OJ error logs are identifying CNG traffic in the same way as APC
- Reviewing any key adhoc SQL the Support team have to see if they are still relevant and how they might need to be adapted.

+Martin's general view+
 * Also says he doesn't need a lot of the complexity requested
 * He has 2 main requirements
- 1. Want to be able to confirm if a particular ancillary id has run on a specific day.
- 2. He wants to be able to understand how long the daily schedule is taking to run (at a high level)...to understand if there is any capacity to add additional searches….or if we are struggling to complete the existing volume in time
 * For 2 he is using a spredsheet S:\Everyone\IT Support (Caroline Easton)\APC_SOLr_Searches\DP Searches 2022.xlsm populated by Support based on the DP_APC_Searches dpstats report

I believe that the minimum Commercial reqs can be delivered by
 * using Kibana front end queries for #1 - ie reviewing the last updated timestamp for an ancillary ids or more likely multiple ancillary ids for a particular destination.
 * For 2 we just need the dpstats reports to continue to work as per Support requirements. Miht be a good idea to automate the data population at some point, but that isn't a CNG deliverable

In addition to delivering the min reqs, I think that there are elements of the original requirements that might be useful and we can deliver in a simpler form.  

Jon
column1884:
04/Nov/22 3:39 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Initial thoughts on reqs beyond the minimum

For AC1 we can
 * check the ancillary tables to monitor which ancillary ideas are expected to run on a particular day and which have been completed
 * I don't think this needs to be scheduled and could be ad-hoc SQL. I think BAH could probably write this.
 * the 'whole schedule' isn't created upfront like the requirements suggests...so I think the estimated end times and % of the way thru are problematic and probably not that useful (priority order and number of searches can change through the day)
 * I'm not sure that it's worth reporting on the time it takes to index the data after it's been returned. I would think it would be more important to have monitors alerting if the time taken to index data was too long.

 For AC2
 * I don't like this requirement - it doesn't match the structure of the data and is far too complex
 * Supplier errors would be logged by xDist in the OJ logs. So I would hope that any existing SQL looking at cache errors could be re-used
 * I need to discuss this with Iain but I hope there would also be sufficient data in the OJ logs to identify problematic destinations (Using the ancillary ids or CNG index data would be problematic as they only hold the current position with no historical view)
 * If we do this, it can probably be done as an adhoc report - I doubt anyone would review it any more than weekly

for AC3 - just keep existing report working

for AC 4
 * Could keep this simple and just run ad-hoc queries via Kibana to look for any timestamps great than a specific time
 * Or make it a little more funky and have an automated Kibana query feeding into a dashboard - this definitely would not be required for day 1

for AC5
 * I don't think most of this is useful
 * Dpstats should give us the number of searches by proposition and identify if searches are finishing within expected window
 * I'd be more interested in looking at the ancillary tables to see how many entries were failing and leading to additional retries.

I'll have a think about all this and confirm a simplified scope.

Jon

column1: (3844) - Error Logging  - Batch Controller (CAPTWO)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.28|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

During the caching process, there could potentially be several failures or errors that could occur around the schedule, search requests and responses to suppliers and indexing. When any error that has occurred during the process, this will need to be logged to allow DBS Support to identify when errors have occurred

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all Batch Controller related errors to be captured *so that* all related failures are able to be identified easily and investigated

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Logging cache errors*

*Given* search requests are being processed by the batch controller

*When* any type of failure or error occurs

*Then* any searches failed to schedule are not re-attempted and logged

*And* any failed search request errors are not to be re-attempted and logged 

*And* any failed search response errors are not to be re-attempted and logged 

*And* all errors are logged with sufficient context information for DBS Support to understand what has happened and investigate them. The actual data to be logged will be confirmed later on.
 * -TLOGGED-
 * -ERRORID-
 * -SEARCH REQUEST ID-
 * -ANCILLARY ID-
 * -ERRORCODE-
 * -ERRORMESSAGE-
 * -SESSIONID-
 * -SERVERNAME-
 * -SUPPLIER-
 * -PROPOSITION-
 * -PRIORITY-
 * -FREQUENCY-
 * -ORIGIN-
 * -DESTINATION-
 * -REQUEST-
 * -RESPONSE (see below comment)-
 * -KEYDATA-
 * -NUMADULTS-
 * -NUMCHILDREN-
 * -CHILDAGE-
 * -NUMINFANTS-
 * -SEARCH REQUEST CREATEDDATE-
 * -AIRLINEBRAND-

*And* Session ID affix to show as 'ES'

*And* all errors to be time stamped and show as DD-MM-YYYY HH:MM:SS

     

*Key Info:*
 * The decision has been made not to have an independent cache error_log -and logging location-on whether errors will be logged to the Independent cache error log or the DP error log will be subject to cost and effort and is yet to be determined (CNG-46 / CNG-47)--
 * -All existing columns and information of existing DP error log to continue to be available-

 * Currently only a failed  F+C and CO will retry once should it fail, I believe F&H and HO has been suppressed to avoid hitting suppliers

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Iain Laird
 * Caroline Easton

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 * -The columns listed are based on existing columns available-

 

*Queries:* 

 

*Dependencies:*

The actual information available to be logged is likely to depended on the type of error encountered. The fields listed here are probably only applicable for some types of errors. The key thing is that enough information is logged to tell BAH Support what has happened and allow them to follow it up. 

Some specific testing will be reqd to evaluate the quality of information being logged to see if it is sufficient for Support needs. This will involve triggering different failures to see what is logged.

https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-444 - FC

https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-457 - HO

column1866:
27/Jan/23 9:28 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi,

I’ve been having a look at the logs for the Batch Controller (bah-bahem) in the SIT environment. there seems to be 2 types of files produced each day under /webserver/tomcat-1a/logs/apps, an Error log and an Info log. Eg *evm-bahem-Error.2023-01-25, evm-bahem-Info.2023-01-25 (see attached logs)*

+Looking at the error file+, I can see that errors are being logged with codes such as EVM_BAHEM_9009 and EVM_BAHEM_1005 along with session ids and timestamps. Some of the messages being logged are generic / vague but it’s likely that this is what is being passed back by xDist.

*The one important thing that I’ve noticed so far, is that not all of these errors seem to be logging the ancillaryId(s) in the error log.*



Example of 1005 error with ancillaryId

2023-01-25 13:37:09,607 [bahemMessageContainer-1] WARN  com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.coreservice.BAHolidaysEventManagerServiceImpl [txId=tx-04-01-9d1b5879-0a37-4d2a-8305-62037e083cab|client=CAPTWO-sse-mhs|entryService=com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.mc.BAHolidaysEventManagerMessageConsumer|callingService=com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.mc.BAHolidaysEventManagerMessageConsumer] [] [TYPE+WARN|code=EVM_BAHEM_1005|desc=ERROR_NULL_XDIST_RESPONSE(PARSING_OJ_RESPONSE::CarOnlyOpenJawResponseParserxdist_resp|Generic Error while Parsing CO Elements from Openjaw Response for *ancillaryId: 58618*)|lineNo=0]

Example of 9009 error w/o ancillaryId

2023-01-25 13:37:05,317 [bahemMessageContainer-1] WARN  com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.coreservice.BAHolidaysEventManagerServiceImpl [txId=tx-04-01-3ac5deae-5966-43f0-8181-74dddabe94b3|client=CAPTWO-sse-mhs|entryService=com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.mc.BAHolidaysEventManagerMessageConsumer|callingService=com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.mc.BAHolidaysEventManagerMessageConsumer] [] [TYPE+WARN|code=EVM_BAHEM_9009|desc=SUPPLIER_UNKNOWN_ERROR(xdist_resp|366|SUPPLIER_UNKNOWN_ERROR)|lineNo=0]

*I would expect any error relating to either batch or burst processing for a specific ancillaryId or Ids to log the ancillaryIds in the error log.*

(One of the differences between these 2 errors is that for 1005,  availability has been returned but couldn’t be parsed. For the 9009, no availability has been returned. However in both situations we should know the affected ancillaryId and be able to log it.

These types of (availability) errors are being logged as Warnings. I assume that the live logging level will be set such that Warnings are not surpressed? If this isn’t the case we would need to log them as actual Errors.

----

Looking at the +Info file+, quite a lot of data is being logged here at INFO level (complete chunks of xml messages).

*It look like we are logging the ancillaryId for both EVM_BAHEM_9009 and EVM_BAHEM_1005 errors, so we should be able to do that in the error log as well.*

2023-01-25 13:37:05,322 [bahemMessageContainer-1] INFO  com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.coreservice.BAHolidaysEventManagerServiceImpl [txId=tx-04-01-3ac5deae-5966-43f0-8181-74dddabe94b3|client=CAPTWO-sse-mhs|entryService=com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.mc.BAHolidaysEventManagerMessageConsumer|callingService=com.ba.captwo.evm.bahem.mc.BAHolidaysEventManagerMessageConsumer] [] [TYPE+STAT|code=BATCH_CALL|BATCH_RETRY,ERRORID=EVM_BAHEM_9009,SEARCH REQUEST ID=10869,ANCILLARY ID=75758,ERRORCODE=EVM_BAHEM_9009,ERRORMESSAGE=xdist_resp|366|SUPPLIER_UNKNOWN_ERROR,SESSIONID=tx-04-01-3ac5deae-5966-43f0-8181-74dddabe94b3ES,PROPOSITION=FH,PRIORITY=1,FREQUENCY=16,ORIGIN=LON,DESTINATION=null,REQUEST=com.ba.schema.json.AncillarySearchRequestParams@5399afb6,,KEYDATA=ProductType=FH,MessagePair=FH,ArrivalDate=2023-12-18,CustomerType=CONSUMER,DepartureDate=2023-12-10,COD=CIT_AU_NS_Sydn,Channel=Online,POS=GB,NUMADULTS=2,NUMCHILDREN=0,CHILDAGE=[0],NUMINFANTS=0,SEARCH REQUEST CREATEDDATE=2023-01-20,AIRLINEBRAND=BA]

this file will definitely be useful in sublive to assist with development and testing but it will be too large in live as it is. Can we please confirm what level of logging is expected to be available in live? With the level of logging in this file likely to be supressed (or turned off) in live, it’s important that the data in the error log is sufficient on it’s own to allow support to investigate.

Thanks,

Jon

17/Aug/22 1:01 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;A few notes captured from a high level introduction of Kibana / CNG to Commercial analysis team:
 * Automation of queries is key for the CA team
 * As well as running the search, CA want to be able to extract the data and store in a specified server location
 * Can developer queries create additional fields (think Yes - seen refs to 'scripting fields' but further research reqd)
 * What mathematical capabilities do developer queries have?

Making a note in this Jira so they don't get forgotten. Haven't considered the first 2 of these points yet.

Jon
column1872:
27/Sep/22 3:34 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;I asked Karan Case for some more details of how the current Commercial analysis queries are run against the existing APC cache:
 * There are specific timeslots during the week when the various searches and extracts are run
 * Different destinations are run on different days
 * The destinations selected are chosen by Yield and can change over time

The following is an (out of date) example....
 * *Sunday*   8:30-9:15am ANU, BGI, CUN, MBJ, MLE, MRU, PUJ, SLU
 * *Monday*    8:30-10:30am MIA, SFO, LAX, BOS, LAS, ORL, NYC, SAN, YVR
 * *Tuesday*   8:30am-8:40am Beach - SKG,TCI,FNC,LCA,PFO,MLA,CFU, AYT,IBZ,CAG,OLB,HER,RHO,AGP,DLM,FAO,NAP,CTA, PMO,PMI,ACE,BJV,CHQ,LIS
 * *Wednesday*    8:30am-9am City - AMS,BUD,PRG,VIE,CPH,BCN,SVQ, RAK,ROM,MIL,STO,NCE,PAR,LIS,BER,MAD,VLC, VCE,FLR,PSA,REK
 * *Thursday*    8:30am-8:40am Beach LA - SKG,TCI,FNC,LCA,PFO,MLA,CFU, AYT,IBZ,CAG,OLB,HER,RHO,AGP,DLM,FAO,NAP,CTA, PMO,PMI,ACE,BJV,CHQ,LIS
 * *Friday & Saturday*   nothing

The days of the week in the schedule is aligned with when the Infare shop (retrieval of competitor data) is done - this allows for more accurate comparison.

Although there's a main version of the SQL query per proposition (FH, FC, HO - not CO), this query is essentially duplicated many times in the CA scripts with different WHERE clauses to extract the data for different destinations, dates (arrival day of the week) and durations. Eg:

!image-2022-09-27-15-31-31-195.png!

**** It sounds like the way that the scripts are run is not optimal and causes frustrations for the Commercial team. Maintaining the scripts is more fiddly because there's many versions. Ideally the script should be more dynamic and use variables for variable input criteria, with a config file (or similar) controlling the values passed in for each run. Given that the values can change over time, this is something that would need to be configurable by commercial users. We should consider this in the design solution.*

The schedule is setup and controlled on the bahsql1 server

The cache data is retrieved to the SQL server.

A macro is then used to bulk upload competitor data from Infare, matches are the identified (macro or manually?) and the matches are exported to Excel for analysis.

Jon

column1877:
23/Mar/23 10:34 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Further info for consideration from meeting with Scott, Nigel and Rosy earlier this week:

* The SQL server currently resides at Astral Towers - the results sets from CA queries will therefore have to be passed thru the Direct Connect pipe between the Cloud and Astral
* There is no test equivalent for the SQL server. Some initial POC work could be done on local PC installation but a solution need to be found for later POC stages which will include volume testing
* Agresso works on Windows server and has dev versions, so this is one possibility although these have large DB sizes (copied from live)
* *Talking to Steve Edgerton, he says that the ‘SQL server’ is actually running on VM ware rather than an actual SQL server instance. He says that BAH are limited by licensing to having just one SQL instance, but that the VW ware boxes are very powerful. He doesn’t think that the existing CA usage on this virtual server is that heavy and the limitation on performance is down the the size of the data pipe between Astral and Heathrow. It might therefore be possible to use the live instance for testing.*

Jon
column1878: 29/Mar/23 12:15 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Can’t assign to Rosy as she’s not available in JIRA. Jon
column1879: 06/Apr/23 9:03 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;The end date I’ve entered is a dummy one until implementation planning is clearer. It s for completion of all aspects of the work and not just the POC which should complete earlier. Jon
column1880:
06/Apr/23 10:49 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Latest updates from Rosy and weekly discussion:

* She’s had some problems with her local setup, so she’s using another developers setup
* The initial run of SQL from remote location hasn’t been completed yet, but it’s hoped to be done by end of next week (14th April)
* Then Rosy will engage Elasticsearch to confirm that their SQL mechanism should be able to support our expected query result sizes etc and if there’s anything else that we need to consider
* The proposed setup at the moment is having the Control M running the schedule (timings) and have this referring to configuration on the SQL server to lookup submission parameters eg destinations & durations etc. 
* This is more restrictive than today and it isn’t ideal if Commercial Analysis team need to change timings eg around sale periods. Requests would need to be raised to change the timings of the Control M schedule.
* To mitigate this scheduled runs could be setup throughout the day (run 1, run 2, run 3 ), but only actually triggered when reqd
* There are some mentions of ODBC for Elasticsearch and I would like this investigated (eg [https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/sql-odbc.html|https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/sql-odbc.html|smart-link] ) to see if other possibilities exist…even if this is only for ad-hoc queries it would be beneficial 

Jon

column1: (3844) - Querying cached data (Support Requirements)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.22|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

BAH DBS Support will need to analyse and troubleshoot when errors occur, therefore will need to query the data to identify where issues have been generated. Yield will also need to query the index -to compare prices with our competitors-

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* the ability to query all cached data *so that* analysis and troubleshooting is able to be applied

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Support Querying*

*Given* search results have been returned from xDist

*When* search results have been indexed

*Then* all information required to formulate search +requests+ are able to be queried

*And* all information required to formulate search +results+ are able to be queried

*And* failed searches are able to be queried

*And* Indexing failures are able to be queried

*And* Support can add to, amend and delete queries

 

-*AC.2 - Yield Competitor Analysis*-

-*Given* search results have been returned from xDist-

-*When* search results have been indexed-

-*Then* all new and existing data fields need to be accessible-

-*And* all queries to be available sub one minute-

-*And* all data fields are able to be downloadable-

    

*Key Info:*
 * -Yield produce a spreadsheet where BAH cached results are used to compare against competitors such as Virgin Holidays and Expedia.-
 * -Key data Competitor Analysis that is required to be retained from existing data is found on the attachment-
 * -Competitor Analysis spreadsheet attached illustrating cached data used to compare against competitors (retrieved from Infare)-
 * CAP Support & DBS Support have full access to the Index

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Iain Laird

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 # A separate requirement does not need to be applied for access levels for Developers, DBAs and DBS Support to access the index for queries

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies:*

column1867:
28/Jan/22 5:07 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;This requirement was originally a combination of Support and Competitor Analysis requirements. *All Competitor analysis reqs were moved out of this Jira into* https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-68. 

The requirements that are left are essentially that
 * all the data reqd is cached (should be covered anyway in indexing reqs)
 * all the cached data can be queried (Kibana query language should allow this, correct?)
 * Support staff know how to query this data (think we need to plan in some training / familiarisation here)
 * Some Commercial users may also want to run adhoc queries (aside from Competitor analysis)
 * I'm not sure how 'failed searches' and 'Indexing failures' are able to be queried. Maybe they would  just appear in reporting instead. 

I think that BAH staff will need training / familiarisation in Kibana query language and for go live we should have a body of translated queries that are likely to be used regularly. With those staff should be able to write their own queries going forward.

Jon

column1: (3844) - Business Continuity (Burst / Schedule / xDist / Indexing)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.29|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

If any part of the scheduling, indexing or capturing of search results were to fail then prices will still need to be produced for the consumers

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to still be outputting prices and information even when system failure occurs *so that* there are no blank prices or errors in offers to customers

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Bursting tool is unavailable*

*Given* the Searching tool is available

*And* the User has committed search requests

*When* the bursting tool is unavailable

*Then* pre-committed search requests are able to be indexed with updated prices

 

*AC.2 - Schedule, Search / Indexing failures*

*Given* priced availability has previously been indexed

*When* schedule, search or indexing fail

*Then* any errored searches are not be indexed i.e. no blank prices or errors/NA

*And* cached prices from previous searches are to be retained

*And* any searches not impacted by errors to show updated prices

    

*Key Info:*
 * This covers: Schedule, Xdist, Indexing failures
 * In the event of prices not being able to refresh or errors are occurring due to technical failure, BAH would rather a price is presented and the customer sees a price jump rather than not producing a price at all or showing as 'NA' or 'Error'

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*
 * Prices are backed up and that backed up prices can be restored and used

 

*Assumptions:*
 * If the system was unable to search or there is a technical failure with the index, that existing prices or backed up prices are still able to be queried

 

*Queries:*

 

 

*Dependencies:* 
 * Prices are backed up frequently and able to be restored or retained

column1: (3844) - New data - Deposits
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.30|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Caching deposits will allow for future exploitation and help promote offers where the deposit can be advertised

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to be able to cache all deposit amounts for packages *so that* deposit amounts can be promoted as part of lead in prices

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Available deposit amounts*

*Given* package search request has been generated

*When* priced availability has been searched and indexed

*Then* deposit amounts to be cached for all packages

*And* deposit currency to be cached

 

*AC.2 - No Deposit available*

*Given* package search request has been generated

*When* priced availability has been searched and indexed with no deposit available

*Then* no deposit information is indexed

*And* deposit information is not available to consumers

 

*AC.3 - Refreshed Searches*

*Given* package Search request has been re-burst and scheduled

*When* priced availability has been searched and indexed

*And* deposit is no longer available

*Then* no deposit information is indexed

*And* deposit information is not available to consumers 

   

*Key Info:*
 * Deposits are only used for DP and not GO
 * Deposit information is not presented when the Package needs to be fully paid. At present full payment is required within 5 weeks, so no deposit value is displayed. This time period may change depending on business requirements.
 * Deposits example on attached is taken from Package pricing response

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 * Package response will be associated with xDist table PACK/Deposit_config to work out when deposit rules

 

*Queries:*
 # From analysis of the Package Response, Deposits are not available on the Package search response or Hotel/Car availability, is this correct? - Shyam / Shankaran to verify (See attached - Package Response and GO Availability analysis for findings)
 # If 1. is the case, can deposits information be pulled through from anywhere else or would it require a separate OJ change i.e. a Change request?

 

*Dependencies:*

column1: (3844) - New data - Images
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.11|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS] 

*Background:*

BAH want images to be consistent across BA.com and Iberia.com, whilst showing the best quality image and customer experience

*Requirement:*

*I want* to be able cache exactly one size image (the particular image size detailed in Acceptance Criteria) and image data *so that* consistent image quality and data is available to consumers

*Acceptance criteria:*

*AC.1 - Caching Images*

*Given* package Search request has been generated

*When* priced availability has been searched and indexed

*Then* medium sized image URLs are to be cached for FH and HO (approx. 880px)

*And* thumbnail sized image URLs are to be cached for FC and CO for Avis and Budget (approx. 135px) +*(*see key info 4*)*+

*And* any image captions available with images are to be cached

*And* where images are not available, cache default 'no image available' image

*And* image order to mirror DP

*And* all image alt tags are to be cached for English language only

*Key Info:*

# Medium sized image URLs are to be cached based on information available in the cap wiki - [http://cap-wiki.uk.ba.com/twiki/bin/view/DynamicPackaging/DPExternalImages|http://cap-wiki.uk.ba.com/twiki/bin/view/DynamicPackaging/DPExternalImages]
# Jira [BAWM-31304] was created in 2017, to remove original images from the Apache server
# Medium images for Hotel based on max 880px 
# When the original requirements of CNG were written, it was expected another BAH project (RDP) was going to update the OJ search responses to include a bigger Car image. Therefore [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-216|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-216|smart-link] was raised to cache the bigger image when available and only cache the thumbnail as a fall-back - it is believed this functionality has been delivered by CNG. Due to the cancelling of the RDP project, the OJ search response was not updated to include the larger image. Therefore CNG will only ever cache the thumbnail until the OJ search response is updated.

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* Sarah Boyett
* Katy Flood

*Assumptions:*

# Alt tags are only available in English, if and when other languages for Alt tags are available that these will be available in the cache
# All images are the best available quality
# Larger Car images will be cached if/when the OJ search response is updated to return them as per [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-216|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-216|smart-link]

column1863:
07/Apr/22 2:05 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Looking at the current OJ handling of hotel images in the availability response, there may be some problems that may affect what CNG caches. I've asked OJ if the following bits in red are the expected behaviour:

+FH Images (RDP)+
 * After responsive, the <MultimediaObject> tags are used by the front end to display images
 * Expected alt tag format from CMS is 'Accommodation - Hotel Name - Picture Category Code - Location' eg *Accommodation - DoubleTree by Hilton New York Times Square West - Bar/Lounge - New York*
 * I am seeing alt tags of the expected form only for images with ContentCode = '4'    *[ContentCode describes the size of image]*
 * {color:#de350b}No alt tags are present for ContentCode = 11,13 or 14      *[This means that there are no alt tags present for the version of the images (ContentCode = '14') that CNG will cache for FH]*{color}
 * On search results screen the ContentCode = '4' version of the image is used and therefore the alt tag appears correctly in the page source

 
+HO Images in live (non RDP)+
 * No <MultimediaObject> tags are present in live because RDP hasn't gone live...we are still using image data from <VendorMessage> section
 * {color:#de350b}These do not contain alt text of the expected form. {color}
 * {color:#de350b}The alt tags are either blank or appear to contain just the caption text when that is present    *[This means that prior to RDP, the majority of HO images in CNG will have no alt tags]*{color}

eg
   <VendorMessage InfoType="1">                        <SubSection SubTitle="HotelImage">
                            <Paragraph ContentData="local" CreatorID="6">
 *<Image AltTag="">*US-G14-5007123/tn_61_US-G14-5007123-B2002.jpeg</Image>
                                <URL>/badp/static/external/US-G14-5007123/tn_61_US-G14-5007123-B2002.jpeg</URL>
                                <Text Language=""/>                            </Paragraph>
                       <VendorMessage InfoType="1">                        <SubSection SubTitle="HotelImage">
                            <Paragraph ContentData="local" CreatorID="6" SupplierCode="XHOTEL">
*<Image AltTag="Guest room">*US-NYC-3075000/tn_616_US-NYC-3075000-P63636196212.jpeg</Image>
                                <URL>/badp/static/external/US-NYC-3075000/tn_616_US-NYC-3075000-P63636196212.jpeg</URL>                                <Text Language="en">Guest room</Text>
 * {color:#de350b}Looking at the html page source for the images, an alt tag of the correct format is displayed - this is being created by a front end stylesheet (because it's not in the response), presumably if the alt tag is missing{color}

 
+HO Images in RDP environment+
 * As per FH with RDP
 * {color:#de350b}No alt tags are present for ContentCode = 11,13 or 14    {color}
 * {color:#de350b}*[After RDP is applied to HO, this would mean that no alt tags exist for the version of the hotel images that CNG will cache]* {color}

 

{color:#172b4d}I've asked OJ to confirm if this is the behaviour they would expect or if it's a bug in their code.{color}

{color:#172b4d}Jon{color}

01/Jul/22 12:07 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;All,

It's worth highlighting that the requirement here differs from the current APC logic, in that Commercial want to store image information for +each image+ returned in the response and not just the first one. (only 1 size for each image).

So that means storing multiple image urls, alt tags and captions. Knock-on implications for the APIs would be:
 * extracting only 1 image (the first) to be sent out for b/w API
 * capability to send all images out in full API

column1: (3844) - New data - Special offers
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

* [ER.9|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

To further promote hotels and cars on tools such as SFD and Holiday finder, BAH want to cache hotel and car special offers to illustrate what is included in the price.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to be able index all hotel and car special offers *so that* products and prices can be further promoted

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Special offers*

*Given* Search requests are burst and scheduled

*When* priced availability has been searched and indexed

*Then* any available special offers headers to be cached

*And* any available special offers description associated with headers to be cached

*And* any available promotional red text to be cached

*And* the order in which they would have been shown to customers to be cached

  

*AC.2 - No Special offers returned*

*Given* Search requests are burst and scheduled

*And* no special offers available

*When* priced availability has been searched and indexed

*Then* no special offers information is indexed

*And* Special offers information is not available to consumers

 

*Key Info:*

* Room selection special offers would require a separate call and is out of scope for this phase
* Special offers headers and descriptions to be linked so the consumer does not have to manual match the two
* See attached special offers shown on the search results page, the different types of Special offer and where and how special offers are created
* Internal reference codes are added at the end of special offers to make hotels aware of what special offers have been applied. In January 2018, a Change request was implemented to mask the Internal reference code on the front end so that only the special offer was to be shown. BAH Commercial have confirmed that CNG does not need similar logic (see - [https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-55?focusedCommentId=1871958|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-55?focusedCommentId=1871958|smart-link] ) 
* Any duplicate special offers do not need to be removed ([https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-55?focusedCommentId=1871096|https://iagtech.atlassian.net/browse/CNG-55?focusedCommentId=1871096|smart-link] )

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*

* Martin Brine
* Sarah Boyett
* Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*



The following document outlines issues with the initial data mapping and handling of special offers.

[https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc={C99BB234-4270-4B84-8518-AD1A841FBDFA}&file=Special Offers Problems - Jira version.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/BAHProjects/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BC99BB234-4270-4B84-8518-AD1A841FBDFA%7D&file=Special%20Offers%20Problems%20-%20Jira%20version.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]



*Promotional red text:*

* Generated by BRE rules - > xDist / Business Rules / Promotions
*  Eg Add cat 1 red mark text to room: This renders the offer as a line of red text on search results and compare page
* cat 2 remarks can also be displayed

column1872:
25/Feb/22 10:09 AM;62e3f1910b4bf7ad924bb236;Hi Jon,

I have analyzed the current batch controller implementation code. The <Special> tag is applicable for FH and HO and <Remarks> tag is applicable for FC and CO. We map specialOfferHeader1Desc for FH and HO and SpecialOfferHeader & SpecialOfferHeader1Desc for FC and CO. Below is the logic followed in the the code.

 

*Flight+Hotel*

1) Iterate all the RatePlans in Roomstay matching the associated rateplancode from RoomRate
2) Iterate the Special->Discount and take the discount description text matching 'en' language code filtering the internal supplier code text
3) Construct the all values as list and map into *specialOfferHeader1Desc* which will be indexed into cache

*Hotel Only*
1) For all matching distributiion system company code =XHOTEL in Roomstay->BasicPropertyInfo, Iterate all the RatePlans in Roomstay matching the associated rateplancode from RoomRate
2) Iterate the Special->Discount and take the discount description text matching 'en' language code filtering the internal supplier code
3) Construct the all values as list and map into *specialOfferHeader1Desc* which will be indexed into cache

*Flight + Car*
1) Iterate the <VehicleAvail> list in packages and iterate through <Remarks> List
2) Check if both Remark Text name and text value is present .
If Yes map the SpecialOfferHeader from Remark's Text Name and map SpecialOfferHeader1Desc from Remarks Text Value
3) Map the SpecialOfferHeader and SpecialOfferHeader1Desc into cache


*Car Only*
1) Iterate through VehAvail list and iterate through the Remarks Loist
2) Check if both Remark Text name and remarks text value is present .
If Yes map the SpecialOfferHeader from Remark's Text Name and map SpecialOfferHeader1Desc from Remarks Text Value
3) Map the SpecialOfferHeader and SpecialOfferHeader1Desc into cache

-Suresh
