column1882:
04/May/23 11:20 AM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;As per the discussion with Martin, Sarah, Anna and Katy today:

* promotional red text needs to be treated separately from other special offers because these only have 1 piece of data rather than 2 (header and description).
* ordering of special offers on the front end prioritises BRE special offer rules (data in Packages/Remarks) section above those appearing in RoomRates/Discounts, which is a bit odd - but CNG would need to match this.
* BRE rules appear first in their relative priority order and then those in Discounts in their relative priority order
* It looks like in a many / most instances, special offers only come through in one section, Remarks or Discounts. (Sale time may be an exception to this where additional BRE rules could be setup). I needed to manually setup rules to trigger this condition.
* special offer ordering needs to be preserved in CNG and clear to end point users of cached data, so they know what they are extracting

We also agreed that we could drop the following requirements to simplify the logic:

* *Not storing duplicate special offers* - this is a problem with source data setup and not CNG. It should be resolved at source
* Adding additional logic to supress *Internal supplier code information*. Commercial will look at the number of instances of this and see if a Commercial process can be / is required to achieve the same end result in a different manner. 

I will discuss this with the rest of the CNG project team

Thanks,

Jon

column1: (3844) - Real time indexing
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.3|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

APC is populated with cache data and data is imported to SOLR. The import process takes approximately 6-7 hours. Cache Next Gen aims to implement near real time indexing

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* cache prices to be available to consumers in near real time *so that* lead in prices are available faster and more up to date

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Near Real time indexing*

*Given* Search requests are burst and scheduled

*When* priced availability has been returned

*Then* prices are to be indexed in near real time

*And* near real time to be maximum of 10 minutes 

 

-*AC.2 - Backing up the Index*-  *(moved to https://jira.baplc.com/browse/CNG-373)*

-*Given* Search requests are being burst and scheduled-

-*When* search has been indexed-

-*Then* Indexed prices are to be backed up-

-*And* backed up Indexed prices can be restored automatically upon failure-

 

*Key Info:*
 * NRT timescales can be agreed if technically not feasible.
 * NRT is based on search results retrieved from xDist to being available to the consumer

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

 

*Assumptions:*

 

 

*Queries:*
 # During the study, NH mentioned that NRT would possibly take around 10-15 mins due to the use of 'Akamai'. Will this still be the case or has a more efficient alternative been found to increase the indexing speeds?

 

*Dependencies:*
column1159: Hi Shankaran, I'll put this one into UAT so that we can monitor how fast the real time indexing is.

column1: (3844) - Schedule
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.4|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Where Priority and scheduled execution has been applied, BAH will want to determine the order in which items are to be scheduled to ensure important items are searched and indexed first

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to be able to order the schedule in which search requests are sent to xDistributor *so that* cache prices are obtained to higher priority search requests sooner

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Schedule*

*Given* Search Requests will be committed and burst in to individual searches

*When* Search requests have been scheduled

*Then* the Schedule is to start at midnight

*And* the searches are to be ordered by Priority applied to the Search Request

*And* the sub priority to be based on proposition

*And* all ancillary IDs associated with the Search request ID to be run together

*And* the reoccurrence of the searches are subject to Frequency applied to the Search Request

*And* searches are subject to Schedule execution date and/or time if applicable (See CNG-20)

 

*AC.2 - Schedule runs past 24 hours*

*Given* all committed search requests have been burst and scheduled

*When* the Schedule has not completed by midnight the following day

*Then* the Schedule is to continue to run until complete

*And* once the previous days schedule is complete, the next day’s schedule is to start immediately after

 

*AC.3 - Stop / Restart the Schedule same day*

*Given* DBS Support staff may have to deal with performance or pricing issues

*When* DBS Support staff have requested to stop the schedule

*Then* BA Support team can stop the schedule

*And* BA Support team can restart the schedule from previous stop

*Or* BA Support can completely stop the schedule for that day e.g. Schedule is no longer run for that day and the next days schedule starts again at midnight

 

*Key Info:*
 * If Schedule runs in to following day, measures will be taken at BAH to reduce the schedule and frequencies going forward to ensure schedule does not overrun for a number of days
 * Currently, when performance issues or pricing issues occur, DBS support make a request to CAP Support to stop the schedule.
 * Planned outage is likely to be for a short period of time, controlled and agreed with CAP Support
 * Unplanned outage is not controlled and the service level agreements will need to be re-assessed and agreed
 * BAH would not want to restart the schedule and any impacted search requests i.e. P1s, will look to be re-run through the immediate run
 * Stopping the days schedule will prevent schedule running over to the following day if outages have occurred

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*
 * NH/Shyam - Technical recommendation is to use Load balancing to optimise xDist
 * BAH would like to use propositions as sub-priorities once search requests have been prioritised by numbers e.g. P1, FH then P1, FC

Sub priority order of: 1 - Flight and Hotel 2 - Flight and Car 3 - Hotel only 4 - Car only

 

*Assumptions:*
 # Due to the Load balancer being used, Sub priority would be obsolete, therefore not worth applying as a Requirement.
 # If Load balancer was not used then BAH would not optimise xDist, therefore would run in to completing the schedule in a day

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies:*

column1: (3844) - Index Capacity Increase
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.2|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Currently the Business produce around 300-350k searches a day of cache data to accommodate lead in prices on tools such as Holiday Finder and SFD. To meet business needs, it has been identified that capacity would need to be scalable

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* search results to be indexed without any capacity restrictions *so that* any future increase of the cache capacity is accommodated

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Capacity is scalable*

*Given* the increased volume of Search requests are split in to independent searches

*When* search results have been returned and indexed

*Then* there are no capacity restrictions for the index

 

*Key Info:*
 * Potential to scale to at least 3 times for go live of Phase 1
 * Expected to process around 1 million searches per day

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*
 * Hardware will always accommodate any future changes to the cache process

 

*Queries:*

If so is there a design or Dev doc on how this will work and more importantly ( from my point of view) how are we going to test it? I presume a huge bulk upload but creating that won't be easy I would have thought.
column1861:
19/Jul/22 12:19 PM;5ff613f64d2179006ebdc358;Hi Tony,

No specific design doc is reqd for this requirement...the entire overall design and implementation of Elastic search is what delivers this requirement.

I see the testing of this to be primarily technical load testing rather than UAT but I don't see it being particularly hard. Using the bulk upload function makes sense. You don't need a huge number of locations, you can use a set of locations and get the numbers up by re-using them with different paxmix and travel lengths to get the numbers up. 

Eg FH 1 rolling search, for 1 duration with lead time 1-355....should result in 355 searches. Do the same destination search for 10 different duration lengths for 5 different paxmix and you get 355*10*5 = 17,750. And you could create that all in excel quickly for 1 basic search.

I think we can discuss the details of this later on but I don't think it's something to worry about.

Jon

column1: (3844) - Logging Burst errors
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.28|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

When search requests have been committed, they will be separated in to individual searches via a burst process. If searches fail to burst, all burst errors will need to be logged and easily identified

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all burst failures to be logged *so that* all burst failures are able to be identified easily

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Populating Error log*

*Given* search requests are burst in to individual searches

*When* individual searches fail to burst

*Then* all burst failures are logged 

*And* -Each error to provide the following info:-
 -_TLOGGED, ERROR ID, SEARCHING TOOL NAME, SEARCH REQUEST ID,  ANCILLARY ID,  SESSIONID, ERROR CODE, ERROR DESCRIPTION , SERVERNAME, SUPPLIER, PROPOSITION, PRIORITY, FREQUENCY, ORIGIN, DESTINATION, REQUEST, RESPONSE, KEYDATA, NUMADULTS, NUMCHILDREN, CHILDAGE, NUMINFANTS, SEARCH REQUEST CREATEDDATE, AIRLINEBRAND_-

And there is sufficient context information for BAH Support to identify what has happened (details to be agreed later)

*Key Info:*

Please note that CNG-47 is an alternative to CNG-46, with the preferred option being CNG-47. The 'must' is to be able to log specified errors an error log. Currently, errors are logged to the DP error log. Ideally, to futureproof for the increase in volumes, all cache errors will be logged to an independent error log.

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Caroline Easton
 * Iain Laird

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:* 
 # All cache errors are able to be logged if BAH are unable to use an independent cache error log

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies*
 #  This is only to be used if an Independent cache error log is unable to be used

column1: (3844) - Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery (Searching only)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.27|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

As a number of consumers depend on the cache data processed, it is important we continue to provide prices as close to updated as possible. If any part of the system goes down, there needs to be a way of obtaining prices using search requests

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to ensure that if the searching tool is unavailable that all search requests are still able to be burst *so that* updated prices and information can still be cached irrespective of searching tool availability

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Searching tool is unavailable*

*Given* the User has previously applied search criteria to the the Searching tool

*And* the Searching tool is now unavailable

*When* Consumers need to obtain prices and associated information from committed search requests

*Then* Committed search requests are able to be burst

 

*Key Info:*

 ** 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

BAH have previously used a backed up version of prices. BAH happy with any recommendations from DBA

 

*Assumptions:* 
 # If the Bursting tool was to become unavailable but the Searching tool was available that any new or amended search requests are able to be applied

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies:*

column1: (3844) - Migrating Existing Search requests
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.1|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Currently there is a Searching tool used that has existing search requests that is used for searches. To ensure search requests do not have to be re-entered, the search requests from the existing tool will need to be moved on to the new solution

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all Search requests that are scheduled or to be scheduled on the current searching tool to be migrated to the new Searching tool *so that* no existing data and search requests are lost preventing all information to be re-entered

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Migrating existing Search Requests*

*Given* there are existing Search requests on the current the Searching tool (DMT)

*When* the new searching tool is available to accept new search requests

*Then* all Search requests from the current searching tool are to be migrated to the new Searching tool

*And* there is no loss of indexed prices and data generated by those Search requests at any time

 

 

*Key Info:*
 * To be part of the Implementation plan

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

To accommodate the new validation rules and new fields, current search requests can be exported on to the new bulk upload spreadsheet, where the validation rules will be mirrored with the Repository and new fields are populated. All search requests are uploaded with the new fields and validation and placed in to Review status. The Manager can do a one off sense check of the search requests and select all in review status to be committed.

Nigel Hassett has said that the current DMT and CNG may need to run in parallel.

 

*Assumptions:* 
 # BAH are unable to test this requirement in sublive
 # BAH will need apply some housekeeping to the current DMT search requests to remove redundant search requests prior to migrating

 

*Queries:*
 #  Do BAH need to identify which search requests are necessary to keep in advance?
 # Once current search requests are migrated, will they be validated against the new validation rules

 

*Dependencies*
 * Search requests from the old DMT are identified as current
 * Once migrated, the new fields are populated on the Search requests and re-validated against the new validation rules

column1: (3844) - Expired Search Requests
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.1|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Search requests can expire when they are no longer run due to specified dates being met. BAH want expired search requests and all associated information to be removed after next scheduled run

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all search requests where the end execution or travel date has expired to be removed *so that* expired search requests are no longer able to be viewed with active search requests

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Reviewing existing Search Requests*

*Given* the User has previously set departure dates or end execution date to a Search request

*When* Search request departure dates or end execution date have expired

*Then* Expired Search request is no longer available to be viewed on the Search request Repository

*And* any pricing from expired search requests to be removed 48 hours from when last indexed

  

*Key Info:*

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:* 

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies*

column1: (3844) - Audit log (Housekeeping task)
column45:
*Epic requirement:*

N/A

 

*Background:*

As many users will be using the Searching tool and many changes can occur, BAH would want to audit which users have made changes and when

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* all changes made by users on the Search Request repository to be logged *so that* a Manager or DBS Support can audit what changes have been made and when

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Logging activity to the Audit log*

*Given* the User has accessed the Search request Repository

*Or* Uploaded the spreadsheet with commands via the bulk upload

*When* the User has committed a new search request or multiple search request/s

*Or* amended and committed previously committed search request/s

*Or* deleted single or multiple committed search request/s

*Then* the activity that has taken place is logged to the Audit log

*And* the following detail is to be applied to the log:
 * Search request ID/s
 * Reason for change 
 ** New Search request added
 ** Amendment
 ** Deleted
 * Original entry e.g 2a
 * New Entry e.g. 3a
 * Modified by
 * Modified (date/time)

*And* any activity is able to be searched

*And* activity can be filtered by any of the details

*And* the User is able to download a local copy of the report any filtered view of the Audit log

*And* details to be stored in the Audit log for 3 months

 

-*AC.2 - Logging activity to the Audit log via Bulk upload*-

-*Given* the User has applied search request commands to the bulk upload function-

-*When* the User has uploaded add, amend and/or delete commands via the bulk upload-

-*Then* the activity that has taken place is logged to the Audit log-

-*And* the uploaded spreadsheet is stored in the Audit log-

-*And* the following detail is applied to the log:-
 * -Success total with breakdown-
 * -Fail total with breakdown-
 * -Modified by-
 * -Modified (date/time)-

-*And* any activity is able to be searched-

-*And* activity can be filtered by any of the details-

-*And* the User is able to download a local copy of the report any filtered view of the Audit log-

-*And* details to be stored in the Audit log for 3 months-

 

*Key Info:*
 * AC.1 includes if search requests have been added, amended and/or deleted via the Bulk upload

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*
 * Available under a Menu dropdown to make the screen less busy

 

*Assumptions:*

column1: (3844) - Deleting Search Requests
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.1|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]
 * ER.26

 

*Background:*

BAH will need to remove any redundant search requests that are no longer required. When BAH do remove any redundant search requests, all associated data will need to be removed as well.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* the ability to delete single or multiple search requests along with any associated or orphaned data *so that* all redundant data is removed

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Deleting Search Requests*

*Given* the User has accessed the Searching tool

*When* the User wants to delete single or multiple existing search requests

*Then* the User is able to select single or multiple search request/s to delete

*And* the warning message is presented allowing the User to accept or decline the deletions

*And* accepting the deletions removes those search requests from the Repository

*And* declining the deletions means the Search requests remain as they were

*And* once deleted, any associated or orphaned data is to be removed immediately

*And* any pre-generated bursts are to be deleted

*And* deleted Search requests are no longer available on the Repository

*And* any pricing from deleted search requests to be removed 48 hours from when last indexed

 

*Key Info:*
 * e.g In the current world, If DMT id (Parent) is removed, no longer require Search Config ID (Child) or Ancillary ID (Grandchild)

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

See attached wireframe as requested by TCS. Note, there is no requirement for the search repository to be built exactly in line with this. {color:#d04437}The design should provide the most optimal user experience in line with the requirements, not the wireframe.{color}

 

*Assumptions:* 

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies*

column1: (3844) - Amend Search Requests
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.1|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Currently if BAH were to make any changes to committed search requests, they would need to create a new search request and delete the old search request. BAH want the ability to amend individual search requests, which once approved will be burst instead of the original.

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* the ability to amend existing search requests *so that* certain search criteria can be tailored without the need to delete and replace

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Amending new Search Requests*

*Given* the User has a search request in draft status

*When* the User wants to amend any single or multiple search requests i.e. not previously committed

*Then* the User is able to click on an Edit button, which allows the user to amend the search request

*And* the search request is locked to the user

*And* any fields can be amended except ID's

*And* the User is able to mark the Search request as 'Review'

 

*AC.2 - Amending new Search Requests previously set to Review*

*Given* the Basic User has set a Search request to 'Review'

*When* the Basic User wants to amend any single or multiple search requests that have been marked as 'Review'

*Then* the Basic User is unable to make any amendments until the Manager has accepted, amended or declined

 

*AC.3 - Manager amending whilst reviewing Search Requests*

*Given* Search Requests have been marked as 'Review'

*When* the Manager opts to amend Search request/s that has been marked as 'Review'

*Then* the Manager is able to select single or multiple search request/s to amend

*And* any fields can be amended except ID's

*And* Status remains as 'Review' until the Manager has made a decision

*And* any amended field/s made by the Manager is highlighted until the Manager has Accepted (Re-committed) or declined

*And* if applicable, any pricing indexed prior to amendment to be removed after 48 hours

 

*AC.4 - Amending previously committed Search Requests*

*Given* the User has a search request that has been committed

*When* the User wants to amend single or multiple search requests with committed status

*Then* the User must click on Amend against each search request, which in turn locks the search request to the user and changes the status to draft

*And* any fields can be amended except ID's

*And* once the User has marked as 'Review', following amendments, any amended field/s are highlighted until Accepted (Re-committed) or declined

*And* Status remains as 'Review' until the Manager has made a decision

*And* original search request continues to burst until amendments have been accepted or declined

*And* any pricing indexed created by original search request (prior to amendment) to be removed after 48 hours 

 

 *Key Info:*
 * If the Search request is marked 'Review', Managers are able to make amendments without impacting the status
 * if the Search request is not marked 'Review', the status changes to Draft and any user can amend
 * This requirement is for manual adding and amending i.e. not bulk uploading

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*
 * Amend is available as a button that allows a User to make amendments to the Search request
 * Amend locks the Search request and is then unavailable to other users (CNG-29)
 * 'Save Search request' (CNG-27) validates and unlocks, allowing users to use
 * See attached wireframe as requested by TCS. Note, there is no requirement for the search repository to be built exactly in line with this. {color:#d04437}The design should provide the most optimal user experience in line with the requirements, not the wireframe.{color}

 

*Assumptions:* 

 

*Queries:*

 

*Dependencies*

column1: (3844) - Capacity Increase - Searching Tool
column45:
*Epic requirement:*
 * [ER.2|https://baplc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/BAHProjects/(3844b)%20%20Cache%20%20Next%20Gen2/Requirements%20Analysis%20and%20Design/20180215%203844b%20Cache%20Next%20Gen%20PRL%20%20v1.2%20(SF).xlsx?d=w0d3c2f04eae34601817bb33295c20dc9&csf=1&e=VCErDS]

 

*Background:*

Currently the Business produce around 300-350k searches a day of cache data to accommodate lead in prices on tools such as Holiday Finder and SFD. To meet business needs, it has been identified that capacity would need to be scalable

 

*Requirement:*

*I want* to add search request without any capacity restrictions *so that* any future increase to cache capacity can be accommodated

 

*Acceptance criteria:*

 

*AC.1 - Capacity is scalable*

*Given* a Searching tool is available to capture search requests

*When* there is an increase in volume of Search requests

*Then* there are no capacity restrictions to the limit of searches undertaken

 

*Key Info:*
 * Phase 1 is to scale to at least 3 times
 * Searching tool is the term for the new DMT, 'DMT' will be used to refer to the current DMT tool

 

 

*Key Stakeholder/s:*
 * Martin Brine
 * Sarah Boyett
 * Katy Flood

 

*Design considerations:*

 

*Assumptions:*

 

*Queries:*

2.1 - Can we apply more hardware to accommodate future changes without formal Releases?

 

*Dependencies:*
